story:
Help pay for the editing, distribution, and cover art of a completed comedy e-novel featuring a strong, funny Australian Indigenous heroine.

See the book extracts below!

Background

Hi, my name's Jessica Getty. I'm a New Zealander and work as a Web Analyst in Sydney, Australia.

When I first came to Australia I was very impressed with the engaging Aboriginal sense of humour which is very cheeky, much like the Maori sense of humour.

I had already written a full length crime novel with a Maori detective as the lead character for which I won a place in a group editing session at the Varuna Writers' Centre in the Blue Mountains. However, I wasn't happy with the novel because it was supposed to be dark but it was turning into a comedy! So I put it in the bottom drawer.

After a few months off I decided to play to my strengths - I wanted to introduce a strong Aboriginal character and write a comedy novel that smacked of the irreverent Bush Mechanics humour seen in the TV series. (Google it if you don't know it). I also wanted to make it a rollicking adventure - a sort of sci-fi Famous Five In Sydney crossed with a Ben Elton type comedy crossed with a Marion Keyes romance!

I wasn't sure how it would go down - a white person writing pretty politically incorrect humour with my Black heroine, Tuesday, perhaps the first Black female heroine in a comedy novel in Australia! However, everyone who reads it says they have laughed out loud and that they love the female lead character.

What your help will be used for

The novel is completed. The market is young adults/adults. It's called Tuesday, You're Terrific and it's my second unpublished novel. (The first and third novels are sitting on my desk for future re-writing). Any funds are appreciated and will be spent as follows:

1. Fact checking by an experienced Aboriginal author and editor through the Sydney Writers' Centre.

2. One professional illustration through 99 designs for use on the cover or inside the book from a professional illustrator or graphic designer.

3. Lastly, if any money is left over it will go towards a Mac Mini so I can access iAuthor to produce the ebook. This will allow me to easily produce the novel and distribute it for iPad. It will also allow me to more easily decide whether I can/should include graphics and illustrations like the old Famous Five books used to have.

Your Perks

Share this campaign via social media - My gratitude!

$1 - My gratitude!

$2 - A copy of the finished ebook. The ebook is also given to all funds given above this amount.

$5 - Your right to vote on which fake book review should appear on an inside cover page of the novel

$10 - Your right to vote on which deep and meaningful quote should appear on an inside cover page of the novel

$15 - Your right to vote on which name submitted by a supporter will be the name of a 'goodie' within the book.

$20 - Your right to vote on which name submitted by a supporter will be the name of a 'baddie' within the book.

$25 - Your right to submit a fake book review for an inside cover page of the novel. All book reviews will be submitted to those who donated $5 for selection as the best and up to 5 fake reviews will be chosen.

$30 - Your right to submit a deep and meaningful (ie. funny) quote for an inside cover page of the novel. All quotes will be submitted to those who donated $10 for selection as the best and up to two quotes will be chosen.

$35 - Your right to submit your name as a 'goodie' character name in the book. All names will be submitted to those who donated $15 for selection as the one best name.

$40 - Your right to submit your name as a 'baddie' character name in the book. All names will be submitted to those who donated $20 for selection as the one best name.

$65 - The publication of your Australian Indigenous Charity's name and website as being supporters on the back cover of the novel.

$75 - The publication of your company's name and website as being supporters on the back cover of the novel.

All helpers who fund me $2 and above will recieve a copy of the ebook for iPad if the campaign is fully funded. If not fully funded, the unedited PDF will be available instead.

Why help?

There is a lack of funny, cheeky Aboriginal role models in Australian literature. Help change this! Have a read of the excerpts below and if you think it's worth funding, fund me!
 

Book Excerpts

Chapter Eight Excerpt

“Help! Help! Get us out of here!”

Mr Scottie MacLaren, whose fork had been halfway to his mouth with tendrils of haggis dangling from his prongs when Bill and Audrey had crashed into his family’s dining room, hesitated. He was in the middle of an important speech to little Errol about the sanctity of the five o’clock family dinner time. “…and one does not  get up from the table just because a car has crashed through the window and come to a stop under our dinner table!” He waggled his juice streaked thumb at little Errol and bunched his great shaggy eyebrows together. “I don’t care if it has rolled to a stop over your foot. Understand?”

Errol’s little white face nodded solemnly. The glass of milk in his clenched fingers sloshed around above the puttering car engine. 

“Please pass the potatoes, dear.” Scottie asked his wife.

Maggie MacLaren picked her spuds up from the bumper and the windscreen and the bonnet and slid off the one impaled on the Porsche’s antenna and placed them back in the shattered china bowl on the desecrated dining table.

“How was your day love?” She asked her husband, picking up a brussel sprout from the side view mirror next to Audrey’s lolling head.

“Aye, it was rotten. Debt collection in the middle of a State Emergency’s a real bugger.”

“Daddy,” interrupted his son.

“Errol,” Scottie MacLaren said calmly, “what have I told you about speaking out of turn?”

“That it’s ill bred. That it’s the sign of common muck. That it’s the kind of behaviour we could expect from pond scum like Englishmen.”

“Very good.”

“But Daddy…”

His mother sucked in her breath and Scottie MacLaren’s eyebrows knotted together until they were actually knotted (it was one of his wife’s duties to pick them apart at the end of the night). His chin trembled. “What?” He shouted. “What is soooooooo important, you have to interrupt your dear auld Dadde?” He struck a match and lit his pipe, waving the match in the air in front of him.

“I can hear somebody screaming from the boot.”

“Is anybody there?” Shouted Tom. “I’m about to…suffocate!”

This is where Scottie MacLaren hesitated. “Goddammit, we’re no gunna git annae rest!” He thumped his fist on the table which was sitting on the roof of the car.  He leant down and pulled Audrey out of the broken passenger window, dragging her body over the shattered windscreen glass.

“Watch where yer bleed!” He yelled to Audrey’s comatose head, dropping her on the green patterned carpet. “Come on, woman, give me a hand wi’ the other.”

Maggie and Scottie had to break open the driver’s door with Maggie’s homemade bread before they could drag Bill out of the squashed little cockpit. Bill was moaning and a trickle of dark red blood ran down his forehead.

Scottie turned off the engine and all was quiet.

From the boot came a rat-a-tat-tat.

“Er, hello?” Tuesday asked.

Scottie puffed furiously on his pipe and jerked open the boot with Bill’s key. Tom and Tuesday sprang up like Jack-in-the-boxes and swayed back and forth. “Git owt o the car yer bloody houns!” Bellowed Scottie MacLaren. He shook his head at the wet patches of saliva on their crotches. “In front of the wee boy ‘n all.”

Tom and Tuesday staggered away from the Porsche, their arms supporting each other, Tom’s erection softening faster than Errol’s foot beneath the Porsche’s eight kilogram tyre. They collapsed beside Audrey and Bill with relief. Tuesday knelt over the unconscious Audrey and slapped her gently across the cheeks and Tom took the opportunity to gently king hit a conscious Bill which rendered him unconscious, a state which Tom was sure would benefit from some more king hitting but which Tuesday gently restrained him from doing.

Scottie and his wife lifted up the Porsche from Errol’s foot. “Ooch, ‘tis only a scratch.” Scottie boomed, tapping his pipe ash into the exposed raw tendons of his son’s foot as he examined it.  “Back to the table ‘n don’t think wi’ oul this excitement ah have naye noticed ya have naye eaten ya sprouts.”

Maggie MacLaren smoothed down her skirt, brushed the dust and debris from the collapsed wall off her chair, and removed Clara’s glass nipple from her bread roll.

Errol MacLaren stared despondently at his dinner plate, thinking how unfair it was that despite the bits of smoking metal and ceiling and chandelier and brake lights and pink batt stuffing and blood and skin covering the dining room table, there were still three boiled brussel sprouts sitting perfectly neatly on his plate in front of him.

Scottie MacLaren smoked his pipe contently and revelled in the quiet joy of dinner with his family, rejoicing in the peaceful bird song that floated on the summer breeze through the four metre hole in his house.

And Tuesday and Tom and Audrey and Bill bled quietly in the corner.

 

Chapter Seven Excerpt

“Ssssssssssssssh,” Anthea ordered. Her voice came from directly beneath the bug in the light bulb. Her footsteps walked slowly about the secret room. She sniffed.

            “What ith it, Anthea?” Asked a heavy voice with a lisp.

            “I swear I can smell - porridge. And…,” she hesitated. “The smell of two people in love!”

            There was a mumble of horrified voices.

            “Who in this room is in love?” Screeched Anthea.

            A number of men spoke at once. “I’m not! No, not me! Never! Wouldn’t think of it. In love? Wouldn’t dare! No, never!”

            A brave voice piped up proudly from the back of the room. “I am.” He stepped forward closer to Anthea. “I am in love with Abdul!”

            There was a collective gasp.

            “It’s true.” Abdul admitted in a deep voice. “Kevin and I are in love.”

            “In love?” Hissed Anthea. “And how exactly does this fit in with your roles as suicide bombers? People who are in love want to live not die.”

            “Hmmm.” Kevin shuffled his shoe along the floor. “I suppose it is a bit of a contradiction.”

            “I hadn’t thought of that,” said Abdul brightly.

            “There’s only one thing for it,” Anthea stated matter of factly. There was the sound of a gun cocking. “Let go of each other’s hand and face the wall.”

            “Hang about,” said Kevin, “isn’t there some way we can still be in love and help out with your terribly secret evil plan?”

            “I know,” suggested Abdul helpfully, “we could just plant the bombs and tip-toe away.”

            There was a general murmur of agreement.

            “YOU CAN’T JUST TIP TOE AWAY!” Screamed Anthea. “YOU ALL NEED TO DIE!”

            “Can’t we just get away with a limp?” Someone asked from the sidelines. “I’ve always wanted a limp. Distinguished looking.”

            “Or a broken nothe?” Lisped the man beside her. “I wouldn’t mind a broken nothe. I’ve needed to get it fixthed for ageth.”

            There was a clamour of excited voices. “Singed eyelashes! A missing pinkie! A little scar on the cheek! Girls go mad for facial scars!”

            “SHUT UP!” Anthea roared. “You have to die so that you never, ever tell anyone about it!”

            “Ooh, I promise!” Squealed Kevin.

            “So do I,” said Abdul, “I promise ever so much. Really.”

            The room rang with agreement. “So do I! So do I! I’ll never tell, ever! Your secret’s safe with me! Not a word! What evil bomb plot? Do you know an evil bomb plot to destroy the most expensive over-priced city in the world? No! No!” There were shouts all around. “No! Never heard of it! I have no idea why there are eight tons of fertilizer and three boxes of dynamite and lots of little red and blue wires and a great big secret map with all the bomb sites drawn on it in this secret room!”

 “Neither do I! Neither do !” Shouted everyone.

Anthea sighed. “That’s very kind of you. But I am sorry, you are going to have to die.”

The were murmurs of disappointment.

“Now, Kevin and Abdul, turn around you two. I can’t have two people who desperately want to move to Rushcutters Bay and own two cats and wear black turtle necks on my evil team.”

“Wait a minute,” piped up a voice. “I’m in love too.”

There was a shocked silence.

“I’m in love with…Brian.”

“Wot?” Said Brian.

“You know,” hissed the voice, “we’re in lurrrve. Like, it’s a bummer, I know. But there you go, sorry about that. Cause you know, like, wouldn’t it be funny if we were all in love, cause then like, poor Anthea here wouldn’t be able to kill us because then like, they’d be no one to carry out her evil plan. You know, wow, I mean, like, wouldn’t that be a bummer.”

There was a bit of a confused silence.

“I love you,” said Brian.

“I love Mohammed!” Thundered a deep-chested man.

“I love Peter!” Squealed another.

“So do I. So do I. I love Peter too!”

“SHUT UP!” Spat Anthea. “WHERE HAVE ALL THE EVIL MEN GONE? You couldn’t move for evil men a few years ago! Now, what can you find? A few disgruntled postal workers at best! A determined writer of letters to the Editor! Well, I GIVE UP, GODAMMIT! NO ONE IS GOING TO DIE!”

A cheer rose from the room.

Across the road from Tom’s house, Mr G lumbered up Anthea’s front steps, the sweat streaming from his face, his armpits wet.

“SOMEONE IS GOING TO DIE!” He thundered.

“Uh oh.” Said Tuesday, Tom, and Esther.

 

Chapter Eight

“I’m her lover,” Bill gloated. “Me and Tuesday.” (Audrey wasn’t around to correct his grammar anymore).

“Yeah, right.” Tom snorted. “You wish. Look how beautiful she is. As if she’d be interested in you.”

Bill turned back to Tuesday. “Beautiful?” He’d never thought of Tuesday in that light. Cute sure. Attractive of course, even in her stained Goodies t-shirt with her breasts doubling the size of the ‘o’ and the ‘d’. But beautiful? Did Tom know something he didn’t? “Whatever. The point is…” Bill screwed up his forehead. He hated that, when you’d just got your finger on the point and then it slipped away from you and you were left holding your hand in the air, pointing.

“The point is…we’re lovers…of sorts.”

Tom laughed and looked back at Tuesday. “Tuesday! Aren’t you going to defend yourself!”

Tuesday nodded vigorously at him. “No.” She stood and inched her way along the couch towards the door. “I mean - this is not the time for reminiscing, musing, self-berating, pondering, reflecting, deliberating, concluding, and philosophising, Tom. I have a fire to fight.” She tried to sneak past them both.

“Wait a minute,” Tom pulled her back by her collar. “You’re just neighbours, right? This old man and you?”

“I’m not old!” Bellowed Bill. “I’m charismatic! I’m mature! I’m sophisticated. I’m…” Bill tried to find the right word. “Thirty-nine!”

Tuesday and Tom didn’t even bother to challenge such an obvious lie. Bill was as much thirty-nine as Tuesday was a white male accountant from Turramurra.

“Anyway, I can prove it,” Bill gloated, giving Tuesday a triumphant look.

“That you’re thirty-nine?” Tom and Tuesday gasped.

“No!” Bill pulled up the waistband of his slipping pants so that they once again covered the crack of his backside. “I can prove that Tuesday and I enjoy a certain intimacy. That our love-making has been passionate and sex-u-al.”

“Bill,” Tuesday hastened. “I know you’re upset that your wife has left you and become a friend of mine and I know the cocaine you take has addled your brain until it’s just pea soup with real peas because you snorted fifteen peas up your nose to show me how the body’s digestion and respiratory systems are inter-related except that they’re not and now you have fifteen peas lodged in your left temporal lobe, I know these things have altered your sense of reality, so why don’t we just forget about this?”

“How can you prove it?” Tom asked Bill, folding his arms.

“I’ve got a CAT scan somewhere,” Bill said.

“No, I mean, how can you prove you’ve slept with her?”

“Tom!” Tuesday put on her most indignant face. “I refuse to let you talk about me like this when I’m still in the room!” She crept towards the door. “Do it after I leave.”

“She has a tiny white scar in the shape of a gun on her ass.”

Tuesday hesitated and paled. If only she hadn’t been playing Cluedo that day with her four year old brother. If only her mother hadn’t boiled the game pieces after her brother baked them in his ‘mud’ cakes. If only her mother hadn’t left the tiny white hot murder weapons to cool on the kitchen counter next to the footstool.

Still, Tuesday had set a trend. All of her brothers had little white scars on their black bottoms and Tuesday couldn’t count the number of family photos taken of them mooning the camera and grinning over their shoulders. 

“First of all,” Tuesday growled, “I have a bottom. I do not have an ass.”

“Secondly, I may or may not have a scar in the shape of a gun in the bottom quadrant of my left buttock. I don’t often look at my bottom so frankly I am unable to confirm or deny Bill’s allegation.”

“Well, I wouldn’t mind looking at your bottom,” said Tom. “You know, just to sort this out once and for all.”

“Neither would I,” added Bill. “I’d quite like to look at your bottom too.”

“NO ONE IS GOING TO LOOK AT MY BOTTOM!” Tuesday gritted through her teeth.

“SOMEONE IS GOING TO DIE!” He thundered.
“Uh oh.” Said Tuesday, Tom, and Esther.
 
Chapter Eight


“I’m her lover,” Bill gloated. “Me and Tuesday.” (Audrey wasn’t around to correct his grammar anymore).
“Yeah, right.” Tom snorted. “You wish. Look how beautiful she is. As if she’d be interested in you.”
Bill turned back to Tuesday. “Beautiful?” He’d never thought of Tuesday in that light. Cute sure. Attractive of course, even in her stained Goodies t-shirt with her breasts doubling the size of the ‘o’ and the ‘d’. But beautiful? Did Tom know something he didn’t? “Whatever. The point is…” Bill screwed up his forehead. He hated that, when you’d just got your finger on the point and then it slipped away from you and you were left holding your hand in the air, pointing.
“The point is…we’re lovers…of sorts.”
Tom laughed and looked back at Tuesday. “Tuesday! Aren’t you going to defend yourself!”
Tuesday nodded vigorously at him. “No.” She stood and inched her way along the couch towards the door. “I mean - this is not the time for reminiscing, musing, self-berating, pondering, reflecting, deliberating, concluding, and philosophising, Tom. I have a fire to fight.” She tried to sneak past them both.
“Wait a minute,” Tom pulled her back by her collar. “You’re just neighbours, right? This old man and you?”
“I’m not old!” Bellowed Bill. “I’m charismatic! I’m mature! I’m sophisticated. I’m…” Bill tried to find the right word. “Thirty-nine!”
Tuesday and Tom didn’t even bother to challenge such an obvious lie. Bill was as much thirty-nine as Tuesday was a white male accountant from Turramurra.
“Anyway, I can prove it,” Bill gloated, giving Tuesday a triumphant look.
“That you’re thirty-nine?” Tom and Tuesday gasped.
“No!” Bill pulled up the waistband of his slipping pants so that they once again covered the crack of his backside. “I can prove that Tuesday and I enjoy a certain intimacy. That our love-making has been passionate and sex-u-al.”
“Bill,” Tuesday hastened. “I know you’re upset that your wife has left you and become a friend of mine and I know the cocaine you take has addled your brain until it’s just pea soup with real peas because you snorted fifteen peas up your nose to show me how the body’s digestion and respiratory systems are inter-related except that they’re not and now you have fifteen peas lodged in your left temporal lobe, I know these things have altered your sense of reality, so why don’t we just forget about this?”
“How can you prove it?” Tom asked Bill, folding his arms.
“I’ve got a CAT scan somewhere,” Bill said.
“No, I mean, how can you prove you’ve slept with her?”
“Tom!” Tuesday put on her most indignant face. “I refuse to let you talk about me like this when I’m still in the room!” She crept towards the door. “Do it after I leave.”
“She has a tiny white scar in the shape of a gun on her ass.”
Tuesday hesitated and paled. If only she hadn’t been playing Cluedo that day with her four year old brother. If only her mother hadn’t boiled the game pieces after her brother baked them in his ‘mud’ cakes. If only her mother hadn’t left the tiny white hot murder weapons to cool on the kitchen counter next to the footstool.
Still, Tuesday had set a trend. All of her brothers had little white scars on their black bottoms and Tuesday couldn’t count the number of family photos taken of them mooning the camera and grinning over their shoulders. 
“First of all,” Tuesday growled, “I have a bottom. I do not have an ass.”
“Secondly, I may or may not have a scar in the shape of a gun in the bottom quadrant of my left buttock. I don’t often look at my bottom so frankly I am unable to confirm or deny Bill’s allegation.”
“Well, I wouldn’t mind looking at your bottom,” said Tom. “You know, just to sort this out once and for all.”
“Neither would I,” added Bill. “I’d quite like to look at your bottom too.”
“NO ONE IS GOING TO LOOK AT MY BOTTOM!” Tuesday gritted through her teeth.

If you don't see the Perks listed to the right try logging in using Google Chrome or Mozilla Firefox.  Sorry for the inconvenience.

Could You Use More Money In These Tough Times?

The Need

If you could spend just $20 and know you would be able to pocket an additional $1,000 or more in savings, would you consider that a good purchase?What could you do with an extra $1,000, $3,000 or even $10,000 this next year? Would it change your circumstances in any way? Think how much even $1,000 in extra money next year would help you out. An extra $1,000 would pay for:

  • Over 250 gallons of gas, or
  • Food for a family of four for 2-3 months, or
  • 3-4 months of heating or cooling bills, or
  • Car payments for 3-4 months, or
  • The first $1,000 of an emergency fund, or
  • A long overdue family vacation

As you can see, even $1,000 can make a big difference. Imagine what $2,000, $5,000, $7,000 or even $10,000 could do for you? The prolonged tough economy has left over 70% of us struggling just to make ends meet from month to month. With prices rising faster than our paychecks - if you even have a job - it's getting harder each month to survive financially.

The Solution

We've written a book called MORE MONEY in Tough Times: Discover the $10,000 You Never Knew You Had that can lead people who are struggling (maybe even you?) out of their personal "economic slump" and help them find the hidden money they've had all along.

This book is a collection of over 100 ways to keep more of the money you're already earning simply by spending smarter. It also includes some basic financial advice on how to better manage your financial life for maximum benefit both now and for the future.
 
MORE MONEY will show you:
  • How to get sale prices on groceries when everyone else is paying full price (without using coupons!)
  • How to save hundreds on your car insurance by increasing your coverage and keeping the same insurance company
  • How to save money on gas before you ever leave your driveway
  • How carrying balances on your credit cards can make you money if you can take advantage of this secret technique
  • How to save thousands on medical tests and procedures even when you don't have health insurance
We've uncovered over 100 other ways to help you keep more of your own money as well, many of which are unique to this book. Each money saving idea is followed by a Potential Savings section so you can see how much each simple change you make can add to the extra money you'll find.
 
All of these ideas are simple to implement and can result in significant savings over the course of the year. Some may only save you $30, but some can save you several hundred dollars in a year. Combined they total well over $10,000 in annual savings if you were able to implement them all.
 
This book doesn't tell you to cut up your credit cards or live in a cardboard box just to save on rent. Instead, MORE MONEY shows you how to spend your money more efficiently so you have thousands left over at the end of the year without reducing your lifestyle!

What Others Have Said About This Book

We've given a few manuscript copies of this book to a select group of people to review and comment on. Here are just a few comments we've received back.

"If you're ready to make better positive decisions about money then read this book! Tom and Lindy truly come from the heart."

- James Malinchak, Featured on ABC's Hit TV Show, "Secret Millionaire"

- Founder, www.BigMoneySpeaker.com

 

"Tom and Lindy Schneider show you simple steps to follow to get out of debt, find more money for charity, and invest in your future. They include lots of online resources as well. Take their advice and you can save thousands of dollars a year."

- Jeremy S., Certified Financial Planner

 

"MORE MONEY is a pain free way to keep more of your own money without budgeting, living like a hermit, or depriving yourself of everything you enjoy. It's a balanced approach to spending and saving that anyone can do, and everyone should do."

- Virginia V., Entrepreneur

Why This Book Is So Important

We won't change the world with this book, but we can help ease some of your financial stress. Our goal is to improve our economy one household at a time.

By helping you survive, and maybe even thrive, in these tough times you can have the freedom to put your money toward the things that matter most to you.

This project is unique in another way: you will get back far more than you give. By putting even a few of these ideas into practice in your own life you'll save far more than any reward level you choose and you'll be helping us to spread the word to others as well.

What We Need & What You Get

So why are we doing an Indiegogo campaign? Quite frankly, we want to know how much interest there is in a book like this. By supporting this project and choosing one of the Perks you are pre-ordering copies of the book and getting some extra freebies as well. We will determine how many books we need to print based on the response to this campaign.

The book is written, the printer files have all been approved: all we are waiting on is to find out how many we should print.

All books will be delivered and in your hands by December 10, 2012.

Here's how we intend to use the money:

  • To pay for the initial printing of the books
  • To provide books to reward you, our backers

Stretch Goal

If we can double our goal we'll be able to print four times as many copies because our cost per book will drop substantially. This will allow us to also initiate a national marketing campaign for the book.

About Us

Both Lindy and I are award winning published authors. Most of my writing has been in the marketing and business world, but I have also won a national award as a songwriter. Lindy is also an award winning illustrator.

One of our many accomplishments is an Amazon best selling children's book entitled Starfish on the Beach, a story about making a difference. Lindy has also been a contributing author to several Chicken Soup for the Soul books. 

Lindy and I are both sought after speakers as well and provide consulting services for a select group of clients.

Because we believe that we are in this world to serve we always choose a charity to give a portion of our profits to for each book we've written. The charity that will benefit from the sales of MORE MONEY is the National Military Family Association, a charity that provides assistance to military families. A portion of all the proceeds from this campaign and any future sales of MORE MONEY will go to support this important top rated charity.

Ways You Can Help

To reserve your own copy simply choose one of the Perks listed to the right. Even at the lowest reward level you'll get back far more value than your contribution. You can contirbute by clicking on any Claim This Perk button or the Contribute Now button at the top of the page.

If you have all the money you need and aren't interested in keeping any more of what you earn we can still use your help. You can help spread the word about this campaign. And even if you can't afford to support it financially you can still share this information with your friends and contacts. Who knows, maybe someone you tell about this project will support it and give YOU a copy of the book!

Share it on Facebook or Twitter. Send the link to your friends via email. You can also use the links on this site as the easiest way to share this campaign.

Thank you for your support and for your interest in MORE MONEY in Tough Times.

               May your money be plentiful, and your tough times few!

story:
IN A NUTSHELL ...

Hi, I’m Ebony.

Writing is my passion and it is has been a lifelong dream of mine to become a published author. With my manuscript, “Sins of the Father” nearing completion and a self-publishing deal in the works, I am closer to achieving my dream than ever before.

Please consider donating to my cause! Even as a writer, I can’t put into words how much it will mean to me. 

ABOUT THE BOOK

Maya King is torn between grief and rage when she discovers that her recently deceased father had another daughter as a result of an extra-marital affair. Things grow more difficult when she returns to her job, as a nurse, and finds the name of her father’s former lover on her list of charges.  

Will Maya accept her father’s other daughter as her flesh and blood? Will she be able to care for his former lover, in her dying days, or will she allow the feelings of rage and betrayal to consume her?

Find out when you read “Sins of the Father” for yourself.

Estimated release: Spring 2014.

WHAT I NEED & WHAT YOU GET

Here’s the deal: I need $5000.

This money will cover the costs to self-publish my manuscript, “Sins of the Father,” including editorial services, cover design, e-book formatting and distribution, worldwide distribution, promotional materials, book launch/signing materials and SO much more.

Every dollar will go toward all aspects of the self-publishing process and distribution (whether I meet my goal or not). If I exceed my goal, the excess will go toward the self-publishing of my next book (already titled and outlined). In the event a major publisher offers me a deal, the excess money will be donated to International Crisis Aid, an organization that has joined the fight against child sex trafficking. 

All contributors will receive a personal thank you note from me (you must provide a valid mailing address). You can donate any amount!

Contributions of certain amounts will receive a free e-book or physical copy of the book (must provide a valid mailing address and add $10 for shipping and handling)!

Folks that are feeling extraordinarily generous may receive a story, written by me, starring them as the protagonist or a private reading for an intimate gathering of friends, complete with refreshments.

Of course, there are those that may just want to donate for the sake of donating. That’s fine, too. You don’t have to receive a perk to donate but, at least let me send you a thank you card!

THE IMPACT

By contributing, you are not only helping me to achieve a lifelong dream, you are impacting my future and enriching my life, as well. Once this book is finally in print and available for purchase, I believe a flood gate of book ideas will open for me. The fear that I’ll never see my dreams realized will diminish and I will be free to continue to pursue my passion.

Who doesn't want to have a hand in helping someone realize something so important to them? I know I love to see people have their dreams come true and I am always happy to be among those who helped it happen.

OTHER WAYS TO HELP

I realize that not everyone will be able to contribute. You can help in other ways, too!

  • Share the link to this campaign on all of your social media outlets
  • Spread the word via email and word of mouth
  • PRAY PRAY PRAY!!!!!

story:
The Book, The Tour, The Mission

Hi, I'm Justin, a comedian and self-proclaimed “fat player”, and my first book was just released on Valentine's Day.  I wrote Confessions of a Fat Player with the hope that by hearing about my experiences, bigger men like me will find the confidence to go out and find the love we all deserve.  One thing I've learned over the years is that being fat shouldn't prevent you from enjoying life to the fullest - and that includes being with women!  

In my lifetime I've been fortunate to meet and date many amazing and beautiful women, and in the book I share my secrets.  These tips won't just help big guys learn to "score with babes," they're about confidence and embracing who you are, which will make every part of your life better.

One part advice, one part story-telling, Confessions of a Fat Player draws readers into a world where even overweight men can truly prosper in the dating scene.  I share (sometimes embarrassing, always entertaining) personal stories, helpful tools and dating insight, combined with my unique sense of humor that's not always politically correct!


                                    

The book has been released in digital format on all major platforms (Amazon, Barnes and Noble, etc.)  With your support, this campaign will fund the physical copies of the book and the national comedy tour to promote it!  Check out some of the radio, podcast and video interviews I've already done for the book below - we had a lot of fun with these!

 

             Live 105 Video                      Joe Sib Podcast                  Sal Calanni Podcast


Thanks for checking my campaign out, and I hope to see you at one of my shows (that's a perk you can get!)

Here's What We Need and Why

We're looking to raise $5500.00 for this tour:

  • $2500 Physical Books - I want to have actual physical copies of the book to bring on tour with us. This will purchase 1000 paperback copies to bring along on the tour. 
  • $500 Road Manager- Our amazing road manager Al will be dealing with all of the travel details, driving, merchandizing setup and bookings. We should be paying him $10,000.00!!
  • $500 Gas- Do I need to explain? 
  • $500 Hotels- Myself and openers will be staying at the homes of kind friends and family members when we can, but when we can't we'll need a hotel room. 
  • $500 Food- Feeding 4 big guys can get expensive...
  • $1000 Misc Expenses- Between helping create this page, editing my atrocious grammar, updating social media, making calls to clubs and much more, there's a lot of expenses that have accumulated in this process!      


Here's What You Get, aka The Good Part!

When you help fund this project, you can get free copies of the book, show tickets, and you can even get some exclusive one-time-only perks! I know that not everybody has a lot of money (I sure as hell don't) so if you're giving some of it to help me with my dreams, I'm making sure I give you something sweet!

These are the different items you can get by helping fund this project.  Check out the perks to the right to pick the combination of items that you want:
  • Free digital copy of the book ($4.99 value) 
  • Free copy of the paperback ($12.99 value)
  • 2-4 tickets to a book tour show, you pick the city! ($30-60 value) 
  • 4 VIP passes to a show of your choice, with reserved seating, backstage access, and a photo session with the performers ($100 value)
  • Signed copy of the paperback (priceless!)
  • Your name in the book (priceless!)
  • Admission to an exclusive "Fat Player" workshop, where I teach you all the strategies from the book, and you get one-on-one access to me. If you're not an aspiring "Fat Player" yourself, why not sponsor someone who needs the help!  (priceless!)
  • I make dinner for you and three friends at my place, and you get your own "thank you" page in the book (priceless!)

What happens if we don't fully fund?

The first priority is to get this book printed, so all proceeds will go to that before we start on anything else... But please don't make us sleep in the car.


How does this help people?

At a certain point in my life I thought that no woman would be attracted to me unless I lost weight. That's a depressing, frustrating and most of all lonely feeling to have. I honestly believe that my book can help change people's perceptions of themselves and provide tools to start living richer lives.


Can you get this done Justin?

Five years ago I built a grassroots campaign out of nothing to run for political office: we raised thousands of dollars, built a 12 person staff and ended up with 16% of the vote. Although I didn't win the election the Mayor appointed me to the Economic Development Commission a month later, making me the youngest person to ever serve on that board. I eventually ascended to President of that Commission.

I've spent many years organizing and producing comedy shows around the state. I have a deep knowledge of how to promote and produce successful shows.


Hey I'm Broke Too But I Still Want to Help!

No problem! Please TELL others about the book and this campaign: whether it's Tweeting, Facebook, Instagram, carrier pigeon, smoke signals, the pony express, screaming from a mountain top or just telling a friend. Getting the word out is so crucial!

Indiegogo has tons of sweet tools for you to share this! Check em out!


About Justin

Born and raised in the Bay Area, comedian Justin Harrison has toured nationally and shared the stage with some of the biggest names in comedy. The creator of the online video and live show series "Comics Gone Viral", Harrison's style has been called "comically surly." It's a bold, unapologetic approach that's never politically correct but always devastatingly hilarious. A Punchline Comedy Club favorite, Harrison is also a fixture at several other notable comedy clubs including Cobb's, The Purple Onion and the Hollywood Improv.

Read more about Justin and what he's up to at www.justinisfunny.com
story_txt:
The Book, The Tour, The Mission
Hi, I'm Justin, a comedian and self-proclaimed “fat player”, and my first book was just released on Valentine's Day.  I wrote Confessions of a Fat Player with the hope that by hearing about my experiences, bigger men like me will find the confidence to go out and find the love we all deserve.  One thing I've learned over the years is that being fat shouldn't prevent you from enjoying life to the fullest - and that includes being with women!  In my lifetime I've been fortunate to meet and date many amazing and beautiful women, and in the book I share my secrets.  These tips won't just help big guys learn to "score with babes," they're about confidence and embracing who you are, which will make every part of your life better.One part advice, one part story-telling, Confessions of a Fat Player draws readers into a world where even overweight men can truly prosper in the dating scene.  I share (sometimes embarrassing, always entertaining) personal stories, helpful tools and dating insight, combined with my unique sense of humor that's not always politically correct!                                    The book has been released in digital format on all major platforms (Amazon, Barnes and Noble, etc.)  With your support, this campaign will fund the physical copies of the book and the national comedy tour to promote it!  Check out some of the radio, podcast and video interviews I've already done for the book below - we had a lot of fun with these!              Live 105 Video                      Joe Sib Podcast                  Sal Calanni PodcastThanks for checking my campaign out, and I hope to see you at one of my shows (that's a perk you can get!)Here's What We Need and Why
We're looking to raise $5500.00 for this tour: 

$2500 Physical Books - I want to have actual physical copies of the book to bring on tour with us. This will purchase 1000 paperback copies to bring along on the tour. 


$500 Road Manager- Our amazing road manager Al will be dealing with all of the travel details, driving, merchandizing setup and bookings. We should be paying him $10,000.00!!


$500 Gas- Do I need to explain? 


$500 Hotels- Myself and openers will be staying at the homes of kind friends and family members when we can, but when we can't we'll need a hotel room. 


$500 Food- Feeding 4 big guys can get expensive...


$1000 Misc Expenses- Between helping create this page, editing my atrocious grammar, updating social media, making calls to clubs and much more, there's a lot of expenses that have accumulated in this process!      

Here's What You Get, aka The Good Part!
When you help fund this project, you can get free copies of the book, show tickets, and you can even get some exclusive one-time-only perks! I know that not everybody has a lot of money (I sure as hell don't) so if you're giving some of it to help me with my dreams, I'm making sure I give you something sweet!

These are the different items you can get by helping fund this project.  Check out the perks to the right to pick the combination of items that you want:


Free digital copy of the book ($4.99 value) 
Free copy of the paperback ($12.99 value)
2-4 tickets to a book tour show, you pick the city! ($30-60 value) 
4 VIP passes to a show of your choice, with reserved seating, backstage access, and a photo session with the performers ($100 value)
Signed copy of the paperback (priceless!)
Your name in the book (priceless!)
Admission to an exclusive "Fat Player" workshop, where I teach you all the strategies from the book, and you get one-on-one access to me. If you're not an aspiring "Fat Player" yourself, why not sponsor someone who needs the help!  (priceless!)
I make dinner for you and three friends at my place, and you get your own "thank you" page in the book (priceless!)


What happens if we don't fully fund? The first priority is to get this book printed, so all proceeds will go to that before we start on anything else... But please don't make us sleep in the car.How does this help people? 

At a certain point in my life I thought that no woman would be attracted to me unless I lost weight. That's a depressing, frustrating and most of all lonely feeling to have. I honestly believe that my book can help change people's perceptions of themselves and provide tools to start living richer lives. 


Can you get this done Justin?
Five years ago I built a grassroots campaign out of nothing to run for political office: we raised thousands of dollars, built a 12 person staff and ended up with 16% of the vote. Although I didn't win the election the Mayor appointed me to the Economic Development Commission a month later, making me the youngest person to ever serve on that board. I eventually ascended to President of that Commission. 
I've spent many years organizing and producing comedy shows around the state. I have a deep knowledge of how to promote and produce successful shows. 




Hey I'm Broke Too But I Still Want to Help! 

No problem! Please TELL others about the book and this campaign: whether it's Tweeting, Facebook, Instagram, carrier pigeon, smoke signals, the pony express, screaming from a mountain top or just telling a friend. Getting the word out is so crucial!
Indiegogo has tons of sweet tools for you to share this! Check em out!


About Justin


Born and raised in the Bay Area, comedian Justin Harrison has toured nationally and shared the stage with some of the biggest names in comedy. The creator of the online video and live show series "Comics Gone Viral", Harrison's style has been called "comically surly." It's a bold, unapologetic approach that's never politically correct but always devastatingly hilarious. A Punchline Comedy Club favorite, Harrison is also a fixture at several other notable comedy clubs including Cobb's, The Purple Onion and the Hollywood Improv.
Read more about Justin and what he's up to at www.justinisfunny.com

story:
Summary

An opportunity for you to show your passion for the art of writing and to instill the love of reading to your friends and loved ones.

  • My name is Reuben Tom Kee.  This is my second self publishing project..

  • Author's Note

    It is surprising how 'little' instances happen to influence one's life. They appear to be coincidences but I believe they are not. They are serendipitous circumstances that have meaning if we allow ourselves to believe: much like the young child in all of us.

    The story is based on real instances but, of course, the retelling has taken some of its own course. For many years, I had harbored the thought of telling this story but it was an enigma of what form it should take.

    As it happened, it was a chance meeting with an author of books for children and the subsequent meeting of a young boy with the name RJ (Ramon Jacob) that was the impetus to put pen to paper.

    It was the spark that lit the fire, and, if I may add, the Bug that bit.

  • *** As a contributor your your participation will be important in bringing this project to life and raising it to a level that I could not achieve alone! ***

What is the Story about?

Ramon Jacob learns to cope with the loss of his mother and adopts the Ladybug as his symbol of her spirit.

She becomes a beacon in his emotional struggles and he believes that she is always there to look over him, to calm him in his anxious moments, to help him accept life's servings of fate, and, above all, to learn to be positive and forward moving in life.

This is a story for young people ages 8-12 and as well for 'children at heart' past the age of 20. For those age 13-19, you are invited to make the choice – you just might like this book.

Other images:  ....for More images of the publication...

What We Need & 

What You Get

Here are the details of the campaign for your particp-action...

Book specs:  Full color illustrated

Unique format 4.25 x 11.00 inches

- using aspects of ancient Chinese bookbinding techniques:

By serendipitous circumstance, I discovered a technique of bookbinding that was prevalent during the Ming dynasty (1366 – 1644) right up to the early 1900's when China produced documents by printing on one side of a large sized paper which was then folded in half. The folded sheets was held between two boards and then tied with cord (often red or yellow) through holes on the raw side of the pages and finally knotted to become the finished binding. Also, traditional Chinese books read from right to left, hence the similar front and back covers. To impart an artisan approach, I have incorporated many of the techniques in the creation of this book.

Each sponsor (except Techno & Best Wishers) is entitled to:

At least One personalised Signed and Numbered limited Sponsor copy

Additonal copies, where applicable, will be Open edition for your gifting purposes

  • This funding phase is to produce the limited edition for you as a sponsor


  • Here are the sponsor levels. There is something for everyone:

    (Mail delivery costs included in each level)

    $350 Grand Sponsor (2 spots)

    Perks: 10 copies incl 5 personalized Signed and Numbered Sponsor copies

    Your name included in book credits of this edition plus 2 future publications

    Option to include names of up to 4 Sparks (younger children) in credits

    You will be mentioned in all publicity regarding this book & the next 2 publications

    You will also receive a Signed and Numbered copy of my previous book of poems -

                                        Ode to China – Sagacity!


    $150 Edition sponsors (3 spots) -  see levels below  for all your perks

    $100 LadyBug / GentleBug (6 spots)

    $65 Red Dots (11 spots)

    $40 Spirits (11 spots)

    $25 Sparks (30 spots)

    $10 Techno Wisher 

    $5 Best Wisher 

  • This project is guaranteed to be produced and completed with target deliverydate of April 2014

Your Impact

By joining my campaign, you show your passion for the written word and its therapeutical effect on readers! After a good read, a person should feel moved, or even changed, if only for a few days. A good read should make us proud to be human!

You will also be contributing to the success of a newly minted self publishing house!

Here is a quote from my last book: A smile can resolve a thousand times our despair!

    • My first book is being sold at our local Chapters store in Ottawa

    • Embark on this journey with me and you will realize the effects of artistic and literary collaboration!

Ways You Can Help

If you are not in a position to contribute $$ now, but feel good about my project, then let me know if you can help to promote to your circle of friends and acquaintances.

  • If you can provide leads for 3 action sponsors, I will be happy to reward with an open edition copy as thanks. Email your leads to: mtcarlo38@hotmail.com

  • Share and share alike – pass along this info with Indiegogo share tools!

That’s how you can be part of this project and you can be proud. It can be as easy as that!

story:
На Български език / In Bulgarian

THE BOOK:

Hi!

My name is Yordan Zhelyazkov (YZ, Yordan or Jordan for short) and “When They Shine Brightest” is my first novel! It’s a character-driven fantasy novel and although small in size, it encompasses the stories of several characters and their struggles through the streets of an invaded city threatened by a Godly disaster.

Korsak Dryshore is a middle-aged war veteran, held directly responsible for the invasion of Seten. His wife, his sons, his townsmen - everyone in Seten blames him for losing the battle in defense of the city. Having also lost his eldest son in that battle Korsak is feeling utterly defeated even without the judgement of others. To make matters worse, he's spent the first several months after the battle away from Seten only to return not just as a culprit for the hard times of the people, but also with a foreign, heathen girl by his side.

Beaten, downcast and given up, his only remaining goal is to live the rest of his life quietly and meekly. That proves to be impossible however when the political and religious situation in Seten escalates, he's implicated into the center of all the commotion and his youngest son and the small, heathen girl are dragged in an impossible situation.

And in the meantime They are about to set over Seten.

That and much more on the book and its world, you can find on my website - http://yzfantasy.com/

For the first three chapters in English, see here: http://yzfantasy.com/2446/when-they-shine-brightest/

(UPDATE!) Also - my very first interview with the big sci-fi and fantasy e-mag ShadowDance: http://yzfantasy.com/2834/my-very-first-interview/!

(UPDATE!) After my first interview in ShadowDance, here’s my first live interview on Bulgarian national TV, for “Bulgaria today” (I’ve added English subtitles in the video, you can access them through the “Subtitles/CC” button).

Enjoy!


THE CAMPAIGN:

 As for the campaign itself – as you’ve probably figured out from my name, I’m not a native English speaker. In fact I’m from Bulgaria and the novel is written in Bulgarian. However, since Bulgaria is a pretty small country and living off of writing alone is quite hard here, I decided to try and get the book translated into English and publish it worldwide. At the moment the translation is in the capable hands of professional translator Alexander Gurovski and is half-way completed. After that, of course, it will go through professional editing and then – to you!

And all that is the reason why I started this crowdfunding campaign – to find in you some of my future readers and to try and gather the rest of the funds I need. All in all, the costs for the translation, editing, website, cover etc are around $3500 but since a part of that is already taken care of, I decided to put the campaign’s goal at $2500. Even with a bit less I’ll be able to finish everything eventually, but I’d still be extremely happy to reach my goal. Every extra dollar after the goal is reached will go into the translation of my short-stories which are part of the novel’s world (and free on my website), into additional illustrations for the book and more.

CAMPAIGN PERKS:

In thanks for your gift to support my enterprise, you can receive:

$4 - An Ebook, a thank you email and a social media shout-out.

$13 - A signed paperback, a blog-post mention and a social media shout-out.

$24 - A signed hardcover, a blog-post mention and a social media shout-out.

$40 - The above plus a future character/place/event, named after (a variation of) the name/nickname/other of the backer.

$60 - The above plus a 30-60 minute long Skype call with the author (or a personal meet if the backer is near Sofia or Ruse, Bulgaria).

$100 (NEW!) - The above plus the opportunity to give an idea for a short story, a segment of a book or even an entire novel (will be brainstormed and fine-tuned until it fits perfectly into the fantasy reality).

$250 - The above plus I'll mail you an autographed, hardcover copy of everything I ever publish until one of us dies. Or the world ends. Either way – quite a lot of books.


If you like the look of my undertaking, I’ll be very grateful for all donations and shout-outs. I’d also gladly answer any questions you might have here, on my website, Facebook, Goodreads, G+ or Twitter pages.

Thank you!

story:
Banana Magazine Issue 001

We (Kathleen Tso + Vicki Ho) are so excited to share a project that we have been working extremely hard on for the past 5 months. As two first generation Chinese-Americans we felt passionately about creating a platform to celebrate, document, and explore experiences and individuals of contemporary Asian culture–defining our collective identity. Introducing Banana magazine, a platform for this journey. Below is our mission statement for further explanation. 

ba-nan-a [buh-nan-uh] – noun - An Asian person who acts like they are white. Yellow on the outside, white on the inside. 

The choice for the name Banana is meant to be an inside joke. For anyone who has ever been called a ‘banana,’ you know that it’s a nickname that has been given to many first generation Asians growing up in western world, like us. It’s not meant to be derogatory, but celebratory. Birthed in Chinatown NYC, Banana strives to navigate through the blurred Eastern and Western boundaries and create a voice for contemporary Asian culture. We want to use the magazine as a platform to feature, celebrate, and join the conversation with Asian creatives in a journey to define our collective identity. 

Whether it is rediscovering your grandma’s herbal soup recipes, exploring current Asian beauty culture through an editorial, or commissioning original artwork to represent the dichotomy that can exist between two cultures, our content strives to cover all things AZN. 
This IndieGoGo campaign will help us bring all the content we have created for issue 001 to life!

What We Need & What You Get

We feel strongly about bringing Banana to life in the form of a physical magazine. And print is expensive! 

We are looking to raise $10,000. This will cover the costs of printing copies and shipping. The more money we raise, the more we can print!

The Impact

Donating to this project will give the Asian creative community the platform for storytelling and showcasing it deserves. Banana strives to start the conversation of what being Asian means today, not only domestically, but globally. 

It will also bring all the content our contributors have worked extremely hard on to reality. From photographers, writers, artists, designers, and more, everyone has contributed for free in support of the project, and we are incredibly humbled. Bringing Banana to life will allow us to showcase their immense talents! 

Other Ways You Can Help

Support us by following us on Instagram (@bananamag) and tumblr (bananamag.tumblr.com).

And you can always reach us at info@banana-mag.com for story pitches, inquiries, or just to say hello!

story: Unfortunately last month I was told by my consultant that I am losing my sight to the retinitis pigmentosa disease and will eventually be blind. More than anything I would love to be able to see the world before this happens. As you can see in my picture I have been abroad to Spain and it was one of the happiest times of my life and I would love to experience this happiness once more. There are so many things in the world that I would love to see and this will be the only chance I will get. My boyfriend Kieron who is so supportive has been working hard to save money so that I can go on this once in a lifetime trip. Any contributions would be appreciated so much and I would be happy to share pictures from my trip in October 2016! Thank you for reading my campaign, please help my dream come true!

story:
www.kidarewriters.com

KIDS ARE WRITERS is a global, online community designed to offer FREE education, inspiration, and support to writers, ages 8-18.  

THE FACTS:

  • KIDS ARE WRITERS launched on March 1, 2014.
  • Within five months, KIDS ARE WRITERS received over 21,000 visits.
  • Visitors represent every state in the USA and 79 countries.
  • KIDS ARE WRITERS is most popular in the US, Australia, Canada, Honduras, Germany, United Kingdom, New Zealand, Philippines, South Africa, and France.
  • Children and adults benefit from KIDS ARE WRITERS. Established authors, budding authors, teachers, and homeschooling parents utilize the site to practice their writing skills and supplement their instruction. 
  • Twelve writing coaches volunteer their time and expertise to the site.
  • The site is managed and funded by founder, Michelle Lynn Senters. She serves as the director and lead writing coach.
  • Michelle conducted several Skype teaching sessions in US and Honduras classrooms. We are already booking teaching sessions, workshops, and personal coaching sessions for the 2014-2015 school year.
  • KIDS ARE WRITERS launched its first annual, FREE Summer Camp to an overwhelming response. Children from around the world participate in daily writing prompts and instruction.

In the coming year, KIDS ARE WRITERS intends to GROW!
We want to:

  • increase active membership to 1,000 young writers around the world.
  • increase a sense of community by communicating in the comment section of each article.
  • frequently publish student work on our site.
  • develop a strong foundation of articles and activities for use by students, teachers, and homeschool parents.
  • offer a small stipend to coaches who contribute their time and expertise.
  • dedicate ourselves to continued professional development, particularly in the area of brain research as it relates to writing and creativity.
  • offer activities and weekly writing prompts that are on the cutting edge of creativity and innovation.
  • post inspirational videos and articles by established authors, playwrights, screenwriters, lyricists, poets, children's authors, etc.
  • offer one-on-one coaching sessions, classroom visits, and workshops.
  • offer writing instruction around the world via Skype.
  • develop a small, but technologically adequate studio to film instructional videos of professional quality.
  • determine future course of KIDS ARE WRITERS, ie. LLC or Non-Profit Organization.
  • conduct several writing contests throughout the year.
  • host our first annual KIDS ARE WRITERS regional conference in the summer of 2015.

  1. Visit www.kidsarewriters.com.
  2. CONTRIBUTE today and inspire the literary voices of tomorrow. 
  3. Help spread the news about KIDS ARE WRITERS and our Indiegogo Campaign via Facebook, Twitter, Pinterest, and other social media sites. 

All perks are designed to further the mission and increase exposure of KIDS ARE WRITERS. We are dedicated to providing the best writing instruction available AT NO COST TO CHILDREN. The only way we can do that is with your help. Please consider making a generous donation today.

If we reach our goal, we will develop stretch goals to further the mission of providing free writing instruction to children around the world.

If you have any questions about KIDS ARE WRITERS, the perks, or any part of the campaign, feel free to contact us at: kidsarewriters@gmail.com. 

KIDS ARE WRITERS just concluded its first annual summer camp. Participants from all over the world (both young and old) received sound instruction, engaging activities, and hands-on support. In keeping with its mission, KIDS ARE WRITERS Summer Camp offered this camp AT NO CHARGE. It's not too late to sign-up because writers can work at their own pace. Click here for more information. 


Can I contact you personally?
Yes. Our email address is kidsarewriters@gmail.com.

How will we set up personal coaching, workshops, or conference perks?
After the Indiegogo campaign is completed, we will make an initial contact through email. After filling out the required paperwork, a signed contract will be sent to you.

Is your instruction conducive to Common Core State Standards?
Yes, but the method of instruction differs greatly from the classroom. Our instructional methods are highly creative and assessment free.

Can adults benefit from KIDS ARE WRITERS?
Yes! We have reports of many adults using our prompts and activities for guided writing practice. In fact, many adults have signed up to participate in our summer camp going on now. Teachers and homeschool parents are also using our site to supplement their curriculum. 

I would like to sponsor a classroom or a student for instruction, but don't know who to suggest. 
If you do not know which school or child to sponsor, KIDS ARE WRITERS can choose for you and offer a scholarship in your name. We have a long list of students and schools interested in private coaching and instruction.

Is the KIDS ARE WRITERS website safe for my child?
While it is impossible to vet every member of the community, we take careful precautions to keep every child safe. Students are not allowed to post pictures or identifying information online. All comments made on our website and Facebook page are screened. 

"Ms. Senters visited the Ditto Elementary First Graders in Arlington, TX via Google Hangout on May 27.  Right from the start, she had the kids' attention, and held it throughout with age-appropriate ideas for adventurous summer writing. Ms. Senters drew upon the idea that writing is a choice and must be done in a way that draws upon interests. From costumed writing to secret detective observations, Ms. Senters held the hearts of our kids.  Our students walked away knowing that writing takes practice, even for an author.  They were motivated to write and set themselves up for summer writing success by customizing Summer Writing Notebooks.  Thank you, Ms. Senters, for touching the lives of our children." -Carrie Brown, 1st Grade Teacher/Children's Writer, Ditto Elementary in Arlington, Texas
"I am a mom of 4 children ages ranging from 5-13. I have been homeschooling them for 4 years. My oldest has been identified as gifted and talented. I love the Kids are Writers website because it gives my kids opportunities to use their creative side to write, not just the basic school method they are taught to use. It is a great resource for topic ideas and techniques. Writing is a very important skill to have in all roles of our lives. Thanks, Michelle, for empowering children everywhere to bring out their creative thoughts through writing! "-Kate K.
"KIDS ARE WRITERS is a fantastic resource.  I'm homeschooling my 3 gifted kids so that they can learn as fast as they want to learn. The writing prompts on KIDS ARE WRITERS challenge them to think and write creatively.  We love how easily we can search the site for different engaging writing exercises.  I firmly believe that every person has a unique story that only they can tell.  KIDS ARE WRITERS  helps my children find their stories...and write." 
- Kirsti Call
"Thank you Michelle for the Skype visit to our fourth grade classroom in San Pedro Sula, Honduras today! We knew it would be a wonderful time, but you just made my kids blow away with the whole experience. That spontaneous surprise of having some snow for them to experience through the lens was just awesome! After the interview, they couldn’t stop talking about the beautiful time and the contest you created for them! My fourth graders deeply believe they are all famous and that is just because of you. I highly recommend Kids are Writers!" -Joanna Mojica, Escuela Bilingue Santa Maria Del Valle in San Pedro, Honduras, Central America

Check out our Gallery and Update section at the top of the page. There, you will see the source of our inspiration.

story:
So why a trequel?

HELLO EVERYBARDY! - this is Daryl Qilin Yam, Joshua Ip, and Ruth Tang.

We are the editors of SingPoWriMo 2016: The Anthology, survivors from the team that oversaw this month-long, write-a-poem-a-day challenge. SingPoWriMo is really more than just a thing you do on Facebook for the heck of it – it's an annual gathering of like-minded people; a rigorous exercise both demanding and rewarding; as well as a bold, balls-out foray into the literary scene.

Our dear Facebook group has grown to over 2,400 members in our third year, sustaining our record of nonstop 100% growth year-on-year! We don't know if we can keep this up, but the poetry is definitely coming. Thousands of poems were generated this month by poets both seasoned and fresh onto the party boat. Asingbols? Check. Udaiyaathathu? Check. Poems on the MRT? Ch-ch-check. Singapore literature is the beast that just refuses to die, and this year's edition of the anthology seeks to collect the best of these poems in a sizeable volume, published and released by Math Paper Press by the end of this year.

Poetry. Is. Coming!!!!

How does the money work?

The quality has gone up year after year, and this time we had to pull together a team of junior moderators just to make sure everything got read and properly sifted through. They've compiled a longlist in the hundreds, and we'll need to work through that before we can have a good sense of what this year's collection will look like, but nevertheless, we hope to keep the final manuscript to under 200 pages. So the approximate cost of producing an anthology will be (all costs in SGD):

1. ~$4000 in printing costs
2. ~$2000 in design/layout costs
3. Marketing/Distribution costs
4. Editorial Costs - zero, we're volunteering.
5. Royalties - <$2000 (~$20 per book x <100 contributors??) we're giving out contributors' copies, not cash at this stage. Contributors retain all their rights.

Math Paper Press will be covering items 2 and 3, but in the community-driven spirit of SingPoWriMo, we're going back to Indiegogo to raise funds for this anthology and ease the financial burden off Math Paper Press / BooksActually, the little independent press / bookstore that could! A cut will also go to Sing Lit Station, our newly-founded literary non-profit that organises SingPoWriMo, puts together the moderating team, and provides all the free food and booze at the parties. Finally, if we do manage to raise more funds than expected, we want to give out copies of the anthology to schools and other places that can afford more exposure to local literature!

Why should I care?

Because Singapore Lit matters. Because you love all things to do with the making of books, the making of stories, the making of exquisite things with words alone. Because, for some strange reason, you feel inspired to write poetry of your own, but don't know how to go about doing it and making your own voice heard.

Because you just have a lot of spare cash lying around, and you want to throw it to a project whose editors and publishers are starving, like, literally. Because your friend is in the anthology and you know, yeah, you know. Because there are young kids in schools who are made to think that literature is not important, not essential to our daily lives, and simply not fun at all to do or read or study. Because this book is testament that literature is all games and hard work and rainbows and the small miracles that happen when a good poem comes together. And because this book is about a thousand people, telling one another to have another go at this wonderful, frustrating, and yet altogether mind-defying smorgasm of a poetry challenge.

Because SingPoWriMo is not simply about you, or me – it's all about all of us, and that same yet strangely variegated language we all speak in: poetry.

Alright alright, now tell me: what do I get for being awesome?

Ahem - you're gonna like what we're offering this year (all donations in USD and adjusted for inflation):

$3 - Our Forever And Always Undying Love: We will love you. We really will.

$13 - Fastest Fingers Firstest: A pre-order copy of the anthology at a special price (~$18 SGD). Only for the first 13 orders. Collection only at the launch event and BooksActually (9 Yong Siak St, Singapore 168645). Last year's anthology was priced at $21, and this year's will be thicker.

$15 - Faster Fingers Not-As-Firstest-But-Still-Good: A pre-order copy of the anthology at a rather special price (~$20 SGD). Collection only at the launch event and BooksActually (9 Yong Siak St, Singapore 168645). We reiterate: last year's anthology was priced at $21, and this year's will be thicker!

$20 - Signed, Sealed, Delivered: A pre-order copy of the anthology with signatures from all editors, delivered to your doorstep via post.

$38 - Eh, Credit Me Please: Everything in the $20 tier, plus your name in the acknowledgments. People will know you as That Guy, and they will love you for it.

$48 - I Would Like a T-Shirt With That: Everything in the $38 tier, plus a limited edition SPWM T-Shirt of your choice of design. (The 4 designs available can be seen in the Gallery page)

$68 - Pretty Postcard Prize - Everything in the $48 tier, plus a beautiful, one-of-a-kind postcard-sized print of your favorite poem of the month. 

$88 - Patron of the Arts: Everything in the $48 tier, plus an original poem by the editors specifically written for the donors, in a beautiful, one-of-a-kind postcard-sized print. We'll do our best.

$128 - The Full Monty: Everything in the $88 tier, plus a special invitation to a soiree with the editors in July - food, alcohol, and poetry performances included!

story:
I quit my corporate job.

I sold my home.

I am leaving everything I have and know to travel the world for one year to learn and share stories and values of everyday people from everywhere places.

I will travel and live in 4 different parts of the world over a year to experience different values and lifestyles. 

I wish to discover what everyday people feel they need to make them happy in life, to learn what makes them sad, to ask them what success looks like, to ask them what their hopes and dreams are and compile these thoughts, dreams and values into one book and one film to contrast different lives from around the world.

I hope to get into the hearts of these places, to add value through any compassionate work along the way I can and to really live with these people to experience and share their lives with you.

I fly to New York on July 3, 2017 and then spend 3 months couch surfing across America, travelling from East to West overland. Then I aim to head to Cambodia for 2-3 months, a third to be confirmed location for a further 3 months and then finish the last few months in India until May 2018, where I hope to spend time living with housing projects and different aspects of Indian society. 

I will write a book, film all I see and also write a soundtrack while on the road for this. 

I don't have much, but I have a small budget and I have a dream.

I gave up all I have to put my heart, soul, blood sweat, and tears into this and I hope I can share the journey with you along the way and in its entirety through the book, film and soundtrack.

I look forward to sharing with pledgers real time updates from the road through written and / or video diary updates to check in with you all and share some of the journey so far with you.

Thanks for reading,

Robbie

story:
Overview

Berfrois is a literary-intellectual online magazine featuring essays, poems and curiosities. We want Berfrois to remain publicly funded and free of advertisements for another year.

What is Berfrois?

Berfrois is a literary-intellectual online magazine featuring essays, poems and curiosities. It is published daily.

What We Need

We need $20,000 of funding to continue publication for another year. 

The Results

Berfrois will remain publicly funded and free of advertisements. We will also redesign the Berfrois website this year.

Other Ways You Can Help

Tell your friends, tell your family, tell your neighbours. Cheers.
