story:
IMPORTANT UPDATE, JULY 1, 2019! Please be sure to read our latest campaign update with important information about shipping dates. The books have been delayed for a number of unforeseen reasons, and we expect to ship them in late 2019. All other perks are shipping THIS WEEK!

Explore the Essential Teachings of Sri Amritananda Natha Saraswati

Sri Amritananda Natha Saraswati (1934-2015), widely known as “Guruji,” was a top nuclear scientist managing missile defense projects in India. Beginning in the late 1970s, he experienced a series of dramatic spiritual visions that eventually led him to abandon his career and become a teacher and guru in Hinduism’s Goddess-centered Sri Vidya tradition. Upon discovering the remains of an ancient Goddess shrine in the jungles of eastern India in 1983, he revived and expanded it, opening it to the public as Devipuram in 1994.

My name is Michael Bowden. I am an attorney, writer and publisher, and the compiler and editor of Gifts from the Goddess: Selected Words of Sri Amritananda Natha Saraswati. Working with Guruji, I authored his biography, The Goddess and the Guru, which published in 2017, supported by an extremely successful crowdfunding campaign. Gifts from the Goddess is a follow-up and companion volume--again, edited and compiled with Guruji’s direct input and involvement. The book presents a broad and generous selection of Guruji’s major, lesser-known, and never-before-seen works, together comprising a startlingly original and eye-opening primary sourcebook--laying out, in engaging, accessible prose, the deepest, most secret and closely guarded traditions of authentic Sri Vidya Hindu Tantra.

Where This Book Came From

One day in the mid-oughts, Guruji, knowing of my background in editorial and publications work, showed me an astonishing manuscript called Understanding Sri Chakra Puja. He had composed it more than a decade earlier, but it was never quite finished, he said. Guruji asked me to help him complete it.

The draft, he explained, had been written in 1993-94, with an American woman named Devi Parvati acting as both interviewer and scribe. They worked on the book together until early 1994, at which point Guruji became enmeshed in the minutiae of running the newly opened Devipuram, and Devi Parvati had to return to America. In those pre-Internet, pre-cellphone days, the two soon fell out of touch--and Understanding Sri Chakra Puja was left unfinished.

In the late 1990s, a massive computer crash at Devipuram caused Guruji to lose many of his early writings and other precious documents. Among the casualties was the original manuscript of Understanding Sri Chakra Puja. He eventually found a copy in PDF format and asked a young devotee to convert it back into MS Word. The young man did so, but in the process, many sentences, paragraphs and sections of the document--including many mantras--were either dropped entirely or scrambled out of sequence.

Guruji noticed the problem immediately, but had no time to fix it himself and could find no one else to do the job. Eventually copies of the draft leaked and began circulating among Guruji’s followers in various forms.

But Guruji still wanted to get it right. And that, he told me, is where I could be of assistance.

Reconstruction and Expansion

Over the next few years, Guruji and I worked slowly through Understanding Sri Chakra Puja, gradually restoring its original form. Along the way, I also began assisting him with editing and preserving some of his other writings and lectures. The more I read of his work, the more I felt it deserved a wider audience. I eventually suggested that a selection of his writings should be compiled with Understanding Sri Chakra Puja into a comprehensive selection in book form.

And the seed of the present volume was born.

Gifts from the Goddess includes writings and lectures from Guruji’s earliest (and arguably, most intense and vivid) days of spiritual teaching, while he was still a working nuclear scientist, and continues on to later gems written not long before his death. Among the many rarities in this volume are his powerful writings on the Ten Mahavidyas (“Great Wisdom Goddesses”) of Tantric tradition, a collection also known as the “Lusaka Notes”--works that even lifelong devotees have difficulty sourcing. Here, for the first time, they are presented in their entirety, augmented with later updates and additions by Guruji.

The Quality of Guruji’s Work

Guruji lived very much in the present moment. Once a lecture was delivered, an essay written, a ritual perfected, he did not linger for long in its glow, but immediately moved on to new challenges.

His manner of expressing himself was genuine and original. He was an evocative writer and a natural teacher with a compassionate, compelling and practical message that, I am confident, will genuinely benefit many people on many different spiritual paths. Over time, I came to view him as a quiet but profound game-changer, a true iconoclast, a living exemplar of the ancient archetype of the jivanmukta—the enlightened being living in the world. (In fairness, this is a claim he has never made, to my knowledge. Quite the contrary: “I don’t accept any claims of me being a realized soul,” he once said. “To me, material and spiritual are all the same. There is only one realized soul. That is God. And you are it.”)

For Guruji, it was always about his students, always about teaching and sharing understanding. That ethic and dedication to radical honesty, transparency and accessibility for all exudes from this collection.

Going It Alone

When, with Guruji’s help and guidance, I initially completed the drafts to his biography, The Goddess and the Guru, and his collected works, Gifts from the Goddess, I presented formal proposals and sample chapters from both to a wide range of commercial publishers.

The biographical portion, The Goddess and the Guru, received some compliments for its artistic and literary merit and presentation, but no commercial publisher saw any serious potential in it: “Who would buy it?” they asked. “This Guruji just isn’t well-known enough.” The Gifts from the Goddess part, however--that is, the writings--got a lot of nibbles. Two major “Eastern spirituality” publishers, in particular, were interested in publishing Guruji’s writings without the biography. One mainly wanted just the sexiest, most provocative “Tantric” stuff. The second publisher was kinder and more evenhanded, but still wanted to stick with affirmations and inspirational writings. The rest, the reviewing editor told me, would have to be “dumbed down, frankly”: it was simply “too authentic” to be palatable to a mass audience.

The bottom line? To publish Guruji's writings commercially, we would have to give up on his intended and clearly stated vision--not to mention a huge amount of control over content, presentation, quality, etc. With the approach we are taking now, Guruji’s work remains in the control of Devipuram and Guruji’s followers.

And that is the reason for this campaign. We need to pull together and make this happen in a form that Guruji would recognize and approve. Yes, it’s a lot more work, and involves a lot more financial risk--but if we succeed, we’ll end up with the book that Guruji envisioned, the unadulterated teachings he wanted to share with the world, and an enduring legacy work to pass down for generations to come.

So it’s all up to us: Guruji’s friends, admirers, supporters, fans and disciples. If we don’t make this happen, no one else will. I’m working with the same editorial, design and production team in Canada that produced The Goddess and the Guru, and those of you who backed the first campaign know what high quality we were able to produce. We’ve done it once, and we can do it again. See more of what we created together in this video of the hardcover of The Goddess and the Guru:

Please support this support as generously as you can. All proceeds will be invested into the book’s design, materials, printing and distribution, and to furthering Guruji’s work at Devipuram and beyond. Together we can fulfill his vision.

The Other Contributors

In addition to Guruji’s writings, Gifts from the Goddess includes an array of extras to enhance and inform your experience of Guruji’s work, including:

A special introductory note from Sri Annapurna (Guruji Amma), Guruji’s wife of 58 years.

A powerful foreword, “Performing a Successful Transplant,” by Sri Uma-Parvathinanda Natha Saraswati, one of the most revered modern teachers in Guruji’s lineage.

 

Plus touching and inspiring perspectives from teachers of Guruji’s methods around the world:

Balasingam Janahan, an early disciple and practicing Vedic priest (United States).

Sundari Amma, Guruji’s sister-in-law and first disciple (India).

Sergey Babkin, a one-time Russian paratrooper, now a translator and teacher of Guruji’s work in the former USSR (Russia).

Venu Shyama (Mani), a prolific performer and teacher of Guru’s rituals (India and worldwide).

William Thomas, one of Guruji’s first Western disciples, and a longtime teacher (U.S. and Europe).

Janice Craig, a California-based yoga teacher who has adapted Guruji’s techniques for Westerners (United States).

Uma Prabha Menon, an early disciple and teacher (India and worldwide).

 

The Rewards

Of course, the biggest perk of backing this campaign is access to the first-edition paperback of the volume, as well as a beautiful special edition hardcover. And check out the stretch goals for all the extras we want to add to the hardcover! We’re also making a commemorative bookmark available to all backers.

For those who missed the first campaign, we’re also offering the chance to get all the perks from the hardcover level of that campaign—including the special stretch goal items! That includes:

  • An original first edition hardcover of The Goddess and the Guru, with a fronticepiece signed by Guruji Amma.
  • A small piece of one of Guruji’s favorite shawls.
  • A commemorative bookmark from volume 1.
  • A postcard of a Sri Chakra drawing by Guruji.
  • A postcard of Guruji.

We’ll be printing another 6" x 8" art print, this time a beautiful shot of Devipuram at night, by Oleg Zinkovetsky.

Copies of the full-color, large-format hardcover art book Amrita Bindu Book of Quotes, and a DVD of the documentary film on Guruji by celebrated director Raja Choudhary.

Copies of Shakti Rising: Embracing Shadow and Light on the Goddess Path to Wholeness, signed by the author, Kavitha M. Chinnaiyan.

Rare hardcover special first editions of The Recognition Sutras: Illuminating a 1,000-Year-Old Spiritual Masterpiece by Christopher D. Wallis, usually available only direct from the author.

 

Stretch goals!

During the campaign, I set some stretch goals. We didn't reach all of them, but in order to have this volume match the quality of the first, I am funding some of the higher ones myself. The following will be included in this book:

  • Both the hardcover and softcover editions will have foil stamping on the cover.
  • The end papers of the hardcovers will be printed.
  • The hardcovers will include an illustrated frontispiece, signed by me and by Sri Uma-Parvathinanda Natha Saraswati..
  • Both the hardcovers and softcovers will include a full-color glossy photo insert.
  • Both the hardcovers and softcovers will include two-color interior printing (black and red).

Trouble with your contribution?

We’ve gotten some reports of people outside the USA having their credit cards declined. I have been in touch with Indiegogo about this, and they've asked that if anyone has this problem, you please contact them directly at indiegogo.com/contact so that they can figure out what the exact problem is and hopefully help you. I will also accept direct contributions by Paypal of $250 and up and transfer them into the campaign myself. Send your contribution using the friends and family option (this is important so I don’t get double charged when I move your donation into Indiegogo) to mbowden@rwu.edu, and be sure to include what perk you want and your shipping address!

 

Questions?

Got a question about something not covered here? Send an email to michaelmbowden@gmail.com.

 

Thank you for your support!

story:
A Seat at the Table: Women, Diplomacy, and Lessons for the World shares the impact of gender diversified leadership in diplomacy. I wrote it to share why both genders are needed at the table to usher in peaceful solutions for our countries and the world. With your help, the book will publish in April 2020. #DiplomacyTable

About “A Seat at the Table: Women, Diplomacy, and Lessons for the World”

With interviews from female diplomats spanning all the regions of the world, this book shares intimate details of tough decisions, the art of diplomacy, and how to step up through your own unique leadership style. 

My name is Susan Sloan and I am the author of A Seat at the Table: Women, Diplomacy, and Lessons for the World. I wrote this book because I believe better solutions for our countries come from having both genders represented at the table.

The goal of diplomacy is to use the tip of the sword to thwart conflict and bring peaceful solutions. I aim to show why diverse voices around the table lead to stronger resolutions, enhanced team dynamics, and international cooperation for security. 

Through reading A Seat at the Table: Women, Diplomacy, and Lessons for the World, you will discover the intimate world of diplomacy. In the pages, I hope to instill the same passion that I have for diplomacy and gender equality in you. Ultimately, you will be able to use this book as a tool for leadership lessons and a mentorship guide.

In this book, you'll learn from female diplomatic leaders spanning Afghanistan, Albania, Australia, Austria, Croatia, Denmark, Finland, Hungary, Iceland, Kosovo, Kurdistan Regional Government, Mexico, Namibia, Singapore, Sweden, the U.S., and more. Personal insights are from Ambassadors, Deputy Chiefs of Mission, diplomats, and government officials discussing:

  • Coalition and Consensus Building
  • Embracing Your Unique Voice
  • Achieving a Career and Family
You will love this book if you want to learn from vibrant, strong, smart, independent women in the diplomatic corps who are changing the world. A Seat at the Table: Women, Diplomacy, and Lessons for the World is a non-fiction book that speaks to people who believe in gender equality, aspiring and current foreign service officers, and foreign policy wonks who are looking for mentorship and how to rise in the ranks to create a better world.

The Book A Seat at the Table: Women, Diplomacy, and Lessons for the World

The book is written in four parts.

Part I Diplomacy: The Short and Long of it
Prologue + Chapters 1-4 share an overview of the history and personal anecdotes of how women in diplomacy have grown and the issues for the next horizon.

Part II Power: Voices Around a Table
Chapters 5-8 explore the power of voices around the table and how to create coalitions while embracing your uniqueness and harnessing emotional intelligence. 

Part III Stability: Diversity Builds Peace
Chapters 9-12 look at inclusiveness and the art of relationship building by raising your profile. 

Part IV Balance: Personal vs. Professional Life 
Chapters 13-16 describe the infamous balancing act of personal versus professional life, managing tough decisions, achieve a family while having a career, and finding the ultimate balance.

How to Help Make it Happen

This book will be published with New Degree Press. We set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing the book. Money raised will go towards the following:
  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April 2020.
  • The cover design of my book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copyediting for the book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch and promotion efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this spring.
With your help...
100 pre-sell copies = the book gets published
150 pre-sell copies = an audiobook gets published 
200 pre-sell copies = the hardcover edition gets published 
The goal of the pre-sell = getting the book published! 

Here are some exclusive rewards for folks who pre-order the book now:
  • You will receive a personally signed copy of the book when I publish
  • A personal thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your name will appear in a special acknowledgments section of the book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the introduction and parts of the manuscript, with options to review it and give early feedback
  • The opportunity to help select the book cover design
  • And more

About the Author

Susan Sloan is writing her first book about women in diplomacy and why gender parity will usher in the next wave for peace and security. During the workweek, she is the Associate Regional Director for a global advocacy organization in Washington, D.C. She has met with more than 60 countries through diplomacy, advocacy, and experiential education. Susan's interactive approach to communications and coalition-building has impacted groups around the world. She represents the agency with diplomats, government officials, community organizers, and international leaders. 

Across the United States and eight countries, Susan previously worked for a travel organization where she created a framework for multicultural experiential learning. Before visiting all seven continents, Susan hailed from Atlanta, Georgia. She holds a master's degree in Global Strategic Communications from Georgetown University and graduated Magna Cum Laude with a bachelor's degree in Journalism with a major in Public Relations and a minor in Spanish from the University of Georgia.

When she’s not writing, you can find Susan in her urban garden, cooking something delicious, and exploring hidden gems in D.C.

For more information, you can connect with Susan at susansloan76@gmail.com and LinkedIn.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically mailing the book to you. We have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Unable to pre-order the book? You can still help!
  • Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family, and network. Please use #DiplomacyTable and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.
  • Share this Pre-Sale Campaign Page as well with anyone who you think might be interested in the topic
  • Send a text message or Direct Message on social media about the book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. 

Thank you for all your support!

Cheers to diplomacy,
Susan

Our Story

Kind Writers is an ambition brought together by our founder, Sophia Apodaca, a poet, writer, and kind human who wants to spread kindness. We are dedicated to bringing the acts of kindness from our artists to the forefront.

Our team includes an eclectic group of artists that work to make a positive difference in our world. In addition to being writers, many on our team are also educators, tutors, and volunteers.

Our Steps to Publication

Our goal is spreading kindness within and outside our community of artists. We accept submissions from all over the world to ensure that everyone has the opportunity to be represented.

We work hard to review submissions, create goals to spread our message, and get involved with our community. Thanks to our IndieGoGo contributors we published our first issue in Spring|Fall 2020. We are working diligently to publish our second issue this summer. We need your help to make it possible!

Join Us

We ask for your support in funding the second Kind Writers publication. Your contribution will aid our journey of spreading kindness through diverse works of art and literature. With your help we will be able to fund the costs of initial publication, Submittable membership, rewards for our writing contests, and future publications. Lend your support now and become an advocate for spreading kindness in a world that desperately needs it!

Donation Perks

$5 - Kind Writers Bookmarks

$10 - 2 Postcard Sets for a Total of 8 Postcards

$20 - Spring|Fall 2021 Print Issue and Digital Copy

$40 - Summer 2021 + Spring|Fall 2020 Print Issues + 4 Bookmarks + 4 Postcards

            *Further details of perks are included in their descriptions.

Become Part of our Community

We understand that these are difficult times. If you are looking for a non-monetary way to support our journey, please follow us on our social platforms. Help spread kindness today!

Instagram: @Kind_Writers

Twitter: @KindWriters

Facebook: @KindWriters

story:
Short Summary

23 Miles and Running—The amazing, inspirational, and uplifting story of a young boy who grew up chopping cotton in the Mississippi Delta and ended up sleeping in the White House.

My name is Ty Pinkins, and I am the author of 23 Miles and Running. I wrote this book to share the amazing account of a kid’s inspirational journey around the world. I was born in the small town of Rolling Fork, Mississippi, literally yards from a cotton field. After giving birth at 15, mom quit school to take care of me while dad worked as a tractor driver on a cotton farm. I grew up on cotton farms.

We moved from plantation to plantation, depending on where dad found work. When I was around 13 years old, he shook me awake early one morning before the sun rose. I climbed on to the back of an old beat-up truck with men twice my age. After driving several miles, the old truck stopped. We all climbed off and stood in the middle of a long dirt road. As the sun began to peek over the horizon, we stared silently at the seemingly never-ending rows and rows of freshly grown cotton—still moist with the morning dew.

Chopping cotton was grueling—back-breaking work. I did it throughout my teenage years to help my parents take care of me. Even at such a young age, I knew it was difficult for my parents—I wanted to carry my own weight. There were times when those cotton fields nearly broke me down. However, over time, I realized how that experience actually built me up! It prepared me for the incredible journey ahead.

In this book, I share that journey—with a deep sense of humility and realization that I am not an anomaly. Just as there were many others like me walking those rows of cotton back then, still today, there are many children in the Mississippi Delta growing up in poverty.

I hope that this book will be an inspiration to you and anyone else struggling to overcome adversity and help you discover that light within yourself to help you get back up when you’ve been knocked down. In this book, I hope to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for overcoming obstacles. I want you to see this book as a tool to help you take that next step forward when you feel like you’re too tired to keep going; and ultimately, face your next challenge with an anxious smile, knowing that through positive energy, you’ve already won.

In this book, you'll learn about overcoming adversity and living life to its fullest—like dancing as if no one is watching:

  • Growing up in the Mississippi Delta
  • Sailing Across the East China Sea
  • Flying Aboard Air Force One

You will love this book if you enjoy a true story of overcoming adversity when life has dealt you a shitty hand, and the cards are stacked against you.

23 Miles and Running is a non-fiction book that speaks to the underdog and people in society who are facing seemingly insurmountable odds.

 

The Book - 23 Miles and Running

The book is written in three parts:

Part 1 contains the introduction and Chapters 1-8. Born in the belly of poverty and chopping cotton in the Mississippi Delta to help my parents pay the bills, I’ll discuss the time when I was 12-years-old and assembled an old bike; and without a seat, I road door-to-door asking people for my first job. I’ll also discuss my first time climbing onto the back of an old truck with men twice my age to head to the cotton fields. Additionally, I will discuss how a lanky white guy from Indiana, traveled over 650 miles to small-town Rolling Fork, Mississippi to lead a team of kids to the state high school basketball championship, and how that moment built so much hope and positive energy in those kids.

Part 2 contains Chapters 9-11. This part discusses my transition from Mississippi when I joined the Army and was shipped off to Bootcamp. It will discuss the 13 years I spent in Europe as well as the challenges I faced and the friendships I made during three combat tours. In this chapter, I will share my experiences of letting go of my fears and traveling across Europe without a care in the world—ending up intentionally lost in places like London, Austria, and Germany.

Part 3 contains Chapters 12-16. This part takes us to Okinawa, Japan, and on a voyage across the East China sea. It follows my amazing journey from that tiny island to the White House and beyond. In this section, I’ll share with you the importance of never giving up and that no dream is too big—reach beyond the stars. I will share how a chance encounter led to me working for the President of the United States, sleeping in the White House and flying on Air Force One.

 

What We Need & What You Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in February 2020
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for My Book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this winter
  • A portion of the proceeds will go to a nonprofit organization dedicated to helping youth from underserved communities in the Mississippi Delta

When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish
  • A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share the experiences of writing my book
  • And more...

 

About the Author

Ty Pinkins is a retired Army Officer who served 21 years in the military—including three combat tours. He is the co-founder and President of the Pyramid Project youth organization which is a nonprofit organization dedicated to exposing youth from underserved communities to the social, cultural, and economic capital necessary for them to fulfill their dreams. Ty earned his law degree from Georgetown University.

Ty wrote this book because there are so many kids in the Mississippi Delta who are still growing up in poor, poverty-stricken, underserved communities like the one from which he came. He is passionate about helping people who feel like the odds are stacked against them. He hopes that this book will provide hope for those who feel left behind and let them know that they are not alone. When they read his story, he wants them to know that “I am you, and you are me.”

In his spare time, Ty enjoys long-distance running, reading, traveling, and allowing himself to get lost in new cultures. His friends describe him as caring, daring, and a true adventurer.

For more information, you can connect with Ty via email at ty@typinkins.com; Facebook (@Ty Pinkins); Instagram (@typinkins); and Twitter (@typinkins).

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family, and network. Please use #23MilesAndRunning and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts
  • You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
  • Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much for all of your love and support!

All the best,
Ty Pinkins

story:
Short Summary

The Overcomer is about how successful entrepreneurs use fear as a catalyst for success in all areas of life. Unfortunately, most of us don’t have the luxury of having our opportunities handed to us on a silver platter at day one. In fact, the most successful entrepreneurs start with nothing. What makes them different from the rest? They achieve their ultimate success with a proven formula: determination, hard work, and a passionate vision.

My name is DeDee Cai, and I am the author of The Overcomer. I want to inspire my fellow entrepreneurs, no matter where you are in your journey, to own your voice. You can pursue your purpose and create a massive impact on the world while flourishing as your authentic, imperfect self.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover that you are more powerful than you ever imagined. I hope to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for overcoming fears and challenges. Ultimately, I want you to see The Overcomer as a tool to help you realize your true unique potential.

In this book, you'll learn…

  • The cheat codes to unlearn your fear as quickly as you learned it.
  • How some of the most successful entrepreneurs became successful by embracing their fears, and how you can too.
  • How one woman broke a cycle of five generations of domestic violence just by re-writing her story.
  • How another woman transformed her life by curing her own depression, anxiety, and fear.

 

If you love self-development, entrepreneurship, and care about leaving a legacy of positive impact, this is a book you will cherish for life.

The Overcomer is a nonfiction book that speaks to business owners, and self-development junkies who want to look at fear and success in a new way.

 

The Book - The Overcomer

This book is split into three value-packed parts that will guide you on your journey to finding your authentic self.

Part 1: The first three chapters and introduction will teach you about the history of fear, what sets the overcomer apart, and why NOW is the ideal time to have a conversation around how we can embrace fear for our own success.

Part 2: In chapters four through nine, you’ll get an in-depth view of the overcomer’s characteristics, and the principles they live by. You’ll witness stories of growth and transformation showing exactly how the overcomer takes on challenges in life and business.

Part 3: In chapters ten through thirteen, you’ll explore the journey of an overcomer, and be challenged to follow along in your own life. You’ll see how anyone can overcome any adversity while rewriting their destiny.

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in August, 2021.
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this Fall 2021.

 

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.

 

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally-signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.

And much more!

 

About the Author

DeDee Cai is the founder and head performance coach of FIT TO PROFIT (FTP), a company that utilizes psychology, cognitive science, holistic wellness, and business to get entrepreneurs mentally fit to attain a peak level of performance in their businesses. With over thirteen years of experience in running her own businesses in the brick and mortar, health and wellness industry, DeDee married her love for living an optimal lifestyle and business to create FTP. She believes that your self-worth is your net worth, and she’s on a mission to empower women to be financially independent by building wealth from the inside out.

Her close friends and family would describe DeDee as being ambitious, determined, and fearless. Her mom often jokes that although she always wanted a boy, she would never trade DeDee for another kid. She often says “ten boys would not measure up to one DeDee.”

DeDee wrote this book to remind everyone that you are more powerful than you ever imagined. Her mission is to transform as many lives as possible creating the ripple effect she wants to see in the world.

Besides running her coaching and consulting business, DeDee is a momma of two, a yoga enthusiast and a self-development junkie. She’s also into golf, ballroom dancing, traveling, and long distance running.

For more information, you can connect with DeDee Cai at dedee@fittoprofit.com, and on social media via the following platforms.

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/dkngn;
LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/dedee-cai-468033167/
 

International Preorders

For international preorders, please send me a private message.
 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer; specifically, my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help.

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #theovercomer and tag me, as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so that we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via IndieGoGo at the top of the page.

Please share my book with five friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
DeDee Cai

story:
The Accordion Babes Pin-Up Calendar is edited by Renee de la Prade, who is a professional accordion-player... she teams up with 12 other indie artists to produce a calendar and CD  celebrating accordion-playing women. It's a glossy 12" x 12" wall calendar, designed to resemble a classic LP. The calendar features sexy photos of lady accordionists, plus a CD with 13 tracks. There is one song from each artist in the calendar; plus one for the Cover Babe; the lovely Joana Reis from Portugal.

The art concept is loosely based on 1940's pin-up portraits, but with accordions. The CD is a fun mix of music, from indie/pop, to folk, Cajun, country, rock, waltzes, a dash of polka... every song featuring accordion in the mix; and contributed by a woman who is featured in the calendar. There are a lot of great bands to discover here.

The 2020 artists are: Joana Reis (cover), LynnMarie (January), Mishkin Fitzgerald (February), Susan Hwang (March), Renee de la Prade (April), Calvaleigh Rasmussen (May), Debra Peters (June), Sarah Savoy (July), Wendy Fitz (August), Skyler Fell (September) Aurelia Cohen (October), Miss Natasha Enquist (November), and Meredith Pangrace (December.)

We need $7,000 to cover CD and calendar printing, graphic design, album mastering, and prize-mailing.

Of course we love it if you pre-order a calendar, but there are more things in this campaign which you should know about. There are special prize-packs with merch from some of the artists ( indie music CD's, T-shirts, etc.) Some of the prize-packs come with handmade earrings or hand-dyed clothes... you can also order autographed calendars. There's a chance to advertise for your business on the back page. Calendar sets are offered for people who want to buy copies for themselves and as presents for friends. Larger orders are available for accordion clubs and music shops; or for anybody who's excited enough about the project to order a large box of them. Folks who don't have lots of money can get a thank-you postcard from an Accordion Babe for $5.

If we earn fewer funds than our goal, we'll do a smaller print run, but we'll still deliver all the calendars and prizes. The 2020 edition is the 11th Accordion Babes Pin-Up Calendar.

There are some great side-benefits which have come around from publishing the calendar over the years; a network of Accordion Babes is being born, with artists who are connected to each other on three continents. The calendar is redefining "sexy" in a feminist, fun, body-positive way... showing women who love music, who are brave and powerful and sensual; and celebrating their art and their personalities. 


Please help us share the campaign. With about 150-200 pre-orders, we can easily pay for the full print-run. If you know an accordionist, they should DEFINITELY find out about this calendar! Thanks for helping us spread the word online... on Facebook, in accordion forums, wherever you think people want to know about us.

story:
"People populate the darkness; with ghosts, with gods, with electrons, with tales. People imagine, and people believe: and it is that belief, that rock-solid belief, that makes things happen." -from American Gods, by Neil Gaiman

My "Dark" Story

It was late summer, Paris, 2008. I had just finished five Stephen King novels and the Twilight Series and Neil Gaiman's American Gods. I was a professional blogger, writing art marketing tips for artists. But in the mornings, a story was blooming in me. A dark man in the woods of Western New York. The Wild Hunt roaming the skies. And a creature - half-woman, half-bird, that came to me out of a real ghost story from the region of a half-woman, half-horse ghost that sometimes appears on a hill in the Finger Lakes. And the mortals who have unknowingly called them there, searching for something WILD in themselves. 


I started writing my story and simultaneously researching the creatures that were appearing in my head. Many of them related eerily back to the Gods and Fairies of ancient Ireland and I realized that I was somehow tapping into the collection consciousness. It thrilled me.


For the next two months I wrote every day until a first draft was completed.


Since then I have done a lot of research on the heroes and Gods of Ancient Ireland, the flora and fauna of Upstate New York, and even spent a week in September 2010 in the Naples valley where it takes place. Two months ago I moved back to the area permanently, partly to really get my hooks into the setting of this story. But it still needs a lot of rewriting and some professional guidance. As a professional editor, I can look at it and honestly say that what it needs is the space and time a writing residency would afford me.


So I applied and sample I submitted was good enough to get me into the Vermont Studio Center, a prestigious writing residency in Johnson Vermont, for May 2011. This would allow me a month to focus solely on my creative writing instead of my freelance nonfiction writing and my editing work. It would allow me to be among other writers - I have been very isolated from people for the past 3 years because of the financial struggles of having my own business in this economic climate.


GO TO THE GALLERY TO READ A RECENT DRAFT OF PART OF THE NOVEL.


The Impact

I am a published poet and short fiction writer but I really feel that my best work will be my completed novel. It will combine paranormal romance with philosophical explorations of what it means to desire to "lose oneself." I like to think of it as a cross between Neil Gaiman and Milan Kundera. I value readability and entertainment and will focus my efforts on making the story unforgettable.


I have been writing and publishing my work since I was 15. I have studied with some incredible writers and once upon a time thought I would be one of them. But working as an editor every day has really made it hard to be the creative person I need to be in my off-time.


I think I have what it takes to make a really beautiful, lush novel that will thrill and intrigue readers. I just need some time, community support, and financial support to do it. And the added confidence that this will bring.


What I Need & What You Get

The problem I am facing is that even after being awarded grant money, the cost for the month at the Vermont Studio Center is still $1,950. I need to come up with at least $950.00 by April 8. The rest can be paid in monthly installments.


This is what I can offer you in terms of perks: a copy of the book when it is published, thank yous in the dedication of the book, brief tutorials in how to submit your own work for publication (this is one of my professional services), or having a character named after you (for really big donations). 


My Publications

Poetry

“Mary, Mary” and “Nietzsche,” Contemporary Rhyme, November 2007 (electronic)

“bees,” Grasslimb Journal, March 2008 (print)

“October,” Electric Velocipede September 2009 (print/electronic)


Short Fiction

         “Faithless” and “AC/DC,” Dark Reveries Magazine, Feb. 2007 (electronic)
         “Gravity is Weak” and “Why Do You Read Literary Theory,” 21 Stars Review, Feb. 2007 (electronic)
         “Pee.” Swill, July 2007 (print)
         “If There is No One to Listen…” and “AC/DC,” Twisted Tongue Magazine, Issue 7, August 2007. (print/electronic)


Nonfiction

"A Bird in the Hand." Follow Your Bliss, Jan. 2011 (electronic)


Other Ways You Can Help

Tweet it, facebook it, email it, share it with others. If you'd like to check out my writing first, go to : http://ninaalvarez.net.

story:
ABOUT THE SERIES

I’m raising money to launch a comprehensive publicity campaign to promote, distribute, and otherwise introduce Leoros to the world. THE EMERALD TABLET is book 1 of 7 in the LEGENDS OF AMUN RA series.

THE EMERALD TABLET is published by Enchanted Forest Press. Because we’re still in the editing phase, we’re not exactly sure how many pages it will end up being, because it depends on layout. However, we anticipate the book will be between 400 – 450 pages long.

I wrote THE EMERALD TABLET because I wanted to write the type of books I loved when I was a kid. I loved the Star Trek and Star Wars Universes; I loved murder mysteries and thrillers (and I still do), I also loved the comic book series Thor, which dealt with Norse mythology. My father introduced me to ancient Egypt and Greece and I fell in love with their mythologies as well. I wanted to combine everything I loved into one heart pounding series.

But most of all, I wanted to explore the human psyche a little. What makes a person good? What makes a person bad? As a fan of science fiction, I loved Darth Vader, but I also wanted to know what led him down the path of the dark side and what made Luke Skywalker strong enough not to succumb to the dark side’s temptations?

I wanted my characters to have to face their fears, overcome their weaknesses, and HAVE to step up to win. I also wanted to write a book that appealed to young adults to get them into writing just as much as a grown adult. Remember, YA is a point of view, not a reading level. I often re-read the stories I read when I was younger.

I have big plans for little Leoros and his gang.  I’m hoping a launch of book 2 in around summer, 2013.

Throughout the seven books, Leoros and Atlantia will go from 13 year olds just learning the world, into young adulthood, and emerging as a grown men and women the climactic battle of book 7.

WHAT WE NEED SUPPORT WITH

Here’s how we’ve structured the marketing campaign:

  • Targeted Ads
  • Email campaign
  • Wholesale book purchases for resale & local stores
  • Local, national, and world-wide media campaign
  • Bookstore tour for readings and signings
  • Fan con presence for direct sales to our best audience

WHAT YOU'LL GET

I want the perks for you to be as personal and meaningful to you as LEGENDS OF AMUN RA is to me so please check out the benefits for the pledge amounts.

THE BIGGER PICTURE

I write stories that I think are interesting and that say something about our society, our nature as people, and that will hopefully relate to readers at a fundamental level. This means writing from the heart, and always learning more about humanity, psychology, storytelling, and the mechanics of being an author. There’s a lot of passion that goes into what I write, but there’s just as much a sense that I’m working my craft.

HERE WHY YOU'LL LOVE ATLANTIA AND LEOROS:

(the main characters in the series)

Leoros is a kid who grew up immersed in comic book lore and science fiction. His parents make him travel the world due to their jobs and he has little friends so most of his time is spent alone. He thinks he knows what it takes to be a hero because he reads about them, but he’s unprepared for the realities of war and the extent of the sacrifice necessary to rise above his fears.

Atlantia is a helot, or slave who comes from the district of Messenia on the planet Potara. As a slave, she is treated with no respect and often the subject of jokes. Her small size makes her easy to pick on. But Atlantia has a secret that she won't tell anyone.

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

Even a dollar can help! But if you’d like to help in some other way:

  • Click “LIKE “ on my Facebook page
  • Follow me on Twitter and RT and reply! I love to interact with other users
  • Share on Indigogo
  • Order a book and pass it on, or donate it to your local library

Thank you everyone in advance for your generosity and support!

*Perks Disclaimer - I maintain all copyright and intellectual property rights in the name, character, and events of the short story.

I loved the Star Trek and Star Wars Universes; I loved murder mysteries and thrillers (and I still do), I also loved the comic book series Thor, which dealt with Norse mythology. My father introduced me to ancient Egypt and Greece and I fell in love with their mythologies as well. I wanted to combine everything I loved into one heart pounding series.
But most of all, I wanted to explore the human psyche a little. What makes a person good? What makes a person bad? As a fan of science fiction, I loved Darth Vader, but I also wanted to know what led him down the path of the dark side and what made Luke Skywalker strong enough not to succumb to the dark side’s temptations?
I wanted my characters to have to face their fears, overcome their weaknesses, and HAVE to step up to win. I also wanted to write a book that appealed to young adults to get them into writing just as much as a grown adult. Remember, YA is a point of view, not a reading level. I often re-read the stories I read when I was younger.
I have big plans for little Leoros and his gang.  I’m hoping a launch of book 2 in around summer, 2013.
Throughout the seven books, Leoros and Atlantia will go from 13 year olds just learning the world, into young adulthood, and emerging as a grown men and women the climactic battle of book 7.
WHAT WE NEED SUPPORT WITH
Here’s how we’ve structured the marketing campaign:

Targeted Ads
Email campaign
Wholesale book purchases for resale & local stores
Local, national, and world-wide media campaign
Bookstore tour for readings and signings
Fan con presence for direct sales to our best audience
WHAT YOU'LL GET
I want the perks for you to be as personal and meaningful to you as LEGENDS OF AMUN RA is to me so please check out the benefits for the pledge amounts.
THE BIGGER PICTURE
I write stories that I think are interesting and that say something about our society, our nature as people, and that will hopefully relate to readers at a fundamental level. This means writing from the heart, and always learning more about humanity, psychology, storytelling, and the mechanics of being an author. There’s a lot of passion that goes into what I write, but there’s just as much a sense that I’m working my craft.
HERE WHY YOU'LL LOVE ATLANTIA AND LEOROS: 
(the main characters in the series)
Leoros is a kid who grew up immersed in comic book lore and science fiction. His parents make him travel the world due to their jobs and he has little friends so most of his time is spent alone. He thinks he knows what it takes to be a hero because he reads about them, but he’s unprepared for the realities of war and the extent of the sacrifice necessary to rise above his fears.
Atlantia is a helot, or slave who comes from the district of Messenia on the planet Potara. As a slave, she is treated with no respect and often the subject of jokes. Her small size makes her easy to pick on. But Atlantia has a secret that she won't tell anyone.
OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP
Even a dollar can help! But if you’d like to help in some other way:

Click “LIKE “ on my Facebook page
Follow me on Twitter and RT and reply! I love to interact with other users
Share on Indigogo
Order a book and pass it on, or donate it to your local library
Thank you everyone in advance for your generosity and support!
*Perks Disclaimer - I maintain all copyright and intellectual property rights in the name, character, and events of the short story.

UPDATE - NOVEMBER 24th

The designer will work on the book after the Thanksgiving holiday; we have not set a final completion date. The workbook is currently being edited with a December 7th deadline. The goal is a PUBLISHED book before the end of the year.

Would you like to learn how to create content that will get more likes on Facebook, more views on YouTube and more visitors to your blog? Would you like to get found more easily on Google?

My book, 62 Blog Posts to Overcome Blogger's Block, can help you do that and more. In addition to providing tips, tools and best practices on how to create high quality, engaging content, which will drive traffic back to your site; it will teach you how to brand yourself - through content - as an authority in your area of expertise.

These three things - content, traffic and branding - will ultimately boost your bottom line.

Don't let the title of the book fool you. Even though it says "blogger's block", it is for any content creator who wants more Facebook likes, YouTube views or blog visitors. Most importantly, it is for anyone who wants to be easily found on Google.

What Makes My Book Different?

  • It is the only book published to date that teaches you HOW to create quality content
  • It provides visual examples of each of the 62 types of posts
  • You get the combined knowledge of 55 content creators, in all areas of expertise, that have over 10 million global followers, including marketing genius Seth Godin, ProBlogger Darren Rowse, Melinda Emerson ~aka Small Biz Lady and wine connoisseur Gary Vaynerchuk 
  • The companion guide provides prompts that will help you generate content ideas for Facebook, YouTube and your blog

What We Need & What You Get

$2,850 is needed to cover the following costs

Final design of book and the editing and design of companion guide

$600

Print 100 copies of both books

$1600

Marketing and promotion

$250

Fees - credit card processing and IndieGoGo

$400

What You Get

What If We Exceed Our Fund-raising Goal?

Here are a few of my planned activities:

  • Invest in additional marketing activities – launch party, local book tours, bookmarks, book giveaways,  pens to accompany the companion guide
  • Print more books and donate a few to community technology programs, where we will conduct blog writing trainings
  • Conduct online and in-person workshops that will teach you how to create content which will get more Facebook likes, more YouTube views and more visitors to your blog, as well as help you get found on Google

More About Me

  • I'm a creative free spirit who love writing, blogging and photography

  • I'm a blog addict with four sites: Marcie Writes, Overcoming Blogger's Block, Shorty: Your Chicago South Side Resource, Real Skate Stories

  • My written published successes can be found in local, national and international publications including Toastmasters magazine, Chicago Independent Bulletin newspaper, St. Louis magazine

  • I’ve written guest posts for some of the largest blogging and writing sites, including ProBlogger and Write to Done

  • I’ve published two other eBooks, The ABCs of Blogging and The ABCS of Live Blogging, the only book ever written on this topic

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Share this campaign: post it on Facebook, tweet it on Twitter, email it to your family and friends, Pin it on Pinterest, share it in a LinkedIn update, make a YouTube video
  • Write about the campaign or the book on your blog
  • Write a review on Amazon
  • Like our Facebook Page
  • Spread the word to other bloggers and writers
THANKS FOR YOUR HELP!

story:
RUN AMOK BOOKS: OUR STORY

Run Amok Books is a small independent press located in Princeton, New Jersey. We published our first book in the fall of 2016. Since then, we have published 6 books, with 4 more slated for 2018 and 3 more already contracted for 2019. In a word, we are growing! And that is great news!

As we grow, so does our reputation. Each month, we find an increasing number of worthy submissions in our submissions in-box. True to our mandate, we strive to publish books that deserve to be published and that are routinely overlooked by the mainstream book industry.

THE ABUNDANT LIFE BY AARON JACOBS

It is difficult to express the excitement we felt at Run Amok when Aaron's submission popped up in our in-box. Here was a book that clearly fit our mandate: it was extremely well written, topically relevant, and funny--oh so funny! We were not surprised to learn that The Abundant Life had already gone the traditional publishing route. It had been sent by an eager New York agent to a well-known New York publishing house and had found its way onto an editor's desk. Impressed and excited, the editor pitched the book to the publisher, who after reviewing it did not hear that magical cha-ching of cash registers opening and so passed--said "no" to an excellent manuscript and talented author. But their loss was our gain, and we jumped at the chance to publish it.

OUR CHALLENGE

The challenge for us is that while our publication list has expanded with great books like Aaron's, our budget has not. This has left us to find new and innovative ways to find funding, ways like crowdfunding and Indiegogo. So what do we need more funds for? The truth is, making books these days can be done quite inexpensively. This is particularly true for Run Amok Books, as all the editing, formatting, and design is done in-house by dedicated Run Amok staff, who volunteer countless hours to projects they passionately believe in. What cannot be done by us is real advertising and promotion. Oh, we can and do send out countless emails to newspaper and magazine reviewers, and to bloggers and book lovers. But in the end, placing a print ad in Publishers Weekly or a digital ad online at The Rumpus or Foreword Reviews costs money. Having our books listed at Net Galley costs a lot of money, but it's money well spent, as a listing on Net Galley virtually guarantees that a book will be reviewed/discussed/buzzed by book bloggers, an essential part of the promotional equation. Just to give you a sense of the costs involved, below is a list  of the costs involved in the book promotion campaign we have planned for The Abundant Life.

  • print ad in Foreword Reviews (to coincide with the publication date): $475 - $1000
  • digital ad in literary e-zines (such as The Rumpus) fulfilled by Litbreaker: $300 - $450
  • Listing on Net Galley book review site: $450 - $700.
  • Social media campaign (twitter, facebook): $100 - $150
  • Total = $1,325 - 2,300

HOW YOU CAN HELP

We are hoping to raise about 70% of the promotional costs (about $1250) for The Abundant Life through crowdfunding. In order to give books like Aaron's the exposure they deserve, we are asking for public support, for your help. Keep in mind that there are many deserving books, like Aaron's, out there, written by many talented people--it could be a friend, a family member, the girl that sits beside you in Lit Theory 101, or the guy clicking away on his laptop in your local coffee shop--and we'd like to publish and promote as many of these books as possible. In order to do that, we're going to need additional funding. And that is where you come in. Please consider supporting this promotional campaign, and when you do, choose a perk--our way of saying "Thank You" for your support.

story:
Introducing Womanthology

Are you tired of reading articles that make women and girls feel bad about themselves? So are we.

Women and girls we spoke with told us that there’s too much in the media that makes them feel bad about themselves and not enough to make them feel good. So we decided to change this by creating a new type of magazine that challenges the status quo. It's about sharing a collection of Women's stories so we called it Womanthology.

Womanthology is a completely independent magazine. It has been put together without the benefit of any external funding or investment in order to create the magazine that women told us they wish existed. Independence has meant the freedom to break the traditional rules in the publishing industry and disrupt the space.

Sneak peak of previous articles

Curious to know what we write about? Here are some of the articles from our archives:

  • Tech entrepreneur, Sammy Payne, talks about using robotics to harness 3D printing technology in order to create ‘superabled’ bionic hands

  • Crane driver, Casey Elsby, talks about building gender balance in construction by positively viewing differences between men and women
  • Founder of My Family Care, Oliver Black, talks about breaking free of unconscious bias in childhood to help break the glass ceiling
  • Aeronautical Engineer and Ph.D. Researcher, Vibha Srivastava, talks about her work researching space architecture
  • Computer Scientist, Writer and Speaker, Dr. Sue Black, talks about her work celebrating the incredible codebreakers of Bletchley Park

This is just a small sample of our content. You can access our full content archives from our homepage.

Some highlights of Womanthology

  • Womanthology is entirely made up of first person content where incredible women (and supportive male champions of diversity) share their career stories, wisdom and knowledge about accelerating gender balance at work.

  • Our stories encourage our readers to reflect on their own career plans, hopes and ambitions.
  • Unlike regular women’s magazines, Womanthology is not about how you look, or how old you are. Traditional magazine segmentation keeps women of different ages apart. We want to bring them together.
  • Our stories have reached more than 200,000 readers and our social media shares have been seen more than 12.5 million times. We’ve come so far but there’s so much more to do and we need your pledges to keep growing.
  • In August 2014, Womanthology founder, Fiona Tatton, visited 10 Downing Street to discuss accelerating gender balance and support of women-led enterprise, having set up the magazine from her kitchen table in Sheffield.

Is it for me?

Are you passionate about getting to 50/50 in the workplace? Do you believe is doesn’t have to take decades to achieve? Do you want a better future for our daughters and our sons? If you answered  "YES!" to one of more of these questions then you belong in our community.

Womanthology was created for women like you, who value authentic perspectives and real experiences that help you grow and reflect on your career journey and where to take it next. You can find careers sections in regular women’s magazines but they are only a small part of the offer. Womanthology is all about sharing the career stories of real life women like you. There is no shortage of incredible women out there all around the world – we just don’t usually get to hear from them.

How your pledges will help

We've set a funding goal of £20,000 to help us grow, We need your pledges to fund us to curate and share more stories, and more opportunities for readers to be energised and informed. Each and every pledge you make helps us to reach more women and effect positive change.

  • Womanthology stories are free to access, but they take countless hours to research, curate and edit each month, and thousands of pounds to sustain each year.
  • Womanthology operates as an independent, mission-led business - the reason we exist is to speed up progress towards gender balance - so we’re coming to you for help.
  • We plan to use campaign proceeds for working capital. Campaign proceeds are what remain after costs and tax are deducted - we are registered for VAT (value-added tax) in the UK, which is included in the price of the perks where it’s applicable. It is important to us to be able to contribute to society and the economy through our operations.

But don't just take our word for it...

Here's some what some of the people who have pledged already have said about why Womanthology is so important to them:

"I'm proud to pledge to the campaign. Diversity faces its greatest challenge in a generation and now, more than ever, it's so urgent to project positive voices like Womanthology. The pace of change is not moving fast enough and without support will stall altogether."

Sian Dudley - Head of Marketing and Communications, Cast

 

"Womanthology has been consistent in providing fascinating insight into so many industries. Female lead stories, providing a well needed counterpoint to much of the world's media. Interesting women, doing interesting work in interesting industries. Good stories, well told."

Julia Dobson - Founder, Village England

 

Who we are

Fiona Tatton set up Womanthology as a hobby from her kitchen table in 2014 when she became frustrated that she couldn't find the type of stories she wanted to read without scouring the Internet and social media. She also wanted to hear directly from the women she admired in their own words and she wanted to give a voice to women who wouldn't always get a chance to share their ideas.

She realised that by using the power of the Internet and social media she could reach out to the women she respected most. So, she began to contact women in all kinds of roles - racing drivers, rocket scientists, surgeons, lawyers, mathematicians, athletes, entrepreneurs, mothers. The list grew and grew.

The daughter of an engineer, Fiona is passionate about giving the next generation of women the widest choice of careers.

The rewards

#IDidItAnyway Champion - £10

Your name will be featured in a special Womanthology article which showcases an #IDidItAnyway Wall of Honour at the conclusion of the campaign.

 

#IDidItAnyway Advocate - £25

  • Limited edition Womanthology #IDidItAnyway 10oz cotton canvas tote bag. Made from naturally environmentally friendly cotton canvas, it is sturdy and durable
  • Limited edition Womanthology children's colouring book that challenges gender stereotypes about careers (crayons not included)
  • Your name will be featured in a special Womanthology article which showcases the #IDidItAnyway Wall of Honour at the conclusion of the campaign

 

#IDidItAnyway Pioneer - Great Britain - £50

  • Limited edition Womanthology #IDidItAnyway 10oz cotton canvas tote bag. Made from naturally environmentally friendly cotton canvas, it is sturdy and durable
  • Limited edition Womanthology children's colouring book that challenges gender stereotypes about careers (crayons not included)
  • Limited edition Womanthology #IDidItAnyway power bank to stay powered up when you're on the go. Charges smart phones, MP3/4 players, digital cameras and gaming devices
  • Limited edition Womanthology #IDidItAnyway A5 notebook. Keep it handy to capture your next big idea that's going to change the world!
  • Limited edition Womanthology #IDidItAnyway aluminium business card holder. It's ultra-light and compact, fitting easily into your bag or pocket. Make sure it's with you and filled with business cards at all times so you never miss an opportunity to connect
  • Your name will be featured in a special Womanthology article which showcases the #IDidItAnyway Wall of Honour at the conclusion of the campaign

 

#IDidItAnyway Pioneer - Outside Great Britain - £50

(This perk is for backers outside Great Britain as it is not possible for us to transport power banks as contained in the other version of the £50 perk overseas. We created this as an alternative containing a pen instead as we didn't want our overseas backers to miss out.)

  • Limited edition Womanthology #IDidItAnyway 10oz cotton canvas tote bag. Made from naturally environmentally friendly cotton canvas, it is sturdy and durable
  • Limited edition Womanthology children's colouring book that challenges gender stereotypes about careers (crayons not included)
  • Limited edition Womanthology #IDidItAnyway Parker pen. Classic and timeless with a stainless steel cap
  • Limited edition Womanthology #IDidItAnyway A5 notebook. Keep it handy to capture your next big idea that's going to change the world!
  • Limited edition Womanthology #IDidItAnyway aluminium business card holder. It's ultra-light and compact, fitting easily into your bag or pocket. Make sure it's with you and filled with business cards at all times so you never miss an opportunity to connect
  • Your name will be featured in a special Womanthology article which showcases the #IDidItAnyway Wall of Honour at the conclusion of the campaign

 

#IDidItAnyway Business Sponsor - £100

  • Listing for your business featuring your company logo on our directory of businesses that are positive about gender balance

(PLEASE NOTE - THIS IS A DIGITAL ONLY PERK. PLEASE SEE OUR TERMS AND CONDITIONS SECTION AT THE BOTTOM OF THIS PAGE. BY SELECTING THIS PERK YOU ARE AGREEING TO THESE.)

 

#IDidItAnyway Story Sponsor - £150

  • Dedicate a story in recognition of someone who has helped you on your career journey or who you want to encourage to fulfil their full potential. The name of your honouree(s) will feature on a digital plaque at the base of a Womanthology alongside your dedication to her / him / them

(PLEASE NOTE - THIS IS A DIGITAL ONLY PERK. PLEASE SEE OUR TERMS AND CONDITIONS SECTION AT THE BOTTOM OF THIS PAGE. BY SELECTING THIS PERK YOU ARE AGREEING TO THESE.)

 

#IDidItAnyway Thought Leader - £500

  • Become one of our exclusive cohort of 100 Womanthology Thought Leaders and join us for our prestigious inaugural #IDidItAnyway thought leadership event at The Shard in London on the evening of Monday 20th November 2017, kindly sponsored by Warwick Business School at the University of Warwick

  • Your name will be featured in a special Womanthology article which showcases the #IDidItAnyway event after it has taken place
  • Limited edition Womanthology #IDidItAnyway 10oz cotton canvas tote bag. Made from naturally environmentally friendly cotton canvas, it is sturdy and durable
  • Limited edition Womanthology children's colouring book that challenges gender stereotypes about careers
  • Limited edition Womanthology #IDidItAnyway power bank to stay powered up when you're on the go. Charges smart phones, MP3/4 players, digital cameras and gaming devices
  • Limited edition Womanthology #IDidItAnyway A5 notebook. Keep it handy to capture your next big idea that's going to change the world
  • Limited edition Womanthology #IDidItAnyway aluminium business card holder. It's ultra-light and compact, fitting easily into your bag or pocket. Make sure it's with you and filled with business cards at all times so you never miss an opportunity to connect
  • Receive exclusive quarterly newsletters and advanced notice of up and coming Womanthology events and activities, with priority booking information

 

RISKS AND CHALLENGES

:: Risks are low. Womanthology has been published for more than three years now and we have a well-established network to deliver great quality, authentic content.

:: We’re working with specialists to deliver this project and these perks to our existing community and beyond. It has been carefully costed and is scalable according to uptake.

:: We plan to deliver all perks by the end of December 2017, and earlier whenever possible.

 

TERMS AND CONDITIONS

GENERAL

:: We reserve the right to withdraw a perk at any time before it has been claimed and issue a full refund.

:: We reserve the right to substitute an item that makes up part of a perk before it has been claimed by first seeking the written agreement of backers who have selected that perk. In the event that an acceptable substitution cannot be agreed a full refund will be issued.

:: Images are intended as a guide to help illustrate perks but these are not to scale.

 

SPECIFIC PERKS

#IDidItAnyway Business Sponsor - £100

(Each listing can be up to 400 characters in length and will include a logo. We reserve the right to decline to publish any listing and issue a full refund. By selecting this perk, you are agreeing to this.)

 

#IDidItAnyway Story Sponsor - £150

(Please note, this is a digital only perk as it is delivered on a rolling basis as the magazine is published. Content will be delivered in themed editions but we are unable to guarantee the specific edition in which your dedication will appear. Each dedication can be up to 800 characters in length. We reserve the right to decline to publish any dedication and issue a full refund. By selecting this perk, you are agreeing to this.)

In August 2014, Womanthology founder, Fiona Tatton, visited 10 Downing Street to discuss accelerating gender balance and support of women-led enterprise, having set up the magazine from her kitchen table in Sheffield.
Is it for me?Are you passionate about getting to 50/50 in the workplace? Do you believe is doesn’t have to take decades to achieve? Do you want a better future for our daughters and our sons? If you answered  "YES!" to one of more of these questions then you belong in our community.Womanthology was created for women like you, who value authentic perspectives and real experiences that help you grow and reflect on your career journey and where to take it next. You can find careers sections in regular women’s magazines but they are only a small part of the offer. Womanthology is all about sharing the career stories of real life women like you. There is no shortage of incredible women out there all around the world – we just don’t usually get to hear from them.How your pledges will helpWe've set a funding goal of £20,000 to help us grow, We need your pledges to fund us to curate and share more stories, and more opportunities for readers to be energised and informed. Each and every pledge you make helps us to reach more women and effect positive change.

Womanthology stories are free to access, but they take countless hours to research, curate and edit each month, and thousands of pounds to sustain each year.

Womanthology operates as an independent, mission-led business - the reason we exist is to speed up progress towards gender balance - so we’re coming to you for help.
We plan to use campaign proceeds for working capital. Campaign proceeds are what remain after costs and tax are deducted - we are registered for VAT (value-added tax) in the UK, which is included in the price of the perks where it’s applicable. It is important to us to be able to contribute to society and the economy through our operations.
But don't just take our word for it...Here's some what some of the people who have pledged already have said about why Womanthology is so important to them:"I'm proud to pledge to the campaign. Diversity faces its greatest challenge in a generation and now, more than ever, it's so urgent to project positive voices like Womanthology. The pace of change is not moving fast enough and without support will stall altogether."Sian Dudley - Head of Marketing and Communications, Cast "Womanthology has been consistent in providing fascinating insight into so many industries. Female lead stories, providing a well needed counterpoint to much of the world's media. Interesting women, doing interesting work in interesting industries. Good stories, well told."Julia Dobson - Founder, Village England Who we areFiona Tatton set up Womanthology as a hobby from her kitchen table in 2014 when she became frustrated that she couldn't find the type of stories she wanted to read without scouring the Internet and social media. She also wanted to hear directly from the women she admired in their own words and she wanted to give a voice to women who wouldn't always get a chance to share their ideas.She realised that by using the power of the Internet and social media she could reach out to the women she respected most. So, she began to contact women in all kinds of roles - racing drivers, rocket scientists, surgeons, lawyers, mathematicians, athletes, entrepreneurs, mothers. The list grew and grew.The daughter of an engineer, Fiona is passionate about giving the next generation of women the widest choice of careers.The rewards#IDidItAnyway Champion - £10Your name will be featured in a special Womanthology article which showcases an #IDidItAnyway Wall of Honour at the conclusion of the campaign. #IDidItAnyway Advocate - £25

story:
Our project

My name is Claire and I have worked for 12 years with hospital clowns and I really want people to understand how precious their contributions are to the wellbeing of sick children.

When my friend Regula Stucki wrote her book, I was on my way to London to study publishing. 

Perfect timing! 

What We Need 

First we need to translate the book in English. We have found the translator. Now we need the funds.

When the manuscript is done and checked, I will work with a self-publisher to create the physical book. Here again, we will need funds. 

We are going to do two campaigns:

- one, the one you are looking at, for the translations costs - £ 2,000

- one, in the Spring, for the production costs - £ 2,500

The book exists in German and has sold nicely there. But I believe it has a much greater potential in English. There are thousands of hospital clowns all over the world and very few books on this particular job.

I am sure that parents, carers, hospital staff would be happy to know more about those precious moments.

 I believe in this project so much, that I am ready to put time, energy and funds into it. But I thought it would mean so much more if many, many people could participate. "Together" is such a beautiful word.

What do you think?

Can you help us? Financially? And / Or By sharing this link to other people who could be interested? That would be fantastic! Thank you very much!

Claire
