story:
THANK YOU!

We raised enough money to pay for all the expenses to send Alejandra to Australia. She will be representing México in the first CVI of the season. We would like to thank everyone who either through donations or likes and shares on facebook and email made this possible.
This is just the beginning of the story. After Australia there are two other competitions where she needs to qualify to compete in the World Equestrian Games in Normandy. There are 52 hours left on the campaign, any funds raised during this period will go directly towards competition entry fees and horse expenses for the competitions in California and Canada.
Our biggest priority now is to let as many people know that there is vaulting in México. It's not just a dream anymore, it's real! So share this with anyone and everyone, let's reach the 2,000 visits!!

¡GRACIAS!

¡Hemos juntado suficientes fondos para mandar a Alejandra a representar a México en Australia! Nos gustaría agradecer a todos los que han formado parte de esta campaña y ya sea con donaciones o publicidad en facebook han hecho esto posible.
Este es sólo el comienzo de la historia. Después de Australia, México (representado por Alejandra) participará en dos competencias más. En ellas será necesario obtener el puntaje requerido para competir en los Juegos Ecuestres Mundiales en Normandía.
Quedan 52 horas en esta campaña, todos los fondos que se obtengan a partir de este momento serán destinados en su totalidad a las entradas y gastos de caballos para estas dos competencias en California y Canadá.
Nuestra meta ahora es que la mayor cantidad de gente posible sepa que en México tenemos vaulting. Ya no es sólo un sueño, ¡Es una realidad! Así es que comparte esta campaña con todos y vamos por las 2,000 visitas!!


¡Ayúdanos a hacer historia!

En Pro Vaulting México, nuestro objetivo es promover el vaulting.

Estamos orgullosos de que por primera vez, México tiene oportunidad de mandar a una seleccionada en vaulting a los Juegos Ecuestres Mundiales. Para convertir este sueño en realidad, nuestra representante tiene el reto de calificar en 3 competencias internacionales: Australia, California y Canadá. ¡Confiamos en que entre todos lograremos esta meta!

El vaulting es un deporte muy interesante donde la persona va bailando arriba de un caballo al galope ( http://www.fei.org/fei/disc/vaulting/about ). Con tu contribución lograremos que México tenga una mayor participación a nivel internacional. La meta es poder promover este deporte y mejorar la sociedad en la que vivimos. El vaulting ayuda a elevar autoestima,  mejorar la fuerza física y  mental, promover el trabajo en equipo y convivir con la naturaleza y los caballos. Una vez que te paras en un caballo en movimiento, sabes que ¡Cualquier cosa se puede lograr!

El vaulting  se empezó a practicar en México hace más de 10 años. Alejandra Orozco Vizcaíno, quien nos representará en estas competencias, fue la primera mexicana en representar a su país en una competencia internacional de vaulting (CVI). En el 2013 México participó por primera vez en una CVI, donde Alejandra obtuvo el 3er lugar. Ella ha estado entrenando y preparándose para competir en Australia en Marzo. Lo único que falta es tu apoyo para lograrlo!

Tú puedes ser parte de esta gran historia, ayúdanos a lograr y superar la meta!

You can help us make history!

In Pro Vaulting México our goal is to promote vaulting and we’re very proud of the fact that for the first time, México has the opportunity to send a vaulter to the World Equestrian Games. In order to make this dream a reality, our vaulter has the challenge to qualify in three international events: Australia, California and Canada. We know that with your help we can make this happen!!

Vaulting is an equestrian sport where a dance routine is performed on a cantering horse. With your contribution we will ensure that this sport grows in México. We want to be able to share it with more people and help improve our society. Vaulting is an amazing way to develop team skills, raise your self-esteem and develop a bond with horses and nature. Once you stand on a moving horse, you know you can do anything!

Vaulting was first brought to México more than 10 years ago. 2013 marked the first year a Mexican vaulter competed internationally, where Alejandra Orozco Vizcaíno placed third. Alejandra has been training hard and is getting ready to compete in Australia in March. All that is missing is your help to make it happen!

You can be part of this great story by helping us reach and exceed the goal!


Mensaje de Alejandra:

Hola, soy Alejandra, Practico el vaulting desde hace algunos años y mi meta es poder representar a México en los Juegos Ecuestres Mundiales (WEG) en Normandía. WEG es como el equivalente a las olimpiadas para todos los deportes ecuestres, se lleva a cabo cada cuatro años y es un evento ENORME.

He estado consiguiendo patrocinios para cubrir los gastos de entrenamientos y viajes a competencias. A pesar de esto, me sigue faltando un buen camino por recorrer para poder asistir a todas las competencias del año.

Para calificar para el mundial, necesito ir participando en todos los niveles de competencias internacionales. Hay tres, en todos el puntaje es del 0-10 y se califica como en gimnasia.

1* CVI: es el primer nivel de competencias internacionales. En este nivel ya obtuve el puntaje necesario el año pasado.

2* CVI: Este es el segundo nivel donde necesito un 6.5 y la competencia es en Australia en un mes!

3* CVI: El nivel más alto de competencias internacionales, aquí necesito un 7.0 y me estoy dando dos oportunidades de lograrlo: una en California y la otra en Canadá, las dos en mayo. Una vez que obtenga el 7.0 en alguna de estas competencias, habré calificado para los Juegos Ecuestres Mundiales ya que soy la única mexicana participando.

He estado entrenando y poniendo todo de mi parte para obtener los puntajes que necesito para calificar. Me encantaría que me pudieras ayudar para asegurarnos de no perder esta oportunidad por falta de fondos.

Message from Alejandra:

Hi, my name is Alejandra. I'm a Mexican vaulter and my goal this year is to qualify for the World Equestrian Games (WEG) and represent México. If you're not a horse person, WEG is like the equivalent of the Olympics for horse sports, it happens every four years and it's HUGE.
I have been getting sponsors to cover some of my training trips and competition costs, but I still need all the help I can get to make it through the year and be able to go to all the qualifying competitions.
To qualify for WEG, I basically have to climb the competition ladder. There's three levels of competition, all of them have scoring from 0-10 kind of like gymnastics:
1* CVI: which is the first level that I competed at last year. I already got the score I needed for that one!
2* CVI: I need a 6.5 for this one, which is in Australia in a little over a month!
3* CVI: This is the highest international level. I need a 7.0 and I'm giving myself 2 opportunities: one in California and the second in Canada, both in May. Once I get this score I'm qualified to compete at WEG since I'm the only Mexican who's ever competed internationally.

I've been focusing on my training and doing everything I can to get the scores I need. I would really appreciate your support to make sure I don't miss this opportunity because of lack of funding!

¿Para qué es el dinero?

  • Boleto de avión a Australia
  • Costo de ingreso a la competencia
  • Gastos del caballo: nuestros amigos en Australia nos están prestando un muy buen caballo para competir y solamente hay que cooperar con los gastos de viaje. 
  • Comidas de nuestra seleccionada durante el viaje a Australia.
  • Hotel y transporte en Australia

En caso de superar la meta, los fondos se utilizarán para los gastos de las competencias en California, Canadá, y si es suficiente, el mundial en Francia!

Where would the money go?

  • Plane ticket to Australia
  • Competition entry fees
  • Horse expenses: our friends in Australia are letting us borrow an awesome horse, so all we need to do is help with the horse travel expenses.
  • Meals for our representative while in Australia
  • Hotel nights and transportation during Australia

If the goal is exceeded the extra funds will go toward competition and travel expenses for the competitions in California, Canada, and, once she qualifies, WEG!


Otras formas de ayudar

Platicarle a tus amigos, familiares y conocidos, y compartir esta campaña en facebook son una excelente manera de ayudarnos a llegar a la meta!

Other Ways You Can Help

Spreading the word and sharing this on your facebook page is an amazing way to help us reach the goal!

story:
Fifty percent of marriages in America end in divorce. Two thirds of those divorces are filed by women. (The National Marriage Project, Rutgers University)

 

Marriage Can Sometimes Feel Like a War Zone.

Be Certain You Are Fighting the Right Opponent!

God designed marriage to play a pivotal role in His strategy for battle against the evil one. He intended the differences between men and women to give us a tactical advantage, but the enemy exploits those differences to undermine our unity.While Satan tempts wives and husbands to fight head-to-head against each other, God wants us to learn to battle back-to-back against the real enemy, defending each other’s greatest areas of vulnerability with our unique strengths. A Wife of Valor: Your Strategic Importance in God’s Battle Plan will empower Christian wives to recognize the enemy propaganda being directed at them and arm themselves with God’s truth regarding marriage.

Hello, I’m Rebecca D. Bruner, an author, retreat speaker, and Bible teacher with over twenty-five years’ experience in women’s ministries. Through my study of the Bible and my twenty-eight-year relationship with my husband, God has revealed many vital truths and insights to me regarding marriage. I wrote A Wife of Valor: Your Strategic Importance in God’s Battle Plan to pass on the crucial lessons I have learned to other Christian wives. My hope is that readers will apply these biblical principles to strengthen their marriages, and perhaps avoid a few of my mistakes.

During my research for this book, I was surprised to discover that women file for divorce twice as often as men do. A Wife of Valor will help women evaluate the success of their relationships on the basis of God’s goals and design, rather than merely their personal satisfaction. Such a resource could play a crucial role in saving many marriages.

By contributing to this campaign, you will help uphold the biblical model of marriage as a reflection of Christ’s relationship with his bride, the church. You will help preserve and pass on these principles to upcoming generations. Each chapter includes questions which can be used for group discussion or personal reflection, making it a valuable resource for counselors and mentors who want to empower young women to serve God in their calling as wives.

Take a stand against the enemy’s schemes to undermine and destroy marriage by helping make A Wife of Valor available to Christian women everywhere.

What We Need & What You Will Get

Money raised through this campaign will be used for: 

  • Professional Editing
  • Cover Design
  • Permissions Fees for Quotations
  • Printing 
  • Shipping
  • Campaign Video
  •  Promotional Materials/Events
  •  Indiegogo and PayPal Fees

In exchange for your support you will receive a variety of rewards including:

  • Autographed copies of the book
  • Softbound copies of the book
  • Copies of the e-book
  • Recordings of Rebecca D. Bruner’s seven-week course on biblical marriage
  • One-on-one video chat with author Rebecca D. Bruner
  • Small group Q & A video chat with Rebecca D. Bruner
  •  Official acknowledgement as a sponsor of the book

The Impact

Marriage is under attack today like never before. If we do not take action to practice, preserve, and pass on the principles of biblical marriage they may well be obliterated in our culture within a generation. The people of God must not let that happen. Help put A Wife of Valor into the hands of Christian women, as well as pastors, mentors, ministry leaders and marriage counselors.

Other Ways You Can Help

This is a fixed-funding campaign, which means the book will be published only if we reach our goal between now and Palm Sunday (3/20) when the campaign closes. Please tell everyone who shares your concern for the current state of marriage in America about this campaign. Use Indiegogo’s share buttons to spread the word on social media and through email. Most of all, I implore you to PRAY for the success of this project.

Risks & Challenges

We know that the enemy would love to undermine this effort to build up marriage. Please pray for God's protection over everyone associated with this project and every step in the process. Greater is He who is in us than he who is in the world! (I John 4:4)

story:
Short Summary

“The stories people tell have a way of taking care of them. If stories come to you, care for them. And learn to give them away where they are needed. Sometimes a person needs a story more than food to stay alive. That is why we put these stories in each other's memories. This is how people care for themselves.”

― Barry López, Crow and Weasel

Not Our Status But Our Stories will bring forth the concept of Ubuntu, [...] A person with Ubuntu is open and available to others, affirming of others, does not feel threatened that others are able and good, for he or she has a proper self-assurance that comes from knowing that he or she belongs in a greater whole and is diminished when others are humiliated or diminished, when others are tortured or oppressed, or treated as if they were less than who they are.” With the independent-publishing of;

Sistah’s Speak (voices of HIV positive women) is the working title for a collection of short fiction, poetry, creative nonfiction, personal narratives, critical essays and visual art from women living with HIV/AIDS. This project seeks to create a space for women to share their stories in their own voice sharing with an opens heart as a vehicle for chronicling your lives. The goal of this project is to empower, supports the soul and uplifts the spirit of women people living with HIV/AIDS. This collection women who are HIV positive share themes of dating, intimate partner violence, reproductive rights, disclosure, who will care for my child if I die, speaking openly about living with HIV, addiction and recovery, loss of relationships and many other issues women face.

Raising Kazembe: A Memoir This collection of journal letter written by an HIV positive father to his son. It chronicles the lesson of life and education, the mental and emotional health of a father who deals with isolation, stigma, mental health issues as well as how the traumas of his childhood played out in his parenting and desire to heal. These letters, Khafre began writing to is then unborn child in 1992, because he did not believe he would live long enough to witness his child grow to adulthood. Khafre wanted his son to know from his own voice. His letters share with is son, Kazembe the reality of living with HIV, the fear of dying,  sexuality, decisions regarding medical care, disclosure and much more.

The goal of Not Our Status But Our Stories is to self-publish to new contributions to AIDS literary history. To bring forth voices, stories and books from often marginalized communities which is inclusive of genre, gender, race/ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability. Working in the spirit of Ubuntu, Not Our Status But Our Stories, this work seeks highlight these voices, “Ubuntu [...] speaks of the very essence of being human. [We] say [...] "Hey, so-and-so has Ubuntu." Then you are generous, you are hospitable, you are friendly and caring and compassionate. You share what you have. It is to say, "My humanity is caught up, is inextricably bound up, in yours." We belong in a bundle of life. We say, "A person is a person through other persons."

What We Need & What You Get

Through your support and participation in this campaign we can work together to put in place sustainable programs that will increase diversity among publishing staffs in the long-term. Together, we can create a more inclusive book publishing industry.

Resources to self- publish Sistah’s Speak and Raising Kazembe: A Memoir

All-in Branding Package, Custom Logo Design Package, a color palette, typography palette, a Stationery Design Package, a Landing Page Design Package, Blog Design Package, with the inclusion of:

Digital Formatting and Distribution (e-Book)

Paperback Publishing

Hardcover Publishing

Cover Interior customization

Image Insertions

Electronic Proof

One-on-one author support

Online distribution thru Amazon, Barnes & Noble and other book retailers

ISBN assignment

US copyright

Library of Congress Control Number

Google Preview

Book Buyer’s Preview

Promotional materials

The Impact

“There is no greater agony than bearing an untold story inside you.”

― Maya Angelou, I Know Why the Caged Bird Sings

I have asked myself this question. “How can I use my position, knowledge of publishing, writing, editing, and sharing stories to help create additional contributions to the literary world that is diverse, equitable, and doesn’t just represent the same segment of society it always has since its inception? What concrete actions can I take to make actual change and move beyond the tired conversation we’ve been having for decades about the lack of diversity in publishing?”

“Stories you read when you're the right age never quite leave you. You may forget who wrote them or what the story was called. Sometimes you'll forget precisely what happened, but if a story touches you it will stay with you, haunting the places in your mind that you rarely ever visit.”

― Neil Gaiman, M Is for Magi

Continuing my efforts in self-publishing stories and voices of people living with HIV was the answer. Yours support will allow Not Our Status But Our Stories to speak the voices and stories of those under- represented in publishing. Together will be allow the stories and history of our collective community to be told.

The Impact of Not Out Status But Our Stories will create and build community through publishing where, “A person is a person through other people' strikes an affirmation of one’s humanity through recognition of an ‘other’ in his or her uniqueness and difference. It is a demand for a creative inter-subjective formation in which the ‘other’ becomes a mirror (but only a mirror) for my subjectivity. This idealism suggests to us that humanity is not embedded in my person solely as an individual; my humanity is co-substantively bestowed upon the other and me. Humanity is a quality we owe to each other. We create each other and need to sustain this otherness creation. And if we belong to each other, we participate in our creations: we are because you are, and since you are, I am. The ‘I am’ is not a rigid subject, but a dynamic self-constitution dependent on this otherness creation of relation and distance”.

Other Ways You Can Help

Challenge five of your friends to support this campaign, post this campaign link of your Facebook page, send emails to your social network, and log on the campaign link to post comments.  Spread the word about this project and share it on Twitter so we can raise the GoGo Factor for this project.  Use the share tools to push this project out to your community.

story:
WHAT IS BIG SHARED WORLD ALL ABOUT?

The Big Shared World project was born out of my frustration with our world today. While we seem to be plugged in and hyperconnected, many people also feel equally isolated. Even when friends get together physically, they may be more immersed in their phones than the conversation “in real life.”

Looking beyond the personal, I also saw people, myself included, experiencing a disconnection from even the most pressing global issues. Sure, we have unprecedented, 24-hour, exposure to news updates, if we want it, but most people I know keep plenty busy managing their own lives, and lack the time to examine how their daily actions contribute to the bigger picture. People all too often feel removed from the heavier issues, as if they are someone else’s problems to solve. While I understand this reaction, I worry that our disengagement could be detrimental for all of us.

At a crossroads in my own life, I had been considering what it was like to be a millennial during this unique moment in history. When that consideration broadened to include what it was like to be a human at this unique moment in history, I decided the only way to learn the answer to that question was to talk with as many humans, from as wide-ranging backgrounds as I reasonably could. I decided to put all my resources together and design a travel project that addressed these growing concerns I was experiencing. Thus, the seed for Big Shared World was sown.

From there, I consulted friends, colleagues, and pretty much anyone who would give me their opinion, seeking a base of three questions to ask those I came across in my travels. After much consideration, I settled on these, as most likely to develop the kind of deep conversation I was seeking:  

These three questions served as a controlled element in an otherwise spontaneous journey around the world. While international travel on its own can change a person’s perspective and broaden their worldview, these three questions allowed for a consistent thread to anchor my interactions, no matter where I was in the world. The initial Big Shared World mission was “3 Questions. 30 Countries. 300 People.” Nearly 15 months later, I had surpassed my goal, and had asked my three questions of over 700 people in 40 countries across six continents!

During that time, Big Shared World, which had started as my personal project, developed into a community. This community was built on genuine, mutual curiosity and a reciprocal desire to truly connect. Every person who took the time to respond to my questions helped elevate the project. 

 

The Big Shared World journey began with the inception of the idea and continues to this day. I actually traveled from October 2014 through December 2015. During this period, I traveled on six regional legs—alighting in either Minnesota or Washington DC in between legs to rest, reconnect with friends and family, and repack for the next region! 

In 2016, with BSW travels complete, I focused on processing my experiences and interactions, and finding the framework for the story I had to tell. To do so, I worked with book coaches, attended writer conferences, and spent a lot of time processing working on putting the experience of the journey into book form. I also worked with a data guru to help me make sense of the more than 700 responses to my three questions through a more thorough analysis process. 

The first half of 2017 will focus on advancing the book’s production process. With a summer publication date, the journey will continue as I work to bring the BSW story to a wider audience. From anecdotes to underlying wisdom gleaned, I look forward to sharing the insights and important takeaways from the project.

 

WHAT COMES NEXT FOR BIG SHARED WORLD?

Just as a small idea turned into the most amazing big adventure, my hope is that this campaign will help define the way forward for Big Shared World. The book production and launch is important, but it is only one part of the bigger picture. Ideally, support for this campaign will garner opportunities to further showcase the importance of embracing curiosity and working together—so we all feel prepared to address the big issues facing our dynamic, fragile world.

 

WHAT IS THE BSW BOOK ALL ABOUT?

The BSW book is part travel journal (think, Bill Bryson), part spiritual memoir (think, idealistic millennial meets Eat Pray Love), and part sociological thesis (except, not boring!). As you read, you’ll follow my experiences from the birth of the BSW idea, across six continents, and back home to the United States, where I start to make sense of it all. Along the way, you’ll meet hundreds of people from around the globe who enter into deeply meaningful conversation about the modern world we all share.

It has been said that “Man travels the world over in search of what he needs and returns home to find it.” I discovered the truth in those words, certainly. But I have also come to understand what author Pat Conroy means when he says, “Once you have traveled, the voyage never ends, but is played out over and over again in the quietest chambers. The mind can never break off from the journey.”

The BSW book is both my opportunity to share my journey with you—and to play it out over and over again, gleaning more insight with each new reflection upon it.

 

WHAT WILL BE THE OUTCOME OF THIS CAMPAIGN?

The Big Shared World journey was brought to life with the help of hundreds of people from all around the world. What better way to publish its results than with a crowdfunding campaign?

While the manuscript has been written, this campaign will help fund book production professionals—including editors, designers, and printers—who will help the book be the best ambassador to for the larger Big Shared World goals as possible.  

HOW WILL THE MONEY BE SPENT?

To better understand the costs of independent publishing, see the chart and descriptions below. 

 

Total: $15,000

*Breakdown of costs are determined based on a word count of 75,000. 

 

WHAT DOES THE BOOK EDITING AND DESIGN PROCESS ENTAIL?

The following are some of the larger components included:

Developmental Edit - This includes a full reading of the manuscript by an editor who will indicate where the story could be expanded or trimmed, address confusing passages, and suggest where revisions could be made throughout.  (approx $3000)

Copyedit - A copyeditor will fix misspellings, verb tense issues, errors in character names or continuity, and make sure edits from the first round of developmental editing didn't introduce any new errors or break style. (approx $3000)

Layout Design - A custom interior design of a book includes fonts, formatting, and styles used throughout a book. Coming up with a consistent template for each chapter maintains consistency and readability throughout the book. (approx $2500)

Proofread - A proofreader goes through an edited, formatted book to look for any mistakes in the text, as well as any undesirable design elements. (approx $1000)

Cover Design - Many people judge a book by its cover, so a quality design is important to the quality of the overall book. Cover and back cover design includes  marketing copy to tell the book’s story and details such as generating the barcode for selling purposes. (approx $1000)

Formatting + Publication Costs - Once the manuscript is print-ready, it will be available on Amazon and other book-selling platforms. Each has different requirements and fees associated. Also, the book will need an ISBN and other official components. (approx $1000)

Printing - Even authors have to pay for their books! Printing costs will cover books ordered through the campaign, as well as an initial run of books to share in marketing and publicity efforts. (approx $2000)

Campaign Logistics - Running a crowd fund campaign incurs costs such as video production, perk fulfillment, and transaction costs with Indiegogo and payment platforms. (approx $2000)

 

The main goal for this campaign is to fund the editorial and design process for the BSW book. Upon reaching our goal, we will move forward with additional steps to achieve a successful book launch. We have brainstormed stretch goals that will help take the book and Big Shared World to the next level. Effective marketing can get a book off the shelf and into people’s hands. Setting longer term goals for Big Shared World will allow the BSW team to continue developing programs for engagement beyond the stories in the BSW book.

The Big Shared World team looks forward to amplifying the mission by developing partnerships and delivering materials that can help bring the message of BSW to more people. We hope that once the initial funding goal of $15,000 is met, we will be able to pursue our stretch goals in order to further expand the BSW project through marketing and outreach, as well as program and curriculum development.

 

WHAT DO I GET FOR MY CONTRIBUTION?

The fun of a crowdfund campaign is in the perks! Our perks are designed at all levels, with individuals and organizations in mind. For just $5, you can receive a handwritten thank you postcard from me, and YOUR NAME IN THE BOOK! The first print run of the BSW book will include a section in the back of the book listing all the contributors at this level and above. For $1500, I will send you 20 autographed copies of the book, then personally show up to your book club meeting to share in the stories of Big Shared World together!

For organizations, I look forward to sharing the insights from Big Shared World with your team! For just $500, we can have a customized consulting session over Skype. For $3000, I'll come to your organization and speak in person! All larger perks include a bulk purchase of the books. 

To keep the campaign fresh, there will be new perks launched throughout the campaign. Coming soon, my personal favorite is the BSW Travel Lover's Package which will be full of my favorite products for an on-the-go individual! If you contribute to the campaign early on, you'll be first to get updates of new perks added to the campaign. 

The perks in this campaign were sourced to include products from ethical companies with a social mission as part of their business models. For instance, the socks in the Book Lover’s Package are from Conscious Steps, a company that gives a portion of their sales to charitable causes. The passport holder in the Travel Lover’s Package is from 11:11, a small business in California that makes each product by hand, with love. 

This journey, this campaign, and this book are all about embracing curiosity and starting conversations that make people think. Contributing to this campaign is not just about helping to publish the stories in the BSW book, it is about joining me and the BSW team in our efforts to bring people together and start meaningful conversations about our Big Shared World, today. 

 

Big Shared World would be just an idea if it wasn’t for the help of hundreds of people—people who answered the questions, welcomed me in their homes, offered suggestions and expertise. Everyone who made this journey come to life is part of the BSW Community!

In addition, the BSW team includes talented individuals and organizations who have supported the journey professionally.  

Student Research Project - I was extremely fortunate to be taken on as a pro-bono client of Integrated Development Group, a student consulting group from University of the Pacific. During the course of the travel, IDG researched an extensive list of resources to help me find more information about various topics that struck me while traveling. The end result was a comprehensive, annotated bibliography that expanded my understanding of concepts ranging from climate change to geopolitics.

Campaign Development + Management - Two talented students from IDG launched their own consulting firm after graduating. Meagan Kim and Courtney Bye of Sprout Consulting have been instrumental in developing this crowd fund campaign. From perk research to the beautiful graphics, this campaign launch has been a huge team effort. 

Website Design - While traveling, I re-connected with a friend in Vietnam from a study abroad program years back. The timing was perfect. I needed a better website, and his family had a web design company. My stay in Vietnam included lots of time in the Seadev office, getting to know their brilliant team and sharing ideas for how the BSW story would best translate into a website. Their design team consistently impressed me as they took my vision and turned it into the most dazzling reality. I am always proud to send my website link to people, as I know it perfectly captures the essence of me and Big Shared World. We continue to work together, ensuring the website reflects the process of the project.

Coaching/Book Editing - I have been fortunate to come across the most amazing people just when I need them. When I initially started to think about how the book would come together, I found Jamie Morris, book coach and editor, at VoiceHeartVision. As I shared the highlights from my experiences, Jamie walked me through story development techniques that helped to illuminate the bigger themes and narrative arcs of the BSW story.

Then, after much time writing and rewriting, I found Caroline Lambert, a Washington DC-based editor and book coach. Caroline has been instrumental in building my confidence in the pages that fill the BSW book.

At an Airbnb conference on global hospitality and travel, I struck up a conversation with Gail Baral, an entrepreneur coach who has helped me to clarify my vision and goals, and continues to provide thoughtful counsel on the best way forward.  

Data Analysis - The data analysis process started with IDG. While traveling, I wrote people’s answers in 10 bright red Moleskine notebooks, then meticulously transcribed them into a spreadsheet. IDG helped begin the methodical coding system needed to analyze the results of this social research project. Yigal Goldshtrom has taken over making sense of the 700+ responses. Not only are there answers to the three questions, but seven demographic questions and various sub-coded elements, as well. Yigal has made tackling this arduous task seem easy, and I look forward to sharing a more detailed analysis of the BSW answers.

Campaign Video - The campaign video is a work of art by two incredibly talented individuals living on two different hemispheres! I connected with Ignacio Lidejover of Puerto-C Films in Buenos Aires, Argentina. Together, we wrote the video script. Then, I connected with Dietrich Wilke of Full Frame Media to do the videography work for the film. Dietrich is a fellow Minnesotan, and together we spent two days capturing footage for the campaign video. By the power of the Internet, the three of us worked together, and Ignacio produced the most beautiful video as the focal point of the campaign. 

 

We appreciate every bit of your support and want to thank you for taking the time to learn more about this significant project. We look forward to sharing this book and the stories of our Big Shared World with you!

-Colleen and the Big Shared World team
story_txt:
WHAT IS BIG SHARED WORLD ALL ABOUT?
The Big Shared World project was born out of my frustration with our world today. While we seem to be plugged in and hyperconnected, many people also feel equally isolated. Even when friends get together physically, they may be more immersed in their phones than the conversation “in real life.”
Looking beyond the personal, I also saw people, myself included, experiencing a disconnection from even the most pressing global issues. Sure, we have unprecedented, 24-hour, exposure to news updates, if we want it, but most people I know keep plenty busy managing their own lives, and lack the time to examine how their daily actions contribute to the bigger picture. People all too often feel removed from the heavier issues, as if they are someone else’s problems to solve. While I understand this reaction, I worry that our disengagement could be detrimental for all of us.
At a crossroads in my own life, I had been considering what it was like to be a millennial during this unique moment in history. When that consideration broadened to include what it was like to be a human at this unique moment in history, I decided the only way to learn the answer to that question was to talk with as many humans, from as wide-ranging backgrounds as I reasonably could. I decided to put all my resources together and design a travel project that addressed these growing concerns I was experiencing. Thus, the seed for Big Shared World was sown.
From there, I consulted friends, colleagues, and pretty much anyone who would give me their opinion, seeking a base of three questions to ask those I came across in my travels. After much consideration, I settled on these, as most likely to develop the kind of deep conversation I was seeking:  

These three questions served as a controlled element in an otherwise spontaneous journey around the world. While international travel on its own can change a person’s perspective and broaden their worldview, these three questions allowed for a consistent thread to anchor my interactions, no matter where I was in the world. The initial Big Shared World mission was “3 Questions. 30 Countries. 300 People.” Nearly 15 months later, I had surpassed my goal, and had asked my three questions of over 700 people in 40 countries across six continents!

During that time, Big Shared World, which had started as my personal project, developed into a community. This community was built on genuine, mutual curiosity and a reciprocal desire to truly connect. Every person who took the time to respond to my questions helped elevate the project. 
 

The Big Shared World journey began with the inception of the idea and continues to this day. I actually traveled from October 2014 through December 2015. During this period, I traveled on six regional legs—alighting in either Minnesota or Washington DC in between legs to rest, reconnect with friends and family, and repack for the next region! 
In 2016, with BSW travels complete, I focused on processing my experiences and interactions, and finding the framework for the story I had to tell. To do so, I worked with book coaches, attended writer conferences, and spent a lot of time processing working on putting the experience of the journey into book form. I also worked with a data guru to help me make sense of the more than 700 responses to my three questions through a more thorough analysis process. 
The first half of 2017 will focus on advancing the book’s production process. With a summer publication date, the journey will continue as I work to bring the BSW story to a wider audience. From anecdotes to underlying wisdom gleaned, I look forward to sharing the insights and important takeaways from the project.

 
WHAT COMES NEXT FOR BIG SHARED WORLD?
Just as a small idea turned into the most amazing big adventure, my hope is that this campaign will help define the way forward for Big Shared World. The book production and launch is important, but it is only one part of the bigger picture. Ideally, support for this campaign will garner opportunities to further showcase the importance of embracing curiosity and working together—so we all feel prepared to address the big issues facing our dynamic, fragile world.
 

WHAT IS THE BSW BOOK ALL ABOUT?
The BSW book is part travel journal (think, Bill Bryson), part spiritual memoir (think, idealistic millennial meets Eat Pray Love), and part sociological thesis (except, not boring!). As you read, you’ll follow my experiences from the birth of the BSW idea, across six continents, and back home to the United States, where I start to make sense of it all. Along the way, you’ll meet hundreds of people from around the globe who enter into deeply meaningful conversation about the modern world we all share.
It has been said that “Man travels the world over in search of what he needs and returns home to find it.” I discovered the truth in those words, certainly. But I have also come to understand what author Pat Conroy means when he says, “Once you have traveled, the voyage never ends, but is played out over and over again in the quietest chambers. The mind can never break off from the journey.”
The BSW book is both my opportunity to share my journey with you—and to play it out over and over again, gleaning more insight with each new reflection upon it.
 

WHAT WILL BE THE OUTCOME OF THIS CAMPAIGN?
The Big Shared World journey was brought to life with the help of hundreds of people from all around the world. What better way to publish its results than with a crowdfunding campaign?
While the manuscript has been written, this campaign will help fund book production professionals—including editors, designers, and printers—who will help the book be the best ambassador to for the larger Big Shared World goals as possible.  
HOW WILL THE MONEY BE SPENT?
To better understand the costs of independent publishing, see the chart and descriptions below. 

 
Total: $15,000
*Breakdown of costs are determined based on a word count of 75,000. 
 

WHAT DOES THE BOOK EDITING AND DESIGN PROCESS ENTAIL?
The following are some of the larger components included:
Developmental Edit - This includes a full reading of the manuscript by an editor who will indicate where the story could be expanded or trimmed, address confusing passages, and suggest where revisions could be made throughout.  (approx $3000)
Copyedit - A copyeditor will fix misspellings, verb tense issues, errors in character names or continuity, and make sure edits from the first round of developmental editing didn't introduce any new errors or break style. (approx $3000)
Layout Design - A custom interior design of a book includes fonts, formatting, and styles used throughout a book. Coming up with a consistent template for each chapter maintains consistency and readability throughout the book. (approx $2500)
Proofread - A proofreader goes through an edited, formatted book to look for any mistakes in the text, as well as any undesirable design elements. (approx $1000)
Cover Design - Many people judge a book by its cover, so a quality design is important to the quality of the overall book. Cover and back cover design includes  marketing copy to tell the book’s story and details such as generating the barcode for selling purposes. (approx $1000)
Formatting + Publication Costs - Once the manuscript is print-ready, it will be available on Amazon and other book-selling platforms. Each has different requirements and fees associated. Also, the book will need an ISBN and other official components. (approx $1000)
Printing - Even authors have to pay for their books! Printing costs will cover books ordered through the campaign, as well as an initial run of books to share in marketing and publicity efforts. (approx $2000)
Campaign Logistics - Running a crowd fund campaign incurs costs such as video production, perk fulfillment, and transaction costs with Indiegogo and payment platforms. (approx $2000)
 

The main goal for this campaign is to fund the editorial and design process for the BSW book. Upon reaching our goal, we will move forward with additional steps to achieve a successful book launch. We have brainstormed stretch goals that will help take the book and Big Shared World to the next level. Effective marketing can get a book off the shelf and into people’s hands. Setting longer term goals for Big Shared World will allow the BSW team to continue developing programs for engagement beyond the stories in the BSW book.

The Big Shared World team looks forward to amplifying the mission by developing partnerships and delivering materials that can help bring the message of BSW to more people. We hope that once the initial funding goal of $15,000 is met, we will be able to pursue our stretch goals in order to further expand the BSW project through marketing and outreach, as well as program and curriculum development.
 

WHAT DO I GET FOR MY CONTRIBUTION?
The fun of a crowdfund campaign is in the perks! Our perks are designed at all levels, with individuals and organizations in mind. For just $5, you can receive a handwritten thank you postcard from me, and YOUR NAME IN THE BOOK! The first print run of the BSW book will include a section in the back of the book listing all the contributors at this level and above. For $1500, I will send you 20 autographed copies of the book, then personally show up to your book club meeting to share in the stories of Big Shared World together!
For organizations, I look forward to sharing the insights from Big Shared World with your team! For just $500, we can have a customized consulting session over Skype. For $3000, I'll come to your organization and speak in person! All larger perks include a bulk purchase of the books. 
To keep the campaign fresh, there will be new perks launched throughout the campaign. Coming soon, my personal favorite is the BSW Travel Lover's Package which will be full of my favorite products for an on-the-go individual! If you contribute to the campaign early on, you'll be first to get updates of new perks added to the campaign. 
The perks in this campaign were sourced to include products from ethical companies with a social mission as part of their business models. For instance, the socks in the Book Lover’s Package are from Conscious Steps, a company that gives a portion of their sales to charitable causes. The passport holder in the Travel Lover’s Package is from 11:11, a small business in California that makes each product by hand, with love. 

This journey, this campaign, and this book are all about embracing curiosity and starting conversations that make people think. Contributing to this campaign is not just about helping to publish the stories in the BSW book, it is about joining me and the BSW team in our efforts to bring people together and start meaningful conversations about our Big Shared World, today. 
 

Big Shared World would be just an idea if it wasn’t for the help of hundreds of people—people who answered the questions, welcomed me in their homes, offered suggestions and expertise. Everyone who made this journey come to life is part of the BSW Community!
In addition, the BSW team includes talented individuals and organizations who have supported the journey professionally.

During the course of the travel, IDG researched an extensive list of resources to help me find more information about various topics that struck me while traveling. The end result was a comprehensive, annotated bibliography that expanded my understanding of concepts ranging from climate change to geopolitics.

story:
Story of My Book

The First Generation has insights from children of Serbian, Filipino, Peruvian, Vietnamese, and Chinese immigrants, and it helps us realize that our problems do not discriminate. These mental health problems are common in all cultures, which is why we need to make it not only acceptable but normal to talk about our mental wellness.

My name is Eileen Stremming and I am the author of The First Generation. I wrote this book because it is so important for us to talk about mental health and it should not be stigmatized. Let’s talk about mental health like we can our physical health. 


My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover that it is up to you to hold yourself accountable to help break down mental health stigma, as well as learn that mental illness does not have to debilitate you. Reframing the conversations around mental health so that they are a normal part of any discussion starts right here. In this book, I hope to instill the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for normalizing mental health in you. And then ultimately I want you to see this book as a tool to help you find that it is completely okay to talk about mental health.

In this book, you'll learn why it's harder to talk about mental health for first-generation children and how important a support system is in order to help yourself and eventually others.

  • You’ll hear about the story of Jady, who found that you are not alone in your journey. Your support system can be the one that you were born with.
  • The story of Ena, who found that listening to the people who have your genuine well-being at heart makes it easier to get out of your head.
  • The story of Jane who, despite her family’s judgments, decided that she needed to get help — and realized that she is the only one who can call the shots in her life. You’ll see that you can take responsibility for your own life and health too.

You will love this book if you are passionate about normalizing mental health assistance and learning about stories from people on their mental health journeys.

The First Generation is a non-fiction book that speaks to children of immigrants and people with mental health problems who are looking at de-stigmatizing mental health and getting help for the first time.

The Book - The First Generation

This book is written in 5 Parts.

Part 1 contains the introduction and why it’s harder for children of immigrants to navigate the conversation surrounding mental health journeys. It’s hard for children of immigrants to discuss these problems because we do not want to appear ungrateful for all that our parents have gone through. In this section, I share my own personal story with mental health as well as my little sister’s experience with the same problems, and the story of Justin Nguyen and his experiences with mental health.

Part 2 contains Chapters 4, 5, and 6. This part helps us recognize the signs of common mental illnesses. It's important to educate ourselves, advocate for our friends with mental health problems, and help prevent suicides. It’s up to us to hold ourselves accountable in normalizing conversations surrounding mental health.

Part 3 contains Chapters 7, 8, and 9. In this section, stories are shared from children of immigrants discussing the importance of creating a support system and simply finding somewhere they feel safe discussing their problems.

Part 4 contains Chapters 10 and 11. This part delves into trying to do something when your mental health seems to be faltering and kicking your butt. It will include stories from people who finally took responsibility into their own hands to better their mental health.

Part 5 contains Chapters 12, 13, and 14. In this section, I will share stories from people who are trying to help break down the stigma and how they are just doing that, as well as advice from mental health professionals on how to do so.
 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
 
  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December 2019.
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for My Book - to make help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this winter!

When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition—which is ultimately what I would LOVE to do.  

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish

  • A personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book.
  • Your name will appear in a special Acknowledgements section of my book (“with Special Thanks to...”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my book and my entire manuscript— with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover!
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book
  • And more...

About the Author

Eileen Stremming is an aspiring psychology trailblazer and Patient Care Coordinator intern at Agape Therapy Institute where she gets to see the ropes of how a practice works. She hopes that this can be the beginning of making an impact in the world of mental health.

She wrote this book because she’s tired of people seeing mental illness as “less than” a physical illness. Just because you cannot see a mental illness does not mean it is not real — and that’s why conversations around mental health need to happen. She is passionate about normalizing the idea of therapy as if it was as simple as going to the doctor’s office.

Eileen’s cats, Katherine and Hamilton, would say she’s a pretty good mommy — she spends hours baking her life away when she’s stressed, gives THE BEST cuddles, and is the most lovingest mom they could have ever wished for.

For more information, you can connect with Eileen at eileenrenee07@gmail.com and eileenrenee_ on Instagram.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:
  • Please share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family, and network. Please use #EileenGetsLITerary and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
  • Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much for all of your love and support!

Warmest hugs and kindest regards,
Eileen Stremming

story:
¿Qué?

Una niña de mi edad es la historia de dos chicas: Alegra y Gladys, que una vez se encuentran emprenden una serie de aventuras de menor a mayor grado.

Alegra lleva un sol interior, una luz manifiesta en sus acciones, que crece para salvar a su amiga de la oscuridad. Esta fuerza concentrada la lleva a descubrir una serie de circunstancias adversas a Gladys, a quien ilumina, día tras día, con fervor, hasta convertirla en una lectora apasionada. Como una heroína, Alegra asciende con su compañera a sublimes alturas. Descubre un túnel oculto en el sótano de la casa de los Gasparotto e inicia junto a Gladys un viaje en el tiempo, que revela valor y pasión por el conocimiento.

¿Quiénes?

Tandaia es una editorial con voluntad de cambio, de dar la alternativa a autores que no la encuentran en otro lugar, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el emplear una campaña preventa para valorar la aceptación y viabilidad de cada título.

De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.

Hoy se nos presenta Beatriz Pineda Sansone.

Nací en la ciudad de Maracaibo, Venezuela, una tierra ardiente llena de luz. De niña era inquieta, llena de arrojo. Admiraba a nuestro Arturo Uslar Pietri cuando conducía su programa televisivo Valores Humanos. Su huella imborrable ha sido mi norte. Mi mayor encanto siempre han sido los niños con su arco iris de inocencia, su sencillez y su corazón floreciente. Cuando tuve los veintidós años, contraje matrimonio con Marcos Sansone, el compañero de mi vida. Tuve cuatro hijas maravillosas, que han extendido el fuego que llevo dentro a otros confines. Gracias a ellas he realizado grandes aventuras a favor de los niños.
          Creé el Taller Literario Infantil Manzanita que devino en Fundación en 1985. Más tarde, con motivo del nacimiento de un nuevo diario en Maracaibo, fundé Azulejo, el periódico de los niños del diario La Verdad —primera etapa—. Extendí el Programa La Hora del Cuento a centros de arte, museos, universidades, colegios y McDonald’s de la ciudad con el fin de cultivar en los niños el amor por la lectura, y todas sus destrezas cognitivas, afectivas y psicomotoras. He luchado con pasión por convertir a los niños en emperadores de la palabra. Más tarde, en 1996, obtuve el título en Filología Hispánica con el premio Summa Cum Laude en la mención Investigación y Crítica de la Universidad del Zulia.
          Cursé estudios de postgrado (2000-2003), y publiqué mis primeros escritos en la misma institución: Las memorias del maestro Ramiro (1979); Desde otro rayo (1992); Cosmogonía en la obra de Ramón Palomares. Revista de Literatura Hispanoamericana No. 36 (1998). Me convertí en articulista de los diarios venezolanos Economía hoy y El Universal. Luego comencé a viajar con mi familia. He vivido en los Estados Unidos, Italia y España. En España he publicado: Los ojos de la montaña (2011), La Hora del Cuento. Enseñar a razonar a los niños a través de la lectura de cuentos (2015), y El Principito y los Ideales. Defensa de la libertad, del amor y del razonamiento (2017).
          He recibido premios y reconocimientos a lo largo del camino, que me han regalado una gran satisfacción. Un relato de mi autoría titulado «Un extraño visitante» ha sido homenajeado recientemente por promover los valores a través de la lectura por la Fundación editorial el Perro y la Rana de Venezuela (2018). Estoy afiliada al Grupo de Estudios Peirceanos de la Universidad de Navarra.

¿Por qué?

Y por aquí una muestra de lo que encontraréis en sus páginas:

«Un día, después del almuerzo, mientras Gladys tendía la ropa de los niños en las cuerdas del patio, yo observaba con curiosidad que había un marcado desnivel en el terreno donde se encontraba la casa de los Gasparotto, de forma que la cocina, el último cuarto y las áreas del servicio se elevaban del terreno a más de un metro, así que había que subir por unas escaleras como de seis o siete peldaños para llegar hasta ellas.
          Le comenté a Gladys que en Italia, la mayoría de las casas tenían desnivel, porque había sótano. Pero acá era muy poco común, y, sin darme cuenta, me vi persiguiendo una pista que me indicara que, efectivamente, había subterráneo. Y, en efecto, en el lugar menos esperado comenzamos a notar que la pintura estaba agrietada formando un cuadrado perfecto.
          Enseguida fuimos por una espátula y un cuchillo y con cuidado comenzamos a abrir la fisura. Pero, cuál fue nuestra sorpresa al percibir que un pedazo de pared se desprendió con facilidad, porque se trataba de una capa delgadita de cemento, así que continuamos levantándola, siempre guiadas por la grieta que aparecía en la pared, y otros pedazos comenzaron a caer, dejando al descubierto la superficie de madera de una pequeña puerta por donde una persona adulta doblada podía entrar. La empujamos con fuerza y ella cedió. Apareció, entonces, ante nosotros una boca oscura que nos causó sobresalto. Pero no entramos, aquel escenario inspiraba sospecha, temor. Se me ocurrió ir corriendo a casa en busca de dos linternas y un palo de escoba.
          —A lo mejor nos tropezamos con un depósito de vino o con un tesoro —dije.
          Armadas con el palo de escoba y las dos linternas, iluminamos el recinto desde afuera, y nuestro asombro creció cuando notamos la presencia de una escalera como de dos metros que descendía más aún. Decidimos entrar con mucho cuidado, pues pensamos que allí se podía ocultar cualquier tipo de bicho.
          Con las dos linternas pudimos iluminar aquel espacio oculto que no recibía luz por ninguna otra parte. Y comenzamos a descender, caminábamos con suma precaución apartando telas de araña. Aquél era un espacio grande como el de una habitación.»

¿Cómo?

Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 880€; esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cincuenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.

  • Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
  • Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
  • Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.

Los fondos recaudados, se utilizarán como ayuda para sacar adelante esta primera edición de Una niña de mi edad que saldría después a la venta.

Aviso para navegantes: La opción RESPALDAR es únicamente para realizar donaciones a la edición, por lo que no habrá comunicaciones posteriores en busca de datos de envío... cualquiera de las opciones válidas de reserva exige cumplimentar formulario para poder servir el pedido.

Además...

Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona a la autora, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y Beatriz PIneda Sansone vea publicada su obra.

Gracias por vuestro tiempo.

Política de Privacidad

story:
Does life often seem harder than it should? 

Do other people seem to succeed faster than you? 

Do their lives seem easier, less stressful and more glamorous, too? 

Have you ever wondered to yourself…why?!

My name is Eugene Vassilas and I am the author of The F*ck Yes Life. 

After writing my first book, The Rebel’s Bible —a guide to developing inner strength— I discovered how many well-intentioned people get secretly trapped by their “struggle” mindset. 

While chasing a better life, it becomes 'hard work' and 'long hours' and 'life's hard' all the way.

If any of this sounds familiar, don’t worry. It’s not your fault;

You’ve been unwittingly conditioned to think and live this way by society and other people.

But with The F*ck Yes Life, I'm going to help you make hustle, stress & fear-based living a thing of the past.

Not to mention, you're going to love the powerful mindsets, stories and lessons that will stick with you a lifetime. 

My hope is that, in reading this book, you’ll discover how accessible your “dream life“— whatever that means to you— really is —without all the “hustling” and  “grinding”.

(If this sound’s crazy, then you definitely need to get this book.)

I'm going to show you how to create a life that is fun, productive, and flows — no matter what yours looks like at the moment.

My hope is that I hope to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for personal growth. And then ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you create your own better world, and bring it to life.

 

This is a book about mindset transformation and personal evolution.

You'll read stories such as:

  • How many stress-driven working cultures prey on your insecurities — and how to recognize it and stop being exploited because of your dreams of success. 
  • How Justin Faerman, Co-Founder of the Flow Consciousness Institute, left his soul-crushing career despite his fear and shifted into a life more in alignment with his passions and dreams as a visionary entrepreneur and wisdom teacher.
  • How J.D. Bradley, notorious street fighter turned book author — honed his hard-earned lessons from the street into insights on how to remain a badass without fighting and getting what he wanted in life.
  • What 300 Warriors from Ancient Sparta can teach us about mindset and getting things done in 2021.

 

You'll love this book if you:

  • Find yourself struggling at work or home, constantly pushing yourself but spinning your wheels and wondering why!
  • Want to see how the most successful are able to balance hard work and play 
  • Are ready for a high-status communication protocol that’s powerful, purposeful and gets your needs met every time 

 

The F*ck Yes Life is a non-fiction book that speaks to ambitious creatives who are open to looking at success and lifestyle design in a new way.

You might be a business person, lawyer, engineer— or someone who is simply tired of being bullied by never-ending life’s to-dos. 

 

This book is divided into four parts:

In MINDSET, you’ll learn the the principles of living a no-limits life. You’ll be introduced to the mature, powerful badass you already have within, but who may be in hiding. Even so, you’ll start to realize what’s possible for the next version of you— and how to bring that person to life. 

In HEARTSET, we’ll focus on emotions, people and connection. After all, this transition requires an empathy overhaul. You’ll learn how to release judgements, conceit, and your so-called “inadequacies” so you can show up as a powerhouse for yourself and others. You’ll connect deeper and feel more satisfied more often as a result.

In BODYSET, we’ll focus on behavior and action. We’ll focus on getting this empowered mindset into your muscle memory, so you can own it. That way, you can still get stuff done, but stay relaxed and balanced while doing it. This section is also going to prove how pointless the "go 110% all the time" strategy is. Instead, you’ll learn how to start doing the right things in the right way, for more grace and ease.

In FUTURESET, you’ll learn how to get out of bed excited each day, and the tools to deal with any challenges which may pop up on the way to the life of your dreams.
 

>>>>BTW: If you support The F*ck Yes Life and want more confidence-packed content, choose the Perk option Rebel Confidence Coaching Program.  This is my 8-week, become-a-badass, live online group process, that starts late Feb. You'll see there's currently a waitlist, but if you choose this perk, you'll get guaranteed entry and  at  1/3 off the blockbuster price. Visit rebelconfidenceprocess.com for more info. <<<<

Ok, now back to the other details...

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April, 2021.
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this Spring.


When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • You will receive a paperback copy of my book when I publish.
  • And much more!

 

ABOUT THE AUTHOR

Eugene Vassilas is a high-performance coach, author and workshop facilitator.

After a serious personal encounter with death, Vassilas was forced  to examine his old default life: overcommitted, always striving, and never-enough.

Motivated to make his “second chance” at life count, he set out on a multi-year, around-the-world journey to find the teachers and learn the skills to show up strong in life— without all the effort and stress from before.

These lessons, and many more, he has distilled into a powerful methodology and put into his books, The Rebel’s Bible and The F*ck Yes Life.

When not supporting others, he’s a movement enthusiast who loves yoga and Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu. You can also find him practicing his languages (EN, BP, DN, ES, GK, IT) in a city near you as he travels the world for work and play.

For more information, you can connect with him IG at Eugene.vass or FB at Eugene Vassilas.
 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network.
  • Please use #thefuckyeslife and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page
  • Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Eugene Vassilas

Motivated to make his “second chance” at life count, he set out on a multi-year, around-the-world journey to find the teachers and learn the skills to show up strong in life— without all the effort and stress from before.These lessons, and many more, he has distilled into a powerful methodology and put into his books, The Rebel’s Bible and The F*ck Yes Life.When not supporting others, he’s a movement enthusiast who loves yoga and Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu. You can also find him practicing his languages (EN, BP, DN, ES, GK, IT) in a city near you as he travels the world for work and play.For more information, you can connect with him IG at Eugene.vass or FB at Eugene Vassilas. 
Risks & Challenges
The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 
Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network.
Please use #thefuckyeslife and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.
You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page
Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you of all of your love and support!Thanks again,Eugene Vassilas

story:
A Riveting Tale

Wildflowers is a riveting tale that dives into the life of Charlotte.

Charlotte spends her time at her wooded cottage home looking after the house and taking care of her younger sisters, Anna and Sadie. While trying to manage a household, she suffers from abuse at the hand of her mother.

Ma has been depressed and grieving but, lately, things have gotten worse. Charlotte begins to wonder if something much more sinister is at play once strange things start happening in the home.

Charlotte fights her own demons and uncovers family secrets in a horrifying quest to get Ma back.

My Inspiration

Having a troubled childhood myself, i have decided to use embellished stories of my life to influence my writing. I am also inspired by the works of Stephen King, the horror master himself.

The Funds

I am self publishing my novel. That means no advances to help me fund my venture. Funds from your backing will help me pay Kickstarter fees/taxes, pay my editor, pay for book formatting, and pay for marketing. 

Warning

Contains themes of suicidal ideation and child abuse. Also themes of witchcraft, demonic elements, and entities that will haunt you.

Meet the Author

Vanessa Perry has had a lifelong dream of publishing a novel and she need your help to finally make it happen! 

She is a horror addict. She loves horror movies, books, games, and art. So, it’s only natural that she writes horror! 

She makes her home in El Paso, TX with her husband, her son, and her furry four-legged friend, Dougie the Dog. 

 

Risks and challenges

One potential challenge is the early copy date. I expect the book to be ready for print early in June (official release date is Sep 30). While my editor and I are working to meet deadlines, it is hard to estimate when editing will be complete.

Other Ways You Can Help

Share, share, share! Tell your friends that you know an aspiring author that needs some support!
