story:
UPDATE:  I'm so pleased to share that as of April 8th we hit the goal of $5000 and Chronic will be published this summer! The campaign is still very much open until the end of April so keep pre-ordering and sharing! A portion of the profits over the $5000 goal will be DONATED to the Crohn's & Colitis Foundation in Cleveland, OH. Thank you for the support and kindness!

Story of My Book

Chronic is a story about learning to accept and love the things that make us different. After being diagnosed with a chronic autoimmune disease as a teenager, I spent years denying and fighting against my body. Fear was my north star until I had a life changing experience and learned another way.

Hi! My name is Christine Rich and I am the author of Chronic. I wrote this book because I carried the secret of my disease for years. Despite how confident and “together” I appeared on the outside, on the inside I carried a lot of pain and often felt afraid and angry as I struggled to accept what it meant to live with an invisible illness that no amount of perceived togetherness would cure.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will feel validated if you are someone living with a chronic illness or condition of any kind. I want you to see this book as an invitation and safe space to reflect on your own journey. I hope that by sharing my (very unfiltered!) story you feel brave enough to share yours because I believe something magical happens when women openly talk about their experiences with each other—that “something magical” is connection, community, and a sense of empowerment. At times, you may feel broken, but my hope is that you never feel alone again.

You will love this book if you are currently living with a chronic condition or have ever struggled with accepting a part of yourself that is different. Ultimately, I hope that Chronic inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into engaging questions like:

  1. As women, why do we insist we’re “fine” even when we aren’t?
  2. If people with chronic illness are more susceptible to anxiety and depression, why isn’t mental health more consistently discussed between physician and patient?
  3. What would happen if we viewed our chronic illness not as a monster set out to destroy us, but rather as a child in need of our love, care and attention? How would that shift in perception change our relationship to our illness?

I look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers.
 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in August, 2021
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this summer.

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook!

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Author’s Note and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!

 

About the Author

Christine Rich is a marketing executive at a Fortune 200 company who enjoys developing talent and building successful business strategies.

She’s been known to lovingly annoy her family, friends and co-workers with her high energy, mental repository of positive quotes, and ability to look on the bright side. She is obsessed with reading memoirs by strong women and truly believes that when one woman shines, we all shine.

Christine wrote Chronic in the hopes of connecting with other women who are living with a chronic illness or condition of any kind and struggling to find acceptance and wellness. As a young woman diagnosed with a chronic autoimmune disease, Christine spent many years trying to hide from and deny the fear, anger and sadness she felt as a result of her illness. After a serious health scare in 2009, she changed her life by making the conscious decision to no longer let fear hold her back from living the wholehearted life she wanted for herself. Today, Christine is a mom, award-winning marketing leader, retired spin instructor, author and volunteer who is passionate about breaking down the stigma of chronic illness and mental health.

When she’s not working, you will likely find her spending time with her family near the lake by her house, reading a book, riding her Peloton, laughing with friends, and relentlessly keeping her “wellness and remission tripod” strong and in check. Christine resides in Hudson, OH with her husband Joe and two daughters, Stella and Roma.

For more information, you can connect with Christine at christinerich0309@gmail.com, at christinerich_author on Instagram or on LinkedIn at linkedin.com/in/christinerich0309/.
 

International Preorders

For international preorders, please send me a private message.
 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #chronic2021 and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
  • Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Chronically yours,
Christine Rich

story:
Story of My Book


Perspectives: Through the Looking Glass merges poetry and personal stories to explore truth and beauty through various perspectives. It is also interactive and encourages readers to speak their own truths with the help of questions.

My name is Aylah Birks, and I am the author of Perspectives: Through the Looking Glass. I wrote this book to share my story of gaining self-confidence as an African-American woman. I wanted to provide a different type of book for readers to read; my book will include exercises that encourage readers to think about their own lives while reading about mine.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will find a deeper level of self-understanding. I want you to see this book as an opportunity to question your own beliefs and opinions within the storylines, plots, and language. Additionally, I would like for this book to bring you a sense of confidence, and to acts as an escape from the world. 


In this book, you’ll join me in exploring racism, self-confidence, self-love, along with many other topics.

You will love this book if you enjoy interactive texts and poems that force you to think about your own life and place in the universe.  You will also love this book if you appreciate poetic elements woven into a cohesive narrative. 


Perspectives: Through the Looking Glass speaks to readers who want to better express themselves, and better understand the concepts of free speech, and the mind-soul connection. 

I hope that this book inspires people to ask questions like: 

  • What can I do to change the negative aspects of my personality? 
  • What is a community? How do you build one?
  • Where is my place in society? Should I want to follow trends, or should I try to start my own?
I look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers. I believe everyone should at least attempt to answer these questions for themselves. 
 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in August 2021.
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, eBook formats).
  • The copyediting for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this summer.

When I pre-sell 120 paperback copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and eBook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover and an audiobook.


I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish it.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Author’s Note and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!
 

About the Author

Aylah Birks is a current honor student at Twiggs County High School, who is poised to be the class valedictorian. After graduation, she would like to major in behavioral science/psychology and legal studies, while minoring in communications and forensic science. She is a community leader through her work with the Georgia Campaign for Adolescent Power and Potential, her GCAPP county initiative; The Twiggs County Community Action Team, the Southern Christian Leadership Conference, and many other organizations. Throughout GCAPP, she has participated in several webinars and youth education opportunities, which have been some of the highlights of her tenure with GCAPP. Additionally, she co-created the Hear Us Out Campaign, alongside other Youth Advisory Council members, during the summer of 2020, and also has planned several statewide summits and seminars.

She wrote this book in order to build a community coalition of both readers and authors in order to bridge the communication gap between the two. Additionally, the driving force behind this book was to cultivate both perspective and diversity, by allowing different topics and thought-provoking questions to be asked during this time. Her passions include advocating for many topics such as mental and sexual health awareness, social justice, and poetry. She enjoys art, old-school music, talking, and laughing. The impact that she hopes to have is that readers are able to walk away from her book, having learned something new.

For more information, you can connect with me at:

Aylah Birks
aylah.birks@gmail.com
official_aylah.b (Instagram)
Aylah Birks (LINKEDIN)
 

International Preorders

For international preorders, please send me a private message.
 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:
  • Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family, and network. Please use #PTTLG and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
  • Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

 

Thank you so much for all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Aylah Birks

story:
My Story

I want to self publish a picture book called, "I Just LOOK Different," for children born with facial deformities so that they know they are not alone, and to foster understanding in hopes of reducing, if not stopping, bullying of those children.

Here is my story.

The little girl in the picture is me, around 4 years old.

My twin sister and I were both born with a bilateral cleft lip and palate. It was a surprise to both of my parents. But we were lucky in many respects. Our dad was in the Air Force, so the numerous medical procedures, which started at 3 months old, were covered by insurance. But more importantly, my sister and I were lucky in that we had each other. We had someone with us at all times that knew what we were going through, someone to talk to, share our fears with, and ultimately commiserate when the teasing began. That teasing and taunting followed us in to adulthood, when it finally stopped. It's been a weird blessing, though I wouldn't wish it on anyone.

It was during one of my shifts as a radiology technologist when the idea of the book came to me. I had to do a chest x-ray on an inpatient at the hospital where I was working. But when I went to get the patient, I was greeted by the stunning site of a person with no face. This patient had tried to commit suicide with a gun shot under the chin but had failed. The patient was alert, but horribly disfigured and blind for life. I didn't know what had prompted this person to get to that point, but I knew they would be in for what would probably be a lifetime of stares and whispers about how they looked.

Who this book is for

All I could think about for hours afterwards was what I had endured growing up, and what children all over born with facial defects were dealing with every day as far as the teasing and bullying. I researched to see if there were any books that are actually meant to help children with facial deformities deal with adversity, and there are very few. So I went to the cafeteria during my lunch break and wrote the book. I called it, "I Just Look Different." But I wasn't comfortable sending it off to a publisher, to be changed and altered. It was my story. It was me.

 When I was younger, bullying was much more personal and direct when the cruel names and taunts were said directly to my face. Everyone knows that in this day and age, bullying has gone to extremes with all of the technology that is out there. Kids need as much support as they can get in dealing with the verbal attacks that come at them from so many places, and which seem to unfortunately be so common place these days. This point was brought home to me after I appeared on America's Got Talent.

I love singing and auditioned for America's Got Talent a few years ago. I made it to Las Vegas before I was cut, but because of those brief few minutes I had been given on T.V, I received hundreds of emails from people born with all types of facial defects, their parents, siblings, and friends, thanking me for putting myself out there and putting a face on something that nobody really talks about. I wanted to publish it after reading them, but still couldn't afford to do so. Now, hopefully with your help, I can.

This book is very personal. It chronicles some of the things I dealt with when I was very young. It is for the children out there like me. They need to know that there are other kids out there like them who have gone through what they are going through every day. Hopefully, the book will also educate those kids who may think it's okay to say hurtful things to other kids, especially for reasons beyond their control. This book is for ALL of them.

THE COST AND BENEFITS

I am self-publishing this book so I can make every decision regarding its printing and publication and offer non-profit organizations reduced retail pricing. The publishing package and the initial printing which of 1000 copies to keep the retail price down will cost $4000. Any money after that will be needed to pay for the illustrations for the book. Part of the profits at the end of the year will go to Ameriface, Operation Smile, and the Smile Train, all national organization that offer information and support to families with children born with facial defects. I am hoping to find an artist willing to do the art work at a reduced rate due to the nature of this book.

I am dedicated to seeing this through, so if the funds aren't raised this time around, I will do what I can with the money raised to get it started, then fund raise again until I make my goal. There are multiple perks being offered as an incentive to donate.

Thank you so much for your support!

Other Ways You Can Help

Know any organizations that help kids with facial defects, or doctor's offices, clinics? Please let them know about this project to help get the word out! Any clinics or non-profit organizations will get a deeply reduced price for any books they order when they order directly from me!

My Story
I want to self publish a picture book called, "I Just LOOK Different," for children born with facial deformities so that they know they are not alone, and to foster understanding in hopes of reducing, if not stopping, bullying of those children.
Here is my story.
The little girl in the picture is me, around 4 years old.
My twin sister and I were both born with a bilateral cleft lip and palate. It was a surprise to both of my parents. But we were lucky in many respects. Our dad was in the Air Force, so the numerous medical procedures, which started at 3 months old, were covered by insurance. But more importantly, my sister and I were lucky in that we had each other. We had someone with us at all times that knew what we were going through, someone to talk to, share our fears with, and ultimately commiserate when the teasing began. That teasing and taunting followed us in to adulthood, when it finally stopped. It's been a weird blessing, though I wouldn't wish it on anyone.
It was during one of my shifts as a radiology technologist when the idea of the book came to me. I had to do a chest x-ray on an inpatient at the hospital where I was working. But when I went to get the patient, I was greeted by the stunning site of a person with no face. This patient had tried to commit suicide with a gun shot under the chin but had failed. The patient was alert, but horribly disfigured and blind for life. I didn't know what had prompted this person to get to that point, but I knew they would be in for what would probably be a lifetime of stares and whispers about how they looked.

story:
Would You Travel the World for Five Years?

This is the true story of a young rabbi who quits the pulpit to travel the world. Rabbi Ben lays out a five year plan to climb the highest mountains, scuba dive with sharks, and see some of the world’s most impressive sites.

On his journey Ben hopes to discover and explore all the world has to offer. His beliefs as a person, as a spiritual leader, and as a religious Jew will be challenged as new situations constantly arise. Now it is time to see what he truly believes in.

‘God is in My Backpack’ follows the first year of Ben’s travels from Australia to Canada, Central and South America, Europe, and India. He shares his personal journey as he discovers a deeper connection with the world at large, and with G-d.

It was not always easy for Ben, as he writes in the book...

A movie was playing on the in-flight screen. I didn’t find it interesting but kept watching anyway. It gave me a way to distract myself from all my nagging thoughts and rising anxiety. So many things came to mind: Could I really travel for the next five years? What if I got bored? Maybe after a while everything would become uninteresting. Seeing a waterfall, a museum, or a monument would just make me say, ‘Yeah, whatever it’s just another waterfall!’ 

And what about money?  Would I have enough? What if I ran out? Maybe things would cost more than I planned? Would this mean I’d need to stop and get a job at some point?

Would I always be able to find food to fit my kosher dietary needs? Could I really survive on mostly fruit, nuts, vegetables, rice, and eggs? I guess I could? I read that if you ate only avocados you could live for a year… but yuck… I didn’t want to eat only avocados for one year.

And could I run away from who I was? I was a rabbi and cantor, – who would I be now? What would my label be? Don’t we all need labels? Don’t we all need to be able to say, “Hi, I’m John. I am an accountant,” or, “I’m Sally and I’m a nurse.”

What was I going to say? I was giving up my identity that I spent the last few years creating. Perhaps I could just be ‘Ben.’ That’s it. ‘Ben,’ nothing more, nothing less… well, maybe a bit more.  I could give my full name, ‘Binyamin.’ This could give me an identity boost. ‘Binyamin,’ in the Bible was the youngest son of Jacob. This was perhaps better than plain ‘Ben.’ But maybe it would be good to lose my identity completely and create a whole new one?

   Iguassu Falls, Brazil

Why You Should Read This Book?

The book is roughly 130,000 words, packed with exciting stories that will inspire and amuse you. Ben shares his travel tips and spiritual perspectives as he strives to understand both the good and the bad experiences.  It is like reading an exciting travel adventure story, though with a Jewish twist along with some deep profound wisdom. 

Many of Ben's travel stories have been published in newspapers and magazines around the world. 

God is in my backpack is different than anything else out there. People dream of taking a holiday, climbing Kilimanjaro, visiting the Taj Mahal, and seeing the amazing wonders of the world, some made by G-d and others by man. Ben lived this dream and now shares his story with you in the hopes that perhaps you too can find and live your dreams.

As an Orthodox Jew who observes the Sabbath and dietary laws of Kashrut, Ben shares his challenges as he tries to stay strong in his religious practice in spite of many obstacles and strange situations. Whatever your beliefs are, you can draw insights into how to hold onto them in difficult situations.

Here is a Sample from the Book:

(Please note: photos won't necessarily be in the book, and things may change slightly after editing)

Along with journal entries, I had other writing to do. I had to fill out postcards to send to family and friends. Most importantly was a weekly card to Grandma. She loved to get the cards and to hear about what I was up to. I couldn’t always tell her the truth, though; some things would make her too nervous. It was important to make her a bit worried, but not too much. Grandma’s job – like any good Jewish grandmother – was to worry about her children and grandchildren. I had to do my share and give her something to worry about, but not, G-d forbid, enough to give her a heart attack.

So, what do I tell Grandma?

I should probably not mention the volcano I climbed this week – yes, the one with the flowing lava – the one where we hiked along a red stream of hot, molten rock. It had been flowing one foot away from me and I could feel the rising heat. The rock was sharp and jagged. One guy slipped and cut his hand and backpack. He probably needed some stitches.

 

This is not a story to tell Grandma. Because it’s not even something she can share with her friends when they sit around drinking tea and kvetching. If she starts telling them how worried she is about her grandson, the Rabbi, who is now climbing active volcanoes, her friends may think she’s started to lose her mind.

Instead, I will talk about the weather, the food, and the people. But how boring! I don’t want to write about this. However, it is something she could worry about and share with her friends.

“Oy, I tell you, my grandson, the Rabbi,” I could hear Grandma saying. “I don’t know what he’s doing in Guatemala, where’s he supposed to get a job in Guatemala; how many Jews and synagogues do you think there are in Guatemala? And look at this card he sends me – he says it was very cold, so he went to the market and bought a jacket for five dollars…How warm is a  five-dollar jacket supposed to keep him! I hope he doesn’t get sick, G-d forbid…”

This could work, I thought; but, I’d spoken about the weather in the last card.

I could tell her about my three days soaking in the hot thermal bath in the mountains. I should probably leave out the part that I was the only one there – well, at least during the night and early morning, when everyone was gone. People came up during the day. But there are a few small cabins to stay in overnight, which are expensive for local people, but with American dollars, it wasn’t much. Early in the mornings, I would soak in the pools, surrounded by lush, green hills. As the sun rose and the clouds lifted, it looked like something from a prehistoric world. It made me think of the movie Jurassic Park that I saw as a kid. A misty jungle. I was almost waiting for a dinosaur to appear.

At night, I lit a wood fire in my small, cozy cabin. I could sit and think. It was one of the most peaceful places I’d ever been to. I like these opportunities because when I’m alone, I can meditate and work on my connection with G-d.

 

But this is too much; it won’t fit on one postcard.

I could write smaller, but Grandma won’t be able to read it.

Hmmmm…

Maybe I’ll tell her about Dan, the lobster, and the food poisoning? No, I didn’t write to her about that story yet.

Better not.

She’s already worried about what I’m eating. Thirty years ago in India, my uncle got serious food poisoning. Grandma’s been worried ever since.

“Grandma, Guatemala is not India…Yes, I know it is a third-world country, but…Okay, I promise to be careful what I eat. Anyway, I’m eating mostly fruits and vegetables…Yes, Grandma, I’m peeling everything, and I’m not drinking the local water, only purified, bottled water.”

We’d had this conversation already – was it three times or four? I can’t remember. Oh, that’s another thing – should you actually trust the bottled water. I’ve heard there have been some scams where people re-bottle tap water to sell to tourists.

I’d better not mention this.

Why don’t I write to my good friend Yossi in Australia instead?

I can tell him about my plans to climb Volcán Tajumulco, a 13,845-foot-high volcano. Yes, this is exciting.

 

No, but first I must write to Grandma and to my family.

I know, I’ll write about what it’s like to travel between villages on a local bus. I can tell them about the box that someone placed next to my feet. It had chickens in it. One of them got his head out and began pecking at my foot. It pecked and pecked and pecked. It seemed to really like my right leg. This, I did not appreciate, but there was nowhere else to move either the box or myself.

I kept asking it politely to stop pecking. I tried giving it a little kick. Nothing, it just kept pecking.

Perhaps I was the lucky one.

An indigenous women dressed in her local tribal clothes – a white blouse with thick, embroidered flowers – boarded the old, yellow school bus holding a large, white rooster. She found a place on the overhead railing and gently placed her rooster up there. There were many spaces between the bars, and the rooster hung out in various places. I was glad I was not sitting underneath, waiting for the rooster to poop on my head.

Perfect!

This week’s postcard is taken care of.

First $2,500 of Profit Goes to Charity

The first $2,500 of profit made from this initial book campaign will go to five Chabad houses to whom I feel a deep sense of gratitude for being there when I needed them. Although I am deeply grateful to every Shul, Chabad house, and Jewish organization that I benefited from along the way, I unfortunately cannot give to all of them. I chose the five below because they are small operations, run by wonderful families who really appreciate every bit of help they can get.

I hope through this campaign to raise at least $2,500 in profit which will enable me to give $500 to each of the five.

  1. Chabad Salvador Brazil
  2. Chabad Puerto Allegra  Brazil
  3. Chabad Lima Peru
  4. Chabad La Paz Bolivia
  5. Chabad Pune India

Thanks for being a part of this project.

 

 You're still reading!

How much more should I share here...I don't want to ruin the book for you...ok just one more piece...

 

Jorge’s mother stoked the fire while Pablo looked around, scanning the village, from house to house. He seemed deeply lost in thought.

“We find you wife from village. A good Guatemala woman who cook for you, no?”

“No, thank you,” I replied; “not interested.”

“Why not?” Pablo pressed. “You marry good girl, you live in village, have many kids, learn Spanish, have a nice farm, some chickens, a few pigs, we have good church you can come to.”

“No, thank you,” I repeated. “It is very thoughtful of you, but I’ve got other things to do with my life.”

Pablo shrugged and said, “Fine, I will teach you some traditional dancing in case you change your mind. If you marry here, you need to dance at wedding.”

I was a Rabbi, or at least an ex-rabbi, I thought. I spent plenty of time dancing at Jewish weddings, Bar and Bat Mitzvahs, and Israel celebrations. Well, that is if you can call what we did dancing – i.e., the hora, the traditional Jewish dance.

Pablo demonstrated his people’s traditional way of how to approach a girl on the dance floor. “Step like this, bow like this, put out your hand…” I guess it worked well if you were dancing at a local village festival. If I tried these steps anywhere else in the world, people would either think I was drunk or doing some comedy routine. My six-year-old dancing partner, Pablo’s daughter, laughed as I did the approach.

Then, it was my turn to show him my traditional dance. I wanted to demonstrate some hora or Chassidic dance steps, though I could not think of any. Chassidic dancing, which is what I grew up with, is mainly running around in a circle while holding hands or clapping. It’s kind of a like doing a hora, only with less rhythm and coordination, and applying more speed.

I explained how, in Chassidic dancing, if you try and dance with any beat or rhythm, you will be bumped into and pushed out of the circle. The family could not understand how my type of traditional dancing had no steps and no rhythm. “You need to just run around in a circle very quickly and go crazy. Like this…” I kept demonstrating.

They probably thought I was crazy. The family had a good laugh at my antics, as did the half-dozen local village kids who had gathered by the door. They had enjoyed watching the hapless foreigner trying to dance to their music, and now, demonstrating his own traditional dances. They were very helpful, though, and I had an endless source of six-year-old dancing partners to laugh at me.

 

Why This Project?

I have chosen to use the crowd-founding approach to help pay for the publication of this book. There are a number of costs such as, paying the editor, the proof reader, for the cover design and the actual printing of the book. Funds raised here will enable me to get the book published.

Thank you for reading this far and I hope you get a coppy and enjoy the book.
 
-Rabbi Ben

They were very helpful, though, and I had an endless source of six-year-old dancing partners to laugh at me.
 
Why This Project?

I have chosen to use the crowd-founding approach to help pay for the publication of this book. There are a number of costs such as, paying the editor, the proof reader, for the cover design and the actual printing of the book. Funds raised here will enable me to get the book published.

Thank you for reading this far and I hope you get a coppy and enjoy the book.
 
-Rabbi Ben

story:
Anyone wanting to find out the latest news on our Colombia book/CD - it's now been published by the way! - should go to soundsandcolours.com/01-colombia

This summer Sounds and Colours - a UK-based South American music and culture website - is launching it's first ever print edition, focusing on the music and culture of Colombia.

Keen to banish existing stereotypes, this collectable book and accompanying CD takes a fresh look at the country’s music and culture, with articles on established genres like cumbia and vallenato, as well as lesser-known folk rhythms and traditions. It also delves into the current music scene and the ways in which Colombian music has influenced artists worldwide.

There will also be features on Colombian cinema, Circo Para Todos, indigenous culture, alternative tourist destinations, Barranquilla Carnival, and lots more. See 'The Contents' below for full details. We've been working on this content all year, doing research into some of the most interesting cultural aspects of Colombia, as well as speaking to collaborators and writers to work on the content, with the aim of bringing you something unique and insightful.

Sounds and Colours Presents Colombia will be:

  • a thoroughly-researched, passionately-written 208-page book/magazine looking at the music, film, arts and culture of Colombia,
  • a valuable resource for anyone interested in Colombia and its culture,
  • a reflection on both alternative and popular culture from the country,
  • a multimedia publication incorporating articles, photographs and illustrations in the print publication, as well as online platforms featuring exclusive music and resources.

 

Why Colombia?

Colombia is the perfect starting point for what we hope to be a series of Sounds and Colours Print Editions. It's a country that seems condemned to sterotypes, yet if you've been to Colombia you'll know that it is one of the friendliest and most beautiful countries in the world. And - importantly for us - it is a country full of culture.

 

What Is Needed

Quite simply we are aiming to make enough money to print 1,000 copies of the book, all of which will come with an accompanying CD of new Colombian music produced by our good friends at Movimientos (listen to their Colombia radio special here. This accounts for $4,000 of our funding goal. The remaining $500 will go towards paying a number of Colombian artists and illustrators for their artwork.

 

What You Get

You will get:
  • a huge published "thank you!" inside the book from ourselves,
  • the 208-page (234mm x  156mm) book,
  • a CD or download of new Colombian music (depending on which option you choose),
  • the higher-end perk includes a tote bag with specially-commissioned artwork from a Colombian artist (artwork TBC)

[And please don't be put off by the fact this campaign is in dollars. Indiegogo was the best website we found for what we needed, but only allows for campaigns in dollars. We want this product to be international, with people all over the world able to discover the best of Colombian music and culture]

 

The Contents

These articles will all feature in the magazine and will be written by our dedicated writing team:
  • Cumbia, Cumbia, Cumbia! - in-depth look at cumbia, starting with Sonora Dinamita (the group that internationalised the style) and onto the present day. Will include an interview with Toto La Momposina as well info on transplanted styles such as Peruvian cumbia, cumbia sonidera and cumbia villera.
  • The African Influence on Colombia’s Atlantic Coast - feat. interviews with Lucas Silva and Sidney Reyes, photos by Miriam Wirz of Barranquilla’s Picó soundsystems and mixtape of champeta music
  • Guide to Colombian Cinema - looking at new Colombian features and classic cinema. Also including an interview with Ciro Guerra about his film Los Viajes del Viento
  • Barranquilla Carnival - history of 2nd biggest carnival in the world, with photos, 1st person account of festival, and descriptions of all the characters (i.e., Joselito, the Marimondos and Monocucos)
  • Ondatrópica and the Resurgence of Tropical Music - article on this new Colombian all-star project from Quantic and Frente Cumbiero w/ photos by B+ taken inside Discos Fuentes studio
  • Juanchito and the Boom of Salsa Caleña - a look at Colombian salsa and its birth in Cali
  • Circo Para Todos: The Social Power of Circus - article on Circo Para Todos and their work with Colombia’s disadvantaged children, as well as their professional touring group Circolombia
  • The Power of Yage (William Burroughs in Colombia) - a short piece on yage (ayahuasca), focusing on William Burroughs experience of taking yage in the Putumayo
  • Música Pacifica Special feat. interviews with Hugo Candelario, Herencia de Timbiqui and Ancestros, as well as feature on Festival Petronio Alvarez and mixtape of music from Colombia’s Pacific Coast
  • Santiago Garcia, The Master a biography of the recently awarded (2012) UNESCO World Theatre Ambassador Santiago Garcia – el maestro – the man behind the renowned Teatro La Candelaria collective. He is only the second person to be awarded the prize in Latin American, after Augusto Boal.
  • Uniting Indigenous and Modern Culture - article on the indigenous cultures of Colombia as well as ways in which their music has influenced modern musicians such as Teto Ocampo and Hector Buitrago
  • The Train Of Fire and Ice: Mano Negra in Colombia - account of Manu Chao’s trip by train through Colombia
  • Carlos Vives and La Provincia - Turning Vallenato Into A Commercial Sensation
  • Alternative Tourist Destinations: Punta Gallinas (Guajira), Nevado del Cocuy, Cano Cristales (Serranía la Macarena)

Plus, there'll be original artwork from Colombia!!!

  • Specially-commissioned cover collage by Colombian artist Javier Piraguata
  • Illustrations from Colombian comic book artist Power Paola
  • Additional illustrations and original artwork from Colombian artists

 

The CD

Our good friends Movimientos - one of London's finest Latin music promoters and a record label to boot - have agreed to produce a CD of new Colombian music, which will accompany each copy of the book.

For a taste of what to expect from the CD check out this Colombia Special on Moviemientos' SOAS radio show http://soasradio.org/content/movimientos-nuevo-colombia

 

Why Get Involved?

Over the past two years Sounds and Colours has earned a reputation as a worldwide champion of South American culture, with regular readers across Europe, North America, South America and Asia. We've always been committed to finding the most interesting stories and artists, and are at our happiest when unearthing a hidden gem. It's the same approach we are bringing to this edition.

When you buy a copy of Sounds and Colours in print, you help to cover the cost of printing a first edition book. This is a big undertaking. You are also supporting the writers in showcasing their talent, the independent Colombian artists with their artwork, and the creation of a wider audience for Colombian culture. Not to mention the fact that you will get book of passionately-written, well-researched book that you will want to keep for years.

 

Who Are We?

Sounds and Colours is a South American music and culture magazine. Up to now we've always been purely online, with this being our first venture into the physical world!

Our aim has always been to raise awareness of the amazing and diverse cultures of South America, promoting independent artists, groups and movements that rarely get the attention they deserve. This is something which we will continue doing in Sounds and Colours Presents Colombia.

 

Why Are We Using Indiegogo?

We have been planning this book for some time now, and could never quite work out how to make it happen. Trying to get advertisers takes a lot of time and diverts our energies away from actually writing about the things we love. It also creates situations where we have to feature certain content to please our sponsors.

By raising the funds through Crowdfunding it really feels like we are able to keep our DIY aesthetic, and will allow us to make the book that we want to make, and that you all will want to read.

 

Breakdown of Costs

The breakdown of the costs are quite simple. Here they are:

Cost of printing 1,000 books: $3,000

Cost of producing 1,000 CDs: $1,000

Payment for Commisioned Artwork & Articles: $500

 

Que Mas?

As well as the articles mentioned above, we are also planning on featuring some of the following ideas:

  • 5 Colombian Bands To Watch Out For
  • Agua Para Todos / Canto Para Agua: Colombia’s Campaigns for Clean Water
  • Colombian Music in New York (feat. interviews with Uproot Andy, Geko Jones and Cumbamela)
  • How Cumbia Beats Changed the Global Beats Scene (w/ new cumbia mixtape)
  • Fernando Botero - He Likes Big Butts
  • The Unique Sounds of San Andres Island
  • Information on Colombia’s other traditional rhythms, i.e. Bambuco, música carranguera, música llanera
  • Exploring The Putumayo: Colombia’s Forgotten Frontier
  • Feature on Medellin’s burgeoning Hip-Hop Scene
  • Article and/or mixtape highlighting 60s/70s rock ‘n’ roll from Barranquilla and Cartagena
  • Colombianos In London
  • Pablo Escobar as Tourist Attraction
  • Gabriel Garcia Marquez Reader

More info: soundsandcolours.com

See our Colombia section to get a taste of what the book will feature

story:
Summary

s. h. montgomery grew up in a small town in the Texas Panhandle but lived 30 years in Chicago before relocating to Las Vegas, Nevada in 2002. She has two children, a sister who lives in Glasgow, Scotland, and a niece living in Barcelona, Spain. Montgomery is an avid collector of ethnographic artifacts, mainly from Oceania and Africa. She believes in helping to make a difference through volunteering.

s. h. montgomery majored in journalism at Texas Tech University, took creative writing at Northwestern University and Columbia College in Chicago, and has written free-lance travel features for weekly and daily newspapers. She presently assists a screenwriter.

It has been her dream to finish the manuscript that was started over twenty years ago. Whisper in the Blood is an epic saga reminiscent of West Side Story and The Godfather. Spanning generations, the story tells of two immigrant families; one from Italy, the other from Ireland. The book intertwines the fortunes and misfortunes of the two families as they adapt to their new lives in Chicago. Author, s. h. montgomery, combines all the elements of love, passion, lust, crime, greed, good and evil, that will leave you wanting more.

s. h. montgomery is trying to raise the necessary funds to edit, publish, print, publicize and distribute her book, Whisper in the Blood.

Be among the first to own a copy.

Her goal is to raise $6000. The funds will be used to not only edit, publish, print and distribute the book, but also to host a book launching party and "Dinner with the Author" in Las Vegas, Nevada, where she lives. The idea is to get the word out about her work by inviting friends, family, and new acquaintances to participate in the function, as well as inviting the local press and bookstore managers to the event.

The finished book, business cards, website, bookmarks, the book launching and signing event, and "Dinner with the Author" have all been incorporated into the perks.

The book is ready to go to the editor. The final cover design is in the works. Printing has been arranged once the book is ready to go to press, and local PR for the book has already been set up in the form of a guaranteed spot on the radio show "Aspects of Writing", and a possible book signing in a major bookstore; all predicated on the appearance of the final product. Plus, montgomery will print and hand out business cards and bookmarks to let people know about the book. All funds collected, whether she reaches her goal or not, will be used to achieve s.h. montgomery's dream of becoming a published author.


Other Ways You Can Help

Whether you can contribute, or not, please tell your friends about this project. You can use the Indiegogo share tools to help get the word out there about Whisper in the Blood. Please share it on FaceBook, Twitter, Google +, or any other social networks you may belong to.

Sincerely - s. h. montgomery

story:
Who I am and what this is

My name is Dylan Youngers and I am a college student majoring in
Mathematics and Linguistics. I currently live in the Bay Area of California. My free time is typically spent by procrastinating and writing.
The purpose of this campaign is to help fund entries for chapbook competitions. 

A chapbook is a collection of short stories and/or poems (In my case, poems) that is smaller than a regular book; typically, a book will contain anywhere from fifty to one hundred pieces, while a chapbook may contain as little as ten to twenty. The purpose of a chapbook is to allow newer writers, such as myself, a foot in the door of the publishing world. Publishing a chapbook is significantly easier and enables newer writers to start creating collections without having to go through large press houses. Chapbooks are usually more intimate than books; they're often hand-stitched or bound, have a smaller print run, and often reside on the "first frontier", so to speak, of publishing.

Should you help this fundraiser in any way, you will be helping a new writer get his first collection published. That's monumental in itself; it's difficult to make a splash in the near-boundless sea of writers. 

What I need and where it'll go

The funding goal is set to five hundred dollars. Most of this money will go towards submission fees for chapbook contests; a great deal of the larger chapbook contests require a small payment to help fund the contest and these payments can range from ten dollars up to fifty. A smaller portion will go towards covering the costs of the perks, however most of that will come from my own pocket.

Should the goal not be reached, the funds will still go towards submission fees and the perks. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't donate? That's cool, money's tight and there's definitely not a shortage of artists asking for money. Anything helps, from supportive messages to sharing this with friends and family.

story:
An Angel Story - The Chronicle of a Great Love

By Venessa Angel

In 2010 - Jesse Angell, just 37, passed away in a mysterious accident, leaving behind his wife Venessa, and their three beautiful children. An Angel Story, is about love, hope, struggle, loss, conquering demons, healing, and embracing all that life throws our way.

Please support An Angel Story; helping to turn otherwise tragic circumstances into a wonderful platform of healing.

 

 

About An Angel Story

They met in college.  For years they searched for one another, almost crossing paths, drifting in and out of the circles of many mutual friends, but it wasn't time.

When their paths did cross it was love at first sight, and they cultivated a magical bond.

He carried them from boy to man- all drive, luck, and charisma- reaching unexpected heights with ease.  He was charmed in all of life, seen through magical love, two beautiful children, the top of his law school, a position to follow with a top firm, support and marvel from friends and family...

But he lost his footing and couldn't escape The Fall, enduring years of struggle and street living. 

Everything lost, his former life only ruins, with only the hope and belief shared between the hearts of him and his beloved.  

A story of joy, pain, and struggle;

A story of hope.

An Angel Story is the Chronicle of a Great Love, is about conquering demons, healing, and embracing all that life throws at us. 

 

Thank you so much for your support!

 

 

 

 

Thank you again so much!

story:
Reclusive lover of Lee Harvey Oswald to make rare appearance in New Orleans as part of  50th anniversary events marking JFK shooting

Judyth Vary Baker says Lee Harvey Oswald is not lone assassin!

Judyth Vary Baker, whose book Me & Lee documents her intimate relationship with Lee Harvey Oswald while they both lived and worked in New Orleans on a cancer research project, will make her first public appearance in New Orleans in over 10 years to mark the birthday of her lover and explain why she believes Lee Harvey Oswald was not the lone gunman who killed President John F. Kennedy.

Ms. Baker will be the featured speaker at a one-day symposium sponsored by Trineday Publishing and Stuart H. Smith at Loyola University’s Miller Hall, Room 114 on Saturday, October 19, 9 a.m. to noon. Other JFK researchers and authors will be featured.

Ms. Baker, a girlfriend and lover of Lee Harvey Oswald in New Orleans during the summer of 1963, has been living in exile in Europe for almost a decade after receiving death threats and surviving several accidents since going public with her story. Her book has been out for three years and has garnered a strong following in the JFK research community, according to Publisher Kris Millegan.

Accused assassin Lee Harvey Oswald is the central figure in Ms. Baker’s true story of an enthralling Cold War spy saga. Me and Lee documents how 23-year-old Oswald was involved in an underground medical laboratory overseen by famed New Orleans Dr. Mary Sherman and employing a 20-year-old Judy to create a bio-weapon capable of infecting and killing humans with cancer. The bio-weapon, which was tested on an Angola prisoner, was successfully developed and to be smuggled into Cuba to use against Fidel Castro. The goal: kill Castro in order to save John F. Kennedy's life by changing the focus of his enemies to invade a then-helpless Cuba. Baker also describes Lee Oswald’s roles in the CIA in the USSR and as a "pro-Cuba" activist in New Orleans so he would be trusted by the communists. Me & Lee reveals for the first time many mysteries in Oswald's life, culminating with his abortive trip to Mexico City, his being ordered back to Dallas, and why he had to die after being framed in the Kennedy assassination. Readers typically say "this book connects all the dots," praising Me & Lee as "the most sensible and logical explanation of the actions of the mysterious Oswald."

After studying her story and interviewing Judyth several times, Jim Marrs, veteran JFK researcher and author of Crossfire: The Plot that Killed Kennedy wrote: “Will anyone in the government finally tell the public the truth about the Kennedy assassination? It is highly unlikely. But can we ever really know the truth? I say yes, by studying the wide array of information now available, thinking for ourselves, and listening to the impassioned unflinching voice of Judyth Vary Baker.”

Former Governor Jesse Ventura calls Baker’s book “stunning” and ranked it among his six favorite conspiracy reads, adding that, “her book shows beyond any doubt that (Oswald) was clearly a government agent.”

The event is open to the public but registration is required. A $20 admission charge includes Ms. Baker’s book or another title from Trineday Books about the JFK assassination. Seating is limited. To reserve your space, go to http://trineday.com/Loyola. Phone inquiries: 800.556.2012


Please contact Kris Millegan at 1.800.556.2012/publisher@trineday.net to schedule an interview.

To defray expenses, TrineDay is reaching out to crowd-funding. Anything you can give helps cuts cost for airfare and organizing this event, and if you can't donate you can still help by spreading the NEWS via Facebook and Twitter and through the Indiegogo tools!

More news on whats happening at Trineday's Facebook and Twitter: @TrinedayKris.

story:
Living in Dubai

As a non-Muslim, female expatriate living in Dubai, I faced challenges every day. My book is a fictional piece based on what I grew to understand about the City and the people who came together from all walks of life to build it.

Focusing on people and events rather than the development and construction; my book will highlight the issues surrounding the intense and sometimes volatile multi-culturalism; the extreme disparity of poverty and wealth and every layer of rates-of-pay and living conditions in between.

The story is set during the boom to bust period of 2008/2009. One day the city was a bustling hive of productivity, the energy was quite frenzied and the next day, when the sub-prime mortgage crash occurred in the US, there was a serious knock on effect which brought Dubai's false economy to its knees. This event saw expatriates let go from their employment and having no choice but to flee the city leaving their property keys at the bank and their cars at the airport.

An experienced, published co-writer

With so much information to tell about this outstanding time in history, I want to give the book it's best chance of success. I want the book to be an unbiased account, looking at events from numerous angles and I believe enlisting the services of a second party, a professional, preferably published co-writer will enhance the process and the overall finished product. 

A high-calibre, published writer tends to charge between $150 to $200 per written page. A quality novel is generally between 300 and 350 pages. $60,000 divided by 350 pages is $171 per page, I can hopefully negotiate the rate or the book may come in at less than 350 pages which is why I have set my goal at $60,000.

story:
My book When Life Took a Dive, so far published in Swedish, is an autobiography, telling the story of my life after the fateful accident in which I broke my neck and became paralysed from the chest down.

I wrote and published my story both in order to help people having had accidents similar to mine realise there is a way back to life and because I wanted to contribute to a deeper understanding for the functionally impaired among people in general.

The book has been widely acclaimed and sold well, but funds are still scarce. It was possible for me to publish it in Swedish due to a sponsorship from my employer, but to publish it in English, I need your help.

To have the book translated into English and printed, I would need a sum of 11500 euros. Among those contributing at least 30 euros, I will, if I reach my goal, raffle off 15 personally signed and dedicated copies of the English edition of When Life Took a Dive, mailed out free of charge and postage. Should you be unable to contribute money but still want to help out for the sake of supporting further understanding for the functionally impaired, please just spread the word!

Thank you kindly!

Yasmin

story:
PUBLISHING A BOOK - "Cancer, What Is The Truth?"

My name is Beezhan and I am a documentary filmmaker. I focus on stories that promotes a healthier planet for all species. I believe that we don't own this planet but share it with billions of other species and our health depends on their health. I also believe that focusing on a healthier planet will create more peace because it specifies that common goal (the home that belongs to all of us) and this goal goes beyond our differences in skin color, race, accent, nationality and …

I have traveled extensively trying to find out if there is a cure for cancer. In these travels I have met amazing doctors who have combined Conventional Therapies (Chemotherapy, Surgery, and Radiation) with Alternative Therapies and call it Integrative Therapies. There are many people in this book that have been diagnosed with Stage IV cancer. They were also told they have a few weeks to live but they are now living happy and healthy for years. With your generous help I will be able to publish a few copies and be able to use that to the next level. The money will be used for print, purchasing ISBN, copy rights,...

Of course the more I can raise, the more I can reach publishers, and investors.

This would be impossible without your help. 

YOU rock.

IndieGoGo Rocks.

Thank you.

Living Web Films Team.

story:
Short Summary

SURVIVOR is my personal account of the cross-continental journey of many Haitian, African and Cuban migrants from 2015 to 2017. With the goal of entering the United States, we traversed through 10 countries by land, even having to walk across the dangerous Darien Gap Forest. Some made it across to the US, others went on to enter Canada, and others, like me, stayed on the Mexican border in Tijuana and Mexicali. Unfortunately, many of them did not survive, and others were deported under the Obama and Trump administrations. I wrote this book to share my personal experience as a migrant, to keep register of our difficult journey brought on by unjust circumstances that cause us to migrate, and to commemorate the resistance and perseverance of everyone on their search for a better life.

About The Autor

Ustin Pascal Dubuisson is a writer from Port Au Prince Haiti. He speaks Creole, French, Portuguese, Spanish and English. At 21 years old, he left Haiti for Brazil and worked there 2 years. In 2016, he embarked on a journey to the United States, passing 10 countries before eventually settling in Baja California when US policy proved to be difficult for incoming Haitian migrants. He hopes to study international business. He currently lives in Rosarito with his 5-month-old son and partner.

 

What We Need & What You Get

The book is currently in the editing process. It has already been written in French and translated into Spanish. We are looking to translate the book in English as well. We have just signed a contract with an editor. They are charging $6.50 dollars for each book, with a total of 1000 copies. We are raising a total of $7,500 to cover this cost, as well as costs of presentation and promotion. In this fact we count on the help of each one and the sensitivity that you have so that we can realize this project.. Here are the following costs that will help our book get published and distributed:

 

·      Design, editing and printing - $6,500

·      Promotion/ Presentation/ Events - $1000

 

The Impact

Around 20,000 migrants made this cross-continental track, but this story is still relatively unknown. The idea of this book is to share with the world my story and the story of many other migrants, a story which involves many risks and loss of many lives. With each second that passed on my journey, I personally learned that there are many more things in this world that value more than money, and that's what I used to survive on this journey , I want to share my experience with the world.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

While we do appreciate any amount of financial contributions, there are also other ways to help. Please spread the word through social media or through word of mouth, the old school way.

story:
Los niños con labio leporino (fisura labial o paladar hendido) en el Perú son muchos. Nacen con esta malformación alrededor de 2600 niños al año. Armonizar surgió en Lima a partir de un grupo de amigos que tuvo la experiencia de atender las necesidades múltiples de un pequeño niño que acababa de nacer con fisura de labio y paladar en un centro poblado de la zona rural de Chincha en la costa sur del Perú. En el 2003 empezamos nuestro proyecto también acá, en la ciudad de Chincha. Atendemos casos de familias en extrema necesidad y que no tienen acceso a una buena cirugía para su niño que oscila entre S/. 1500 (US$ 500) y S/. 3000 (US$1000) aproximadamente, fuera de lo que son gastos de movilidad, medicinas, alimentos, hospedaje y sus terapias post-operatorias que implica acompañarlos, usualmente, durante varios años.

En Armonizar les damos una atención personalizada para saber las necesidades específicas del niño tanto antes, durante como después de la cirugía o cirugías que necesite. No basta con que el niño se vea bien, pues eso es lo que se logra con la cirugía. Es necesario también darle terapias con fonoaudiólogos, fisioterapeutas, psicólogos, odontólogos, especialistas en terapias de aprendizaje para que el niño logre desarrollarse bien. No son pocos los niños que llegan mal nutridos y es necesario alimentarlos para que puedan ser intervenidos quirúrgicamente. Por todo esto optamos por no operarlos en campañas gratuitas pues corren el riesgo de no tener un resultado óptimo en la cirugía o que hayan complicaciones. Lo que logramos es darles a los niños una atención interdisciplinaria e integral y a sus familias un acompañamiento solidario, cercano. 

Asimismo, aquí en Armonizar-Chincha, venimos atendiendo también a muchos niños con otras malformaciones craneofaciales y síndromes que no tienen dónde atenderse.

Con nuestro esfuerzo y la de colaboradores solidarios, con dificultad, pero con muchos frutos, vamos consiguiendo los especialistas, los equipos, las medicinas y todo aquello que es necesario para poder atender las cirugías y las largas terapias que requieren estos niños y colaborar a que sus sueños se conviertan en realidad. 

En Armonizar-Chincha, con tu ayuda y la de los especialistas solidarios acá, si alcanzamos la meta, podremos lograr el traslado, cirugías y terapias hasta fin de año de por lo menos cinco niños cuyas familias viven en extrema pobreza. Si la superamos nos ayudarás a tratar a más niños. El primer reto que nos ayudarás a superar es proporcionarles una buena alimentación, que puedan ingerir fácilmente para lograr el nivel de hemoglobina adecuado además de tener bien sus vías respiratorias para poder ser intervenidos quirúrgicamente.

Lo recolectado irá íntegramente a la Asociación Armonizar-Chincha y nosotros invertiremos el total de la suma en el tratamiento de los niños, NO en costos administrativos.

Si quieres convertirte en padrino de alguno de los niños, con el permiso de sus padres, podremos mantenerte al tanto de su evolución en el tratamiento. ¡Qué mejor recompensa que ver a un niño sonreír!

Si no logramos la meta total, lamentablemente sólo podremos atender a algunos de los niños para quienes estaba destinada la campaña pero de todas maneras se destinará para ellos.

story:
Introduction

I'm an actress & college instructor in New York City, writing a memoir on life with a mentally ill mother and how I came to be the non-custodial parent of my two children, dual realities that walk hand-in-hand through a shame-riddled story I've been long afraid to share. But my often troubled story has a happy twist, a happiness that required shaking off the restraints of fear & shame, and living true to my identity.

By sharing my story, I hope to challenge stigma and shame in mental illness, question parental rights in our current social situation, and underscore the importance of identity in a world of increasing conformity. Personally, I'd like to retire this fear of sharing my truth.

story:
The Story 

"Have you ever wondered what happens at night,
when the Supermarket doors shut nice and tight, 
when the lights go out and the trolleys are still
and there's no more shoppers at the till?
Well then turn the page, take a peek in, 
the supermarket parade is about to begin!"

So begins the fantastical adventure of The Supermarket Parade! - a picture book designed for fun and to be read over and over again as kids return to see which character is their favourite this time. Maybe it's the nervous egg on spaghetti stilts or the pair of potatoes with bagpipes and kilts....

Our aim is to make kids laugh by letting their imaginations run wild around the supermarket aisles! 

It's a cheerful story told through lyrical rhymes & action-packed illustrations with funny details, that engage children to answer questions, find clues and marvel at the colourful line of product performers.

Our book is ready to be published!

This book is born from a collaboration that started 2 years ago between Sinead, Irish writer and Heloise, French illustrator, when we were introduced by our mutual friend Melanie (thanks Mel!). We took a simple idea about a secret supermarket parade and turned it into a playful picture book for kids who love to delve into the world of make believe. 

Now, we are very, very close to completing The Supermarket Parade:  

 We've shown the book to lots of youngsters around us and have been heartened by all the giggles and smiles it received. This response has motivated us to get the book to a wider audience of kids so they too can join in the fun of the parade. 

 

I'm on Board!  How Can I Help?

We need your help to raise funds and be able to publish this book. You can pre-order a copy of the book and more now! All the money raised will help us cover the costs of production and delivery of the book along with other perks we've created for you.

This is an opportunity for you to support young artists & get involved at a very personal level in a small promising project. Better still you'll be gifting the book and all the fun of the parade to your young friends! 

As rewards for your help, you will be able to receive the book and a variety of hand made bonuses!  Such as signed copies of the book, A4 prints for your loved ones ready to be framed and put in their bedrooms, colouring books of the characters, stickers and even the opportunity for your child's name(s) to appear in the book!

The Story 
"Have you ever wondered what happens at night,when the Supermarket doors shut nice and tight, when the lights go out and the trolleys are stilland there's no more shoppers at the till?Well then turn the page, take a peek in, the supermarket parade is about to begin!"

So begins the fantastical adventure of The Supermarket Parade! - a picture book designed for fun and to be read over and over again as kids return to see which character is their favourite this time. Maybe it's the nervous egg on spaghetti stilts or the pair of potatoes with bagpipes and kilts....
Our aim is to make kids laugh by letting their imaginations run wild around the supermarket aisles! 
It's a cheerful story told through lyrical rhymes & action-packed illustrations with funny details, that engage children to answer questions, find clues and marvel at the colourful line of product performers.
Our book is ready to be published!
This book is born from a collaboration that started 2 years ago between Sinead, Irish writer and Heloise, French illustrator, when we were introduced by our mutual friend Melanie (thanks Mel!). We took a simple idea about a secret supermarket parade and turned it into a playful picture book for kids who love to delve into the world of make believe. 

Now, we are very, very close to completing The Supermarket Parade:  
 We've shown the book to lots of youngsters around us and have been heartened by all the giggles and smiles it received. This response has motivated us to get the book to a wider audience of kids so they too can join in the fun of the parade.

story:
Bring our movement archive online! 

Since 2005, Upping the Anti: A Journal of Theory and Action has published hundreds of articles, interviews, letters, and roundtables that document and reflect on grassroots organizing and radical politics.

We pride ourselves on publishing a print journal, but it’s high time for Upping the Anti to become widely available and accessible online.

A new website will help us reach new readers and audiences who want to engage with movement debates and lessons learned through organizing, and hone their analysis of anti-capitalist, anti-oppressive, and anti-imperialist politics. If UTA has been useful to your organizing work, please consider chipping in.

 

Help us join the 21st century

We are an all-volunteer collective and all of our subscription and sustainer money currently goes to publishing our print journal, twice per year. We need our readers' support to build a new website and bring grassroots theory to the masses. 

Want to learn more about what we publish? Check out our website or our subject guide.

 

Perks

Every person who donates will be entered into a draw to win a 1-year subscription to Briarpatch Magazine! Check out our list of perks to the right.

All contributors will be thanked in our 20th anniversary print issue. If you prefer to remain anonymous, please make a note of this in the comments.

 

Poster by Sam Wallman (11x17) - $30 donation (includes the current issue of UTA, a sticker, and your name in print)

 

Silkscreened UTA Poster (18x24, two colour options) - $50 donation (includes the current issue of UTA, a sticker, and your name in print)

 

Bicycle Tune-up - $100 donation (includes the current issue of UTA, a sticker, and your name in print)

Tune-up by a professional bike mechanic (who happens to be a UTA editor!). Includes: gear and brake adjustment, minor wheel trues, hub adjustment, air and oil, lubrication of pivot points and cables, and an assessment of whether new parts are necessary. Tune-up will take place in downtown Toronto. 

 

Stickers (four options)

 

Other ways you can help

Share this campaign with your networks and encourage your friends to chip in!

Has Upping the Anti been useful to your thinking and organizing work? Consider becoming a sustainer! Sustainers make monthly contributions of $5-15 to support our work.

story:
¿Qué?

Kilómetro 93 nos muestra la parte terrorífica del mundo cotidiano, en una trama con múltiples giros.

Kilómetro 93 está ambientada en la ciudad de Granada durante el caluroso verano de 2017. Describe a vida de cinco desconocidos que comparten un coche para viajar a Madrid. Tras el asesinato de uno de ellos y la pérdida de memoria de tres de los otros cuatro pasajeros, la investigación girará en torno a estos personajes que verán sus vidas amenazadas por el recuerdo.

El amor entrará de golpe, atropellando el desorden que ya protagoniza la vida de los personajes para darle un rayo de luz a lo que podría considerarse una auténtica pesadilla.

¿Quiénes?

Tandaia es una editorial con voluntad de cambio, de dar la alternativa a autores que no la encuentran en otro lugar, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el emplear una campaña preventa para valorar la aceptación y viabilidad de cada título.

De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.

Hoy te presentamos a Patricia Moreno Raya.

Nacida en Granada en 1988, estudió Farmacia y trabaja como farmacéutica hospitalaria.
Ha realizado varios talleres de escritura en la universidad de Granada y en la escuela de
escritores de Valparaíso. Ha publicado en las antologías de relato de las editoriales Letras con Arte, La Fragua del Trovador entre otras y ha colaborado en revistas literarias como Literántropos o Solo Novela Negra. Ha participado con la editorial Artificios en el poemario El pájaro azul. Homenaje a Rubén Darío (2016); en el libro de microrrelatos La Paloma. Homenaje a Frida Kahlo (2017), y en la antología Amor con humor se paga (2017).
Con esta mista editorial publicó su primera novela La tercera planta, un RomanticNoir que
salió a la luz en febrero de 2017. Ha sido I Finalista del III Concurso de microrrelatos Sol de Otoño en enero de 2018 y del III Premio Valparaíso de Poesía con el poemario El viaje en diciembre de 2017. Ganadora de las Justas literarias de San Ginés de la Jara con el poemario Gritos del alma, silencio enjaulados, en abril de 2018.

¿Por qué?

Y por aquí una muestra de lo que encontraréis en sus páginas:

«—¿Recordáis algo? —preguntó Amelia directamente, impaciente—. Ya no solo del accidente, si no en general, de vuestra vida, algo, aunque sea lo más mínimo…
          —No —respondieron al unísono Susi y Tomás.
          —Yo tampoco… Y estoy desesperada, no sé por dónde empezar a vivir ahora.
          —Pues yo tengo que reconoceros que estoy tranquilo —intervino Tomás—, creo que es cuestión de tiempo que recuperemos la memoria, por lo que dicen los médicos la intoxicación por monóxido de carbono no es permanente, debemos confiar en ellos, y mientras tanto disfrutar de la situación que tenemos.
          —¿Cómo que disfrutar? ¡Disfrutar de qué si ni siquiera sabemos quiénes somos! —Amelia no entendía la actitud calmada de Tomás, su mirada relajada y expresión alegre. Sospechó que quizás él sí que recordaba algo y fingía estar en la misma situación que ellas.
          —Disfrutar de todo y de nada a la vez. Podemos tomarlo como un periodo de descanso, de intentar conocernos desde cero, de enfrentarnos a lo desconocido que se esconde dentro de cada uno de nosotros. Ahora no tenemos responsabilidades, no podemos trabajar, no podemos discutir con las personas que nos hacen enfadar, ni preocuparnos por problemas que ahora mismo nos son tan ajenos. Puede que alguno de nosotros tuviera una vida fácil, pero seguro que había preocupaciones y quebraderos de cabeza. Tenemos la posibilidad de pasear por lugares nuevos encima de nuestros propios pasos, observar el paisaje del que tantas veces habremos disfrutado y maravillarnos por primera vez. Podemos conocer a las personas de nuestra familia y considerarlos amigos, o quizás volver a enamorarnos del que juraba ser el amor de nuestra vida.
          —Creo que a ti el accidente te ha dejado un poco loco —afirmó Susi.
          —No…, puede que Tomás tenga una parte de razón. Aunque no puedo dejar de sentir miedo —reconoció Amelia.
          —¿Razón? Creo que no me está ayudando demasiado hablar con vosotros…
          —¿Y de qué quieres hablar?
          —Del inspector. De que somos sospechosos de haber matado a un hombre, y ninguno de los tres recuerda nada. Puede que uno de nosotros sea un asesino.»

¿Cómo?

Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 880€; esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cincuenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.

  • Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
  • Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
  • Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.

Los fondos recaudados, se utilizarán como ayuda para sacar adelante esta primera edición de Kilómetro 93 que saldría después a la venta.

Aviso para navegantes: La opción RESPALDAR es únicamente para realizar donaciones a la edición, por lo que no habrá comunicaciones posteriores en busca de datos de envío... cualquiera de las opciones válidas de reserva exige cumplimentar formulario para poder servir el pedido.

Además...

Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona a la autora, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y Patricia Moreno Raya vea publicada su obra.

Gracias por vuestro tiempo.

Política de Privacidad

story:
Hello everyone! We are overjoyed to announce that our second book God is with Us is now available for pre-sale of personalized, signed copies AND that we will be hosting a God is with Us meet and greet, book reading, and party complete with dancing in Sedona on October 27, 2018 in celebration of the new book and of course, of YOU! Tickets for this are limited, so please get yours early if you are ready and able to meet us in this sacred space. We are so thrilled to offer this and hope that many of you can come!

For those of you who may be new to our work, Hanan and I are a writing and creative team - married for 20 years and having gone deeper and deeper into sacred partnership throughout. Hanan is a highly ethical, heart-centered shaman whose work helps clients emerge from illness, overcome personal obstacles and tap into their sacred purpose; and I am a writer, speaker and embodiment of the divine feminine, working to inspire others daily through my writing. 

God is with Us is our second book, which details the story of how we uncovered a hidden shamanic lineage that holds potent secrets to vitality and divine union. This book, both tender and fierce, resurrects potent truths that were forced into hiding for thousands of years: known as the Essene tradition. This secret lineage—whose ways and practices are encoded in the Dead Sea Scrolls as well as within us—is a messianic, Goddess-honoring sect of Judaism who practiced shamanic divine union as the deepest form of personal atonement and communion with the Divine.

God is with Us also tells the very real, miraculous stories of Hanan’s shamanic journeywork, which have helped people heal everything from addiction to broken relationships to cancer—and more. We outline five potent journeys, each with its own collective messages and themes, shedding vital light on how we may all use these practices to heal, restoring wholeness and energetic vitality that will last lifetimes. 

This is also a wonderful volume for anyone who is simply curious about shamanism, the divine feminine, and/or divine union and wants to learn more from an ancient perspective.

In this campaign, we are offering a pre-sale of God is with Us, which is a limited time event as well as tickets to our epic celebration in Sedona on Saturday, October 27, 2018, in which we will all come together, socialize, eat, enjoy a reading of the book and Q&A, and of course, DANCE!!! Proceeds from this will go directly to support our family as we relocate to the magical town of Sedona, as well as to support the development of EISEN, our new institute devoted to education on how ethical, heart-centered shamanism can revolutionize our treatment of illness (mental and physical) when used in loving partnership with conventional medicine. You can learn more about EISEN here: esseneshamanism.com.

WE ARE SO EXCITED and we hope that you are too. Thank you so much for supporting our work. Please feel free to contact us with any inquiries, and we’ll see you in Sedona!
