story:
Little Pilgrim's Big Journey is a 226-page fully illustrated children's book based on a classic story The Pilgrim's Progress, a tale about walking the Christian faith. Rediscover the story that has inspired generations, now adapted for the next generation. 

 

 

This version of John Bunyan's timeless tale is designed for children ages 4 to 10, with beautiful artwork on every single page and simplified text.

 

 

Next to the Bible, The Pilgrim's Progress is the most printed and translated book of all time. John Bunyan's ability to combine a dynamic adventure story with biblical truth has captivated the minds and hearts of children and adults for centuries.

 

 

 

This book is printed with an heirloom quality with thick premium paper, silk-ribbon page marker, gold-foil print, and a genuine cloth hardcover. We hope that the children who read this book today will one day read their well-worn copy to the their children, looking back with joy on their own pilgrimage.

 

 

The Pilgrim's Progress has inspired countless generations to follow Christ, even when the path is difficult. We believe this message is needed today more than ever, and hope this book will inspire the next generation of 'little pilgrims' to believe the King's Word, follow the King's Path, and seek the King's City.

 

 

 

Help us make this dream come to life and put this book it into the hands of thousands of little pilgrims worldwide. We hope and pray it will bear lasting fruit for decades to come. 

 

- Download a PDF of Chapter 1 to preview. 

 

- Watch this video of Chapter 6 read by the author:

 

Choose from these BOOK PERKS

ALL OPTIONS ARE SET WITH A $7 FLAT SHIPPING RATE TO CANADA/USA 

 

1. One Blue Book

Get one hardcover copy with cloth cover, gold foil, and silk-ribbon page marker

 

2. One Coloring Book 

Get one 60-page coloring book

 

3. One Limited Red Book Bundle

Get one limited edition red cover + a 60-page coloring book + sticker set + large fold-out map

6. Evangelist

7. Good-Will

Donate 50 blue covers (25 through any ministry of your choice + 25 through our ministry in Cambodia). Additionally, you get one limited edition red cover + three blue covers + a 60-page coloring book + sticker set + large fold-out map

 

 

 

 

This book is the passion project of Tyler Van Halteren. Tyler is from Ontario, Canada, and a graduate of The Master's Seminary. He currently serves as a missionary in Cambodia with his wife and two boys.  

"Pilgrim's Progress was the first book I read as a young Christian. I was captivated by the imagery and the idea of the Christian life as a journey to the Celestial City. As the years went on, that image of being a pilgrim in this world stuck in my mind and shaped the decisions I made. I hope this book will inspire my two sons and many other children to seek the Celestial City." 

 

 

Many versions of Bunyan's timeless tale have been published since the first edition in 1678, but when Tyler looked for a version for his children, he found there were none that combined engaging full-color illustrations with simplified language for children.

 

 

This version keeps the depth of the message, while making the themes understandable for early readers. Working alongside a professional editor with 40 years experience in Christian publishing, the wording and concepts have been carefully chosen and crafted to be relatable to young children. It is designed for families to read together with their younger children, and for older children to read to themselves.

 

 

As a help to children and parents, there are short summaries at the end of each chapter which explain the spiritual significance of the characters, places, and trials encountered. A question and study guide is also included in the book for family discussion.

 

 

 

To start, Tyler's plan is to translate Little Pilgrim's Big Journey to Khmer and French languages, and hopes to work with like-minded missions agencies and Christian publishers to translate it into many more. 

"As a missionary in Cambodia, I desire to see this book spread the beauty of the gospel message far beyond the borders of North-America. We plan to use a portion of the profits from each book to help cover costs of translation and printing so that Christ can be known across the globe. It is easy to forget that many churches overseas have limited biblical resources. In Cambodia, we see firsthand the impact that translated, gospel-centered children's books can have on evangelism and discipleship."

 

 

We had everything ready to go during our initial campaign. Files are now all submitted and printing has begun. We will ensure that your orders arrive in October. 

 

 

We are offering a flat $7 shipping for all orders to the US and Canada. This is $7 on any reward level. If you buy the 4-book combo, you only pay $7. You can also add on any number of items and your total shipping cost will be $7.

For the rest of the world:

UK, EU, AU - $14 CAD

HK, CH, TW, JP, KR, NZ - $20 CAD

Everywhere else - $24 CAD

All orders in Cambodia can be picked up free of charge. 

 

 

If you are a bookstore, church, or simply anyone interested in a large order, please contact us to discuss bulk discounts and shipping prices. Send inquiries to info@lithoskids.com

story:
Story of My Book

All for One: The Big Business of Saving the World tackles the challenges facing international corporate social responsibility head-on.

My name is Jordan Cynewski, and I am the author of All for One: The Big Business of Saving the World. I wrote this book to outline realistic ideas to help businesses, investors, and everyday consumers understand their role in solving the problems facing our world today.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover how international businesses can do well by doing good. In this book, I hope to instill the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for international corporate social responsibility in you. And then ultimately I want you to see this book as a tool to help you better understand how your simple decisions can have a tremendous impact on people across the world.

In this book, you'll learn about what makes a company truly socially responsible and where we all fit in as part of the problem or part of the solution to some of the modern world's biggest issues:
  • The real challenge of automation and emerging technologies
  • Socially responsible investing (SRI)
  • Practicing conscious spending habits

You will love this book if you work for an international company or if you simply want to know more about the global impact of your daily transactions.

All for One: The Big Business of Saving the World is a non-fiction book that speaks to everyone from CEOs to everyday people who are looking at corporate social responsibility and the challenges of globalization for the first time.

 

The Book - All for One: The Big Business of Saving the World

The book is written in 3 Parts....

Part 1 contains the introduction and two additional chapters. The reader will learn why they should care about international corporate social responsibility (CSR) and how the world arrived at this point. It will discuss the basics of CSR in a globalized world and the role of ideology in the global supply chain.

Part 2 contains Chapters 3 through 5. This portion of the book will focus on what is being done to further or hinder CSR today. It will examine the lessons that can be learned from poorly executed CSR and the example set by CSR leaders in major industries across the globe. It will also analyze the surprising role of governments in CSR.

Part 3 contains Chapters 6 through 8. This will build off the lessons from earlier in the book and focus on the future of international CSR. It will discuss concerning developments in technology and the global workforce, as well as promising innovations in socially responsible investing (SRI). Finally, the book will conclude with a discussion on the socially responsible consumer and what we all can do to contribute to a brighter future.

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in July, 2019.
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for My Book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this summer
  • When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
  • A personally signed copy of my book when I publish
  • A personal, handwritten thank-you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your Name will appear in a Special Acknowledgements section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share the experiences of writing my book
  • And more...

 

About the Author

Jordan Cynewski is a recent graduate of Georgetown University, where he served as President of the Alpha Epsilon Pi Fraternity and as an Executive Board Member of the American Cancer Society's Relay for Life.

He wrote this book out of his strongly held conviction that all private entities, from individuals to global businesses, can and should do their part to make the world a better place.

When he realized he would never create meaningful change as a Government major, he decided to try something different by writing a book on business.

For more information you can connect with Jordan at cynewskibooks@gmail.com.

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:
  • Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #AllForOne and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page
  • Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Jordan

story:
Story of My Book

Unfiltered is about how to combat misinformation using perspective journalism.

My name is Sudiksha Kochi and I am the author of Unfiltered. I wrote this book for two reasons. First, I am passionate about fighting misinformation. I had the opportunity to work at PolitiFact, a Pulitzer-Prize winning fact-checking organization, where I discovered just how dangerous misinformation can be. When an individual is exposed to falsehoods, they are forming a perception of reality that not only puts themselves at risk but puts others at risk too. We see it all the time, from the groups of anti-vaxxers and anti-maskers who believe that the COVID-19 pandemic is "fake" to the QAnon conspiracy theorists who continue to believe that the 2020 presidential election was a fraud. It is scary to think that misinformation can lure hundreds of people across the nation into its trap.

I also wrote this book because many people think of journalists as "stenographers." To put it simply, they think that journalists go to the White House or Capitol Hill, hear what politicians have to say about an issue, and then present those words to the public. Well, I am here to tell you that is not what journalists do! In fact, journalists challenge the power of elected officials, engage in their local communities, and report from an angle all the time. This side of journalism, however, is never fully exposed to the public.

My book is about perspective journalism, which is a concept that I branded after doing extensive research and interviews with journalists from a variety of different experiences and backgrounds. Perspective journalism combines the fundamentals of news reporting with the fundamentals of fact-checking. In this book, I introduce six principles of perspective journalism and offer strategies to help combat misinformation using those principles.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover more about what journalism is and, more importantly, use journalism to positively impact your life. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you fight misinformation on a daily basis and change your thinking about any news topic at hand.

In this book, you'll hear stories such as...

  • Former NBC journalist and GoLike founder Mariana Atencio's experience covering three hurricanes, one earthquake, and a mass shooting at a Texas church. She conveys the idea of storytelling in journalism and how stories have to be told with "raw emotion that really needs no translation."
  • Independent journalist Jennifer Karchmer's time in Reykjavik, Iceland documenting freedom of the press as a volunteer for Reporters Without Borders.
  • Emmy-Award Winning NPR journalist Tonya Mosley's thoughts on rebuilding trust with local communities and the power of accountability in journalism.
  • Freelance journalist Alice Driver supported by the National Geographic Emergency Fund for Journalists documenting the experiences of families living in Latin America
  • PolitiFact founder and Knight Professor of the Practice of Journalism and Public Policy at Duke University Bill Adair's model on the continuum of journalism.

Unfiltered is a nonfiction book that speaks to anyone who wants to look at journalism and combating misinformation in a new way.

The Book - Unfiltered

This book is divided into three parts.

Part 1 contains the introduction + chapters 1 - 3. In this section of the book, readers will learn the history behind misinformation, why the term "fake news" should not be used, Bill Adair's model on the continuum of journalism, the psychology behind misinformation, and the prevalence of misinformation in society today.

Part 2 contains chapters 4 - 9. In this section, readers will learn about the six principles of perspective journalism. Each chapter will feature 2-3 journalists whose experiences contribute to the foundation of each principle.

Part 3 contains chapters 10 - 12 + conclusion. In this section, readers will be offered strategies to help combat misinformation on a daily basis using the principles of perspective journalism.

What We Need & What You Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in August of 2021.

The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)

The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).

The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.

The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this summer. 

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.

Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.

You will receive early access to the Introduction and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback.

You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.

You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.

And much more!

About the Author

Sudiksha Kochi is a sophomore at George Mason University majoring in communication with a double concentration in journalism and media production/criticism and a minor in political communication. Kochi is expected to graduate early in 2022. On campus, Kochi is the president of the Society of Professional Journalists and a staff writer for the Fourth Estate. Off campus, she is an intern for PolitiFact, a broadcast intern for Voice of America's media lab, and a reporting intern for Voice of America's Student Union. She will be a breaking news intern for USA Today this summer, which she is super excited about!

Kochi believes that the job of any journalist should be to serve his/her community and, through this book, she is hoping to provide a tool for individuals to be more informed about how to fight misinformation. She wants this book to impact people in a positive way and possibly even better their lives.

Kochi aspires to be a political reporter or a White House correspondent for a print publication after she graduates. She is also curious about investigative journalism.

When Kochi is not studying for classes, watching the news, or working on her internships, she can usually be found reading books! She loves all genres, especially fantasy! She also loves spending time outside in the sun, going on long walks, and playing with her two umbrella cockatoos.

For more information, you can connect with Kochi at sudikshakochi.24@gmail.com and on Instagram, Twitter, LinkedIn, and Facebook!
Instagram: @sudikochi.24
Twitter: @KochiSudiksha
Facebook: Sudiksha Kochi
LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/sudiksha-kochi-6979...

International Preorders

For international preorders, please send me a private message. 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #Unfiltered and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so that we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Sudiksha Kochi

About the Author
Sudiksha Kochi is a sophomore at George Mason University majoring in communication with a double concentration in journalism and media production/criticism and a minor in political communication. Kochi is expected to graduate early in 2022. On campus, Kochi is the president of the Society of Professional Journalists and a staff writer for the Fourth Estate. Off campus, she is an intern for PolitiFact, a broadcast intern for Voice of America's media lab, and a reporting intern for Voice of America's Student Union. She will be a breaking news intern for USA Today this summer, which she is super excited about!Kochi believes that the job of any journalist should be to serve his/her community and, through this book, she is hoping to provide a tool for individuals to be more informed about how to fight misinformation. story:
Story of My Book

Navigating the Storm details the mental health challenges I faced, the positive role that therapy had in helping me overcome them, and the lessons I learned along the way. It is a nonfiction memoir that speaks to anyone who has dealt, or is dealing, with their own proverbial valleys and are interested in learning about mental health and therapy in a new way.

My name is Shayne Petkiewicz and I am the author of Navigating the Storm. My overarching goal for this book is to be a resource for anyone interested in learning more about mental health or begin going to therapy. In it, I share many lessons I learned along the way, which I hope can help you become more informed about mental health. I also detail a number of tools and techniques that helped me deal with my challenges, which you can employ to help manage your own difficult moments, traumas, or crises and have the knowledge to access professional help if you so desire. In this book, I hope to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement that I have about mental health.

As part of writing this book, I have had the incredible experience of meeting people from all walks of life and from across the globe. I have spoken with professors, therapists, neuroscientists in the field of psychology and mental health as well as many who shared their stories and traumas; all doing a fantastic job of contributing to the conversation of mental health. In this book, you'll learn about topics such growth, anxiety, hope, loneliness, emotional intelligence, and more.

This book is divided into three parts: Trauma, Survival, and Growth. In Trauma, I detail the initial challenges I faced and the steps I took to commence going to therapy. In Survival, I highlight some of the techniques I learned in therapy to help me cope with my difficulties. And in Growth, I touch on various areas where I developed and learned having processed my traumas.

You will love this book if you are intrigued by a narrative of someone transitioning from suffering to growth, are curious to learn more about practical tools to improve your mental health, or believe that mental health should be a more socially accepted and less taboo subject.

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in August, 2021.
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats.)
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this summer.


When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell more than 120 copies, those proceeds will go directly to supporting the activities of two fantastic non-profits: American Foundation for Suicide Prevention (AFSP) and Ever Forward Club.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • You will be invited to participate in exclusive webinars with AFSP and Ever Forward Club and discuss the role of mental health in their work.
  • And much more!

 

International Preorders

For international preorders, please send me a private message BEFORE ordering - there are some nuances to the process.

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #NavigatingtheStorm and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so that we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
  • Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your support!

Shayne Petkiewicz

story:
Although you might not instantly recognize Josh Kirby by name, his art was groundbreaking. Not only is he the illustrator who’s unmistakable style was hand selected to attract readers to Sir Terry Pratchett's Discworld series, but he was also an award winning science fiction, horror and fantasy artist. 

Josh's prolific career spanned over six decades and his illustrations adorned film posters, puzzles, games, album art and hundreds of book covers for literary greats, including Ray Bradbury, Ian Fleming, Isaac Asimov, Alfred Hitchcock, Jimmy Sangster, Richard Matheson, Ursula Le Guin, Jack Kerouac, Jules Verne, Edgar Rice Burroughs, Robert Heinlein. And of course, his epic film poster for Star Wars: Return of the Jedi.

 But that's not where the story ends...

 Josh Kirby left the world a surprise in his vast art archives: an unfinished  children's book about a time traveling mouse named Marmaduke.

The manuscript remained buried amongst papers for fifteen years, just waiting for the right moment. That turned out to be at the 2016 UK Discworld Convention.  Now, the Josh Kirby Estate has proudly teamed up with cartoonist Ray Friesen to finish the story and bring it to you! 

With your generosity and support we exceeded our funding goal of $7,500 and we will be able to print and ship the finished full colour children's book and lots of other bits and bobs, BUT we just missed our goal of being able to create the audio book version and that's where you come in, to help us get there!

The additional $1500 will allow us to reach our stretch goal of $15,000 so everyone who pledged at any level for either the Kickstarter campaign or this one on Indiegogo wins! We will record an audio book version of the story, narrated by voice-over artist extraordinaire Stephen Briggs and it will be given as a free bonus download to EVERYBODY who has pledged at book level or higher!  

We will not be charging extra for the audiobook, we will be providing it FREE to book level backers as a big old THANK YOU so please tell your friends, enemies, and anyone who loves time traveling mice!

Check out the 50 States of Mind website, on the news, and on podcasts!

DISCLAIMER: If you know of a corporation that can sponsor this project, or a paid speaking gig, or any other way for me to earn money, PLEASE do that instead. Crowdfunding is a great thing, but I don't want to take your donations if there's a way I can earn it.

I set out to fund this entire project through corporate sponsorships and speaking gigs. Weirdly, corporations haven't gotten super generous after their nice tax cut (who knew!) and I've only been able to schedule one (really great) paid gig, so I'm turning to drastic measures.

THE DEAL:

I will move to any state in the US for $15,000, the cost of doing the entire trip. If an individual or corporation gives me $15,000, I will move to a state of their choice for Sept 2019-Sept 2020. I'll do community service 3x a week and be a part of the community. For $20,000, you can pick any city or town (except for Truth or Consequences, NM) 

What We Need & What You Get:

These are the expenses I'm dealing with on this trip.

  • 25,000 miles worth of gas
  • occasional hotels/AirBnbs when I can't find hosts
  • interview equipment/meals for interviewees/gifts for hosts
  • car payments
  • marketing
  • food
  • flights back and forth from the UK

Why is this important?

We live in a very polarized country and I want to share a variety of opinions that exist in our excitingly diverse country. It's important for us to understand other perspectives and since not everyone can get in the car and curate a mix of regional, political, socioeconomic, and ethnic identities, I decided I'd do it for you. We need a positive view of the contributions people are making to their local communities that we're not getting from the media. Here is a sampling of some of those interviewed:

Kachen Kimmell (Mayor of Gambier, OH)

Leon Bibb (Cleveland News Anchor)

Staff of Skeet’s Bar (East Cleveland) 

Christine Hallquist (First Openly Transgender Gubernatorial Candidate)

story:
Story of My Book

Rise: How Empowering Women Elevates Us All is about how society benefits as a whole when women are given the chance to come into their power. Rise seeks to not only illustrate the various reasons why female empowerment is important, but also aims to provide guidance on how we can support the women around us and allow them the chance to create a positive impact on their own lives, their communities, and even the world.

My name is Shana Abraham and I am the author of Rise: How Empowering Women Elevates Us All. I wrote this book because I’ve come to realize just how important and powerful female empowerment is, not just for women but for society as a whole. We can look at its effects from any perspective — political, social, health, economic, etc. — and it always results in progress.

There are many people who want to empower women, but don’t know the most effective ways to encourage them. There are also many young women who want to create social change, but don’t know where to start. Many women would benefit from learning about the tools that can help them, but also from learning that they are not alone in the challenges that they face.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover the close relationship between gender equity and global health. In this book, I hope to instill the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for female empowerment in you. And then ultimately I want you to see this book as a tool to help you create social change and support the women around you.

In this book, you'll learn about the various levels of adversity that women face daily, and the core principles of female changemakers who've been able to overcome such challenges, including:

  • How there are many different ways to be an effective female leader and the range of experiences that can create an impact. You’ll learn from stories about Malala Yousafzai, who was shot by the Taliban, to Elyse Fox, who battled with depression her entire life and discover the various ways women can overcome their forms of adversity to advance a greater cause.
  • How Mercy Akuot was a child bride in Sudan, and how after days of violence and struggle, she was able to get help and escape this fate. You’ll be inspired by her resilience and how she’s used this experience to fight negative cultural practices across the globe.
  • How it’s not about giving women charity, but rather a chance to fight for what they deserve, and how young women across the globe have championed a variety of causes, from Jihye Yang in South Korea, Suhani Jalota in India, and Nadya Okamoto in America.

 

You will love this book if you either are or know a young woman who wants to be a leader in their own right. They may look up to certain female public figures, but don’t know just how powerful they themselves can be when given the right resources. With the stories and insights you find in Rise, you’ll learn effective strategies to lift up the women around you and help them explore opportunities to create social impact.

Rise is a non-fiction book that speaks to young women and their supporters who are looking at female empowerment and social change for the first time.

 

The Book - Rise: How Empowering Women Elevates Us All

The book is written in 3 Parts...

Part 1 provides background on the female empowerment movement, the history of social change, and why many women continue to hesitate to create social change and/or take leadership roles. It highlights key insights, such as how women tend to reinvest 90% of their income into their families when economically empowered, in comparison to the average 30-40% from men. Part 1 also delves into how social change has been amplified due to the advancement of technology in recent years, such as through social media campaigns, online crowdfunding sources, etc.

Part 2 explores the core principles of female changemakers and details the stories of how they’ve been able to cultivate qualities such as authenticity in order to attain their level of success. You’ll see how adversity can come in various forms, from violent encounters like Malala’s experience to mental health struggles like Elyse Fox, and how with resilience, one can find ways to overcome these challenges. Part 2 also speaks to the importance of a support network and illustrates the various levels in which a young woman can be encouraged and advocated for.

Part 3 centers around how to empower women and girls. It lays out the various challenges to empowerment, such as how many young girls are forced to turn to sex work in order to pay their school fees, allowing them to continue their education and avoid being married off early. It dives into the various methods of empowerment: psychological, social, economic, education, and more. Factors such as the lack of academic opportunities for girls is costing our society trillions of dollars, demonstrating one of the reasons it’s imperative that we not only acknowledge the necessity of female empowerment but also act on this issue. This final part shows that there are numerous ways to move the world towards a more equitable society and that it’s never too early or too late to start supporting women.

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
 
  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in July 2020
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for My Book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this summer

 

When I pre-sell 100 physical copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a Spanish translation. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a Hindi translation. These translations were chosen as goals rather than a hardcover or audiobook in order to expand the reach of the book to people who may not be comfortable reading English, many of whom belong to low-resource areas and may need the tools within it the most. 

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish
  • A personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book

And more...

About the Author

Shana Abraham is a Program II student at Duke University, a private research university located in Durham, North Carolina. Initially studying global health and public policy, she discovered not only a passion for women’s health but also a strong interest in empowering women and creating sustainable initiatives that allow communities to use resources more effectively. She decided to create her own major, choosing to study “Culturally-Specific Innovation to Reduce Health Disparities for Black and Brown Women,” in the hopes that it will provide her the multidisciplinary background to better serve disadvantaged populations in the future. The idea for Rise was born from her love for mentoring young women and her passion for health education and promotion.

When she’s not running around campus between classes and club meetings, you can often find Shana dancing with her performance teams (or by herself) to any type of music. She also has an unhealthy obsession with dogs and loves dragging people into existential conversations.

For more information, you can connect with Shana at shana.abraham224@gmail.com and @shana.abraham on Instagram.

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family, and network. Please use #RisewithShana and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page
  • Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much for all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Shana Abraham

Story of My Book
Rise: How Empowering Women Elevates Us All is about how society benefits as a whole when women are given the chance to come into their power. Rise seeks to not only illustrate the various reasons why female empowerment is important, but also aims to provide guidance on how we can support the women around us and allow them the chance to create a positive impact on their own lives, their communities, and even the world.My name is Shana Abraham and I am the author of Rise: How Empowering Women Elevates Us All. I wrote this book because I’ve come to realize just how important and powerful female empowerment is, not just for women but for society as a whole. We can look at its effects from any perspective — political, social, health, economic, etc. — and it always results in progress.There are many people who want to empower women, but don’t know the most effective ways to encourage them. There are also many young women who want to create social change, but don’t know where to start. Many women would benefit from learning about the tools that can help them, but also from learning that they are not alone in the challenges that they face.My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover the close relationship between gender equity and global health. In this book, I hope to instill the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for female empowerment in you. And then ultimately I want you to see this book as a tool to help you create social change and support the women around you.In this book, you'll learn about the various levels of adversity that women face daily, and the core principles of female changemakers who've been able to overcome such challenges, including:

How there are many different ways to be an effective female leader and the range of experiences that can create an impact. You’ll learn from stories about Malala Yousafzai, who was shot by the Taliban, to Elyse Fox, who battled with depression her entire life and discover the various ways women can overcome their forms of adversity to advance a greater cause.
How Mercy Akuot was a child bride in Sudan, and how after days of violence and struggle, she was able to get help and escape this fate. You’ll be inspired by her resilience and how she’s used this experience to fight negative cultural practices across the globe.
How it’s not about giving women charity, but rather a chance to fight for what they deserve, and how young women across the globe have championed a variety of causes, from Jihye Yang in South Korea, Suhani Jalota in India, and Nadya Okamoto in America.

 
You will love this book if you either are or know a young woman who wants to be a leader in their own right. They may look up to certain female public figures, but don’t know just how powerful they themselves can be when given the right resources. With the stories and insights you find in Rise, you’ll learn effective strategies to lift up the women around you and help them explore opportunities to create social impact.Rise is a non-fiction book that speaks to young women and their supporters who are looking at female empowerment and social change for the first time.
 
The Book - Rise: How Empowering Women Elevates Us AllThe book is written in 3 Parts...Part 1 provides background on the female empowerment movement, the history of social change, and why many women continue to hesitate to create social change and/or take leadership roles. It highlights key insights, such as how women tend to reinvest 90% of their income into their families when economically empowered, in comparison to the average 30-40% from men. Part 1 also delves into how social change has been amplified due to the advancement of technology in recent years, such as through social media campaigns, online crowdfunding sources, etc.Part 2 explores the core principles of female changemakers and details the stories of how they’ve been able to cultivate qualities such as authenticity in order to attain their level of success. You’ll see how adversity can come in various forms, from violent encounters like Malala’s experience to mental health struggles like Elyse Fox, and how with resilience, one can find ways to overcome these challenges. Part 2 also speaks to the importance of a support network and illustrates the various levels in which a young woman can be encouraged and advocated for.Part 3 centers around how to empower women and girls. It lays out the various challenges to empowerment, such as how many young girls are forced to turn to sex work in order to pay their school fees, allowing them to continue their education and avoid being married off early. It dives into the various methods of empowerment: psychological, social, economic, education, and more. Factors such as the lack of academic opportunities for girls is costing our society trillions of dollars, demonstrating one of the reasons it’s imperative that we not only acknowledge the necessity of female empowerment but also act on this issue. This final part shows that there are numerous ways to move the world towards a more equitable society and that it’s never too early or too late to start supporting women.

The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in July 2020

The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
The Copyediting for My Book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this summer

story:
IN CASE YOU DON'T READ FURTHER, THIS IS WHERE YOU CAN ORDER THE BOOK (print copy starting at the $15 giving level).  THANKS FOR READING THIS MUCH! 

Dear Visionary,

Hello!  And, Namaste.  You’re undoubtedly here for a reason, and we thank you.  You may be here because you love our idea of creating a children’s board book series that promotes greater cultural awareness and openness, starting with India.  You may also like the fact that we’re trying to give back to some amazing young leaders in India.  You may also be here because you assumed, based on the 2Lokas name or something else and totally random (it happens), that we’re offering some super-cool, human-sized gadget that will beam you up to an otherworldly place, and back, in 3.74 minutes.  Or, simply, that we’re just two crazy ladies.  

In any case, we believe you may also be reading this because you share our larger vision of building connections in the work that we do, and cultivating “youthfulness” throughout the world. And, by youthful we don’t mean age.  Age is just a number, an arbitrary numerical assignment.  By youthful, we mean the curiosity, the openness, the fun and fearlessness that we associate with being young - that we see and admire in our own little ones.  We could certainly use more of that in the world and we truly believe it’s in all of us, perhaps hidden or forgotten, but it’s there.  So, by investing in our first board book, you’re also investing in our shared vision.  Thats right, now you’re a part of this vision, so jump up, jump down, and get excited!

Of course, for those of you who are wondering what on earth we’re talking about, don’t worry, we’re going to take a turn for the tangible and concrete with bullet points, photos, infographics, and more. Starting...now.

Your contribution to this campaign will not only be forever appreciated, but it will also:

  1. Help us launch The Little Loka™ Series with our first children’s board book - “Maya and Leela Present: Dances of India.”

  2. Allow us to pay it forward to the country we’re writing about (India!) and financially support young social entrepreneurs effecting social change in their communities. We’ll also be donating books here in the U.S. as part of our philanthropic efforts.

  3. Enable us to build a business model that fully integrates social values, forges connections among people from varying backgrounds, and promotes the shared vision we mentioned above.

You’re probably also interested in who we are, and possibly even in how this whole thing came about.  Well, we’re two professionals, two mothers, two college tennis buddies, two lo(c)kas.  We noticed a dearth of books aimed at the youngest readers (ages 0-4) that reflected the rich cultural diversity around us - both in the United States and around the globe.  Thus, our book project, with a social twist, was born!  We believe it’s never too early, or too late for that matter, to open up to and better understand the world.  And, 2Lokas (the venture we started) and this book project are part of our own effort to create a meaningful and successful social enterprise model for ourselves and for others.

That’s essentially it!  Feel free to scroll down for additional details on the campaign including: where specifically your money will go, awesome perks, and our hopefully not too lofty monetary goals. Even if you’re not particularly interested in getting your hands on a book (you can always get a gift for someone or we can donate one or many books on your behalf - clearly, the options are abound!), we still invite you to consider contributing to this journey of ours.  Likewise, if you’re in the Washington, D.C. area, think about coming out to our Book Preview shin-dig on November 17th, which may or may not involve some form of Indian dance (so get ready to Free Your Dance!). Check back for updates on this!

Anyway, we understand that there are many cyber places and spaces you could be frequenting right now.  But, you’re here with us.  And, we thank you for that.  

Much love,

Kyra + Malini

2Lokas, LLC

Express. Engage. Empower.


                                                            

                                                         

FUNDING DETAILS

Book Launch: Your contributions will help us cover all aspects of the production of 500 print copies of the board book (board books are more expensive to print) plus the development and launch of an interactive digital version.  The costs include: publishing, editing, printing, packaging, design, illustrations, marketing, and ultimately distribution! And, if all goes well, your contributions will also help us launch the next book in The Little Loka™ India series.  We are all about creating a sustainable model.  

Seeding Tomorrow’s Leaders: Paying it forward was a mandatory part of our mission and business model.  It made sense to us to focus our giving on India (the country we’re writing about) and on young social entrepreneurs dedicated to making a difference in their respective communities.  We also realized early on that allocating a percentage of our profit was not ideal for us because there was no guarantee that this amount would be significant enough to make an impact.  So, we decided to set aside a pre-determined pool of money for each young leader.  We’ll make two payments to them over the course of one year.  Thus, your contribution to our campaign will also help us fund the two amazing young leaders whom we’ve vetted and selected - Sumeet Gade and Aarti Naik.  Both began their social ventures when they were only 20 years-old and amidst their own challenging circumstances.  Sumeet started Pragati, a program to promote the recovery of children in hospitals.  Aarti began SAKHI for Girls Education, an initiative aimed at promoting education for girls within slums.  For more information on the pre-selected projects and their amazing founders, feel free to visit the Tomorrow’s Leaders page on our website.  

Book Donations: Although the focus of our books, and our venture in general, is global in nature, we’d like to support communities within the United States as well.  We live in a pretty special place, indeed.  And, there clearly is a need for our support here, particularly given the increasingly diverse country we live in.  Our plan is to donate Little Loka™ books to communities in need - via libraries, Head Start programs, etc.  We feel that this will be a wonderful way to not only support more traditional education and literacy efforts targeting young children, but to foster a greater understanding of the cultural similarities and differences among us all as well.  

Perks: And...finally!  As much as we’d love to be able to provide the perks we’re offering through the various tiers for free, our budget just won’t allow it.  Le grand sigh. Anyway, the good news, because there’s always good news, many of our perks will be 100% handmade and/or personalized with the help of our in-house artist and illustrator extraordinaire who has an eye for creative merch and product design.  Not to mention, she’s clearly quite talented when it comes to artistic endeavors.  There are also some fabulous organizations that have agreed to lend a hand by subsidizing their work so we can offer specific perks to you!  So, we’ve built the cost of design, printing, and production into our goal total.  And, if you absolutely love something and want more of it or if you’re interested in additional items we might offer, we’ll also be selling items separately through our online storefront.  


                                                              

                                                        
LET'S SURPASS $25,000!


                                                               

                                                            

ACCOUNTABILITY = AWESOME

We’re known to geek out to cool visuals, so, rather than try to explain where each of the estimated dollar amounts is going, we figured we’d provide an infographic in the form of a flow-chart instead.


                                                                                                                      


PERK PREVIEW

As mentioned above, we'll be providing some pretty fabulous perks, many of which will feature original images by our illustrator!  Most are fairly self-explanatory, so we'll spare you the lengthy rambling, which we've clearly perfected, ha!  Anyway, below is a little sneak peek.  Oh, and just a note - the estimated delivery date is the end of February for most of the tiers.  However, we know that the holidays are coming up, and what better gift to give someone who's got little ones running around than a board book? Thus, if you're interested in getting a super early bird copy of a book, just let us know; we can certainly do our best to expedite the process!

And, on that note, here are some of the perks.

The not-just-a-bookmark bookmark!

 

Beautifully handmade dandiya sticks!

Original design for either a t-shirt or tote!

Handmade charm!

Our book! (Note: Image a mock-up)

Additional perks that our illustrator has helped design include:

  • Specially designed postcard from Leela
  • Interactive eBook
  • Handmade book-inspired charm
  • Dances of India themed wallpaper for your phone, laptop, or iPad
  • Dances of India themed original poster
  • Portrait of you or your child (if you have one :)  as an Indian animal
  • Painting of you or your child (if you have one :) with Maya and Leela
  • Original print (selection of 5 designs that we'll share with you if you choose this option!)  

And, finally, we'd like to give a round, or several, of shout-outs to a handful of people who've very kindly offered to help us fulfill many of these perks, in addition to our illustrator:

  • Handmade dandiya sticks by Hasta - The Creative Hand 
  • Personal dance class or choreogoraphy session contributed by Rhythmaya Dance
  • Tickets to Dakshina/Daniel Phoenix Singh Dance Company's signature Fall Festival (DC-based, 2014)

                                                             


ADDITIONAL INFORMATION

For more information on our project, our books, and our overall vision, feel free to visit our website: www.2lokas.com.  We’ve been documenting our process - from start to not yet but almost finished - on the blog and invite everyone, regardless of whether or not they’ve elected to donate, to join us on this exciting adventure!

And, while you’re at it, come hang out with us on social media!

  • Twitter

  • Facebook

  • Pinterest

(Note: Image a mock-up)Additional perks that our illustrator has helped design include:
Specially designed postcard from Leela
Interactive eBook
Handmade book-inspired charm
Dances of India themed wallpaper for your phone, laptop, or iPad
Dances of India themed original poster
Portrait of you or your child (if you have one :)  as an Indian animal
Painting of you or your child (if you have one :) with Maya and Leela
Original print (selection of 5 designs that we'll share with you if you choose this option!)  

And, finally, we'd like to give a round, or several, of shout-outs to a handful of people who've very kindly offered to help us fulfill many of these perks, in addition to our illustrator:

Handmade dandiya sticks by Hasta - The Creative Hand 

Personal dance class or choreogoraphy session contributed by Rhythmaya Dance
Tickets to Dakshina/Daniel Phoenix Singh Dance Company's signature Fall Festival (DC-based, 2014)
                                                             ADDITIONAL INFORMATIONFor more information on our project, our books, and our overall vision, feel free to visit our website: www.2lokas.com.  We’ve been documenting our process - from start to not yet but almost finished - on the blog and invite everyone, regardless of whether or not they’ve elected to donate, to join us on this exciting adventure!And, while you’re at it, come hang out with us on social media!

story:
July 2nd Update!

I am absolutely blown away by all of the incredible support I have gotten thus far in my campaign and I want to thank every single one of my contributors! I aspire to be like each and every one of you when I am older. I want to be able to use the knowledge and experience I have gained and will be gaining in the next few years of life to help others through many different medical and science outreach opportunities. 

I am ecstatic to have reached and surpassed my goal of $1995 (by birth year). I feel very honored to have so much support around me.  Seeing as I have reached my goal, I have decided to raise my goal to $3000. If I reach $3000, I will be running a teen science blogging contest and use the money for prizes to motivate teens to work on their writing. Hopefully this will spark some new interest in science communication!

Please do not hesitate to contact me with ideas or questions – I look forward to hearing from you! 

Hello readers!

My name is Megan Nantel and I need your help so that I can do science this summer!  I’m a grade 12 student living in Vancouver, British Columbia and I am going to be graduating at the end of June.  Since I will be attending university next year, I definitely need to get a summer job to save up... BUT I would much rather continue to work on some science projects that I started during the school year instead!

Your support would allow be to continue my science research project and continue to develop a science blogging network for teens! Working on these science endeavors this year has helped me realize that I want to continue with science in my future.  I really enjoy both the areas of scientific research and science communication; hence, I want to work on these two important cultures of science this summer!

My research project is on Okanagan grapes yeasts ability to use diesel as a carbon source (http://futurescienceleaders.org/wild-destroyers/). Hydrocarbon spills and hydrocarbon waste (like oil containers or oil drums) can be detrimental to the environment so scientists are looking at ways to use naturally occurring species to clean up this pollution!  Any information about microorganisms that can add to our collective knowledge of potential bioremediation and hydrocarbon degradation methods is critical to finding the perfect combination that can one day reverse this sort of damage.  Your support would directly make a discovering like this a reality! I have already generated a lot of interest with this project and am competing at the Canada-Wide Science Fair but there is so much more I could do!

This summer I would also like to work on developing a newly created science blogging network for teens called U20 Science.  Science communication is critical for all scientists, especially young ones.  I would be spending the summer creating easy Wordpress tutorials and working on publicizing the site to teens.  The work with U20 Science would help lay the framework for future young scientists by educating them about the importance of science communication. 

I really enjoy working on these projects but saving up for school is crucial for me.  Your support would mean that I could continue this work.  My goal is $1995 because I was born in 1995, however anything above this would be amazing! 

As cheesy as it may sound, helping me means helping the future of science in general!  Helping me also means that you are eligible for some amazing perks!  Best of all, all of the perks accumulate so you don’t just receive the perk that matches with the donation but all of the perks before it as well!  I have items from homemade cards and key chains to acknowledgements in my paper and science cookies.  I will definitely treat all my supporters with love!

Thank you so much for taking the time to read my campaign! Please also use the Indiegogo share tools to help me generate interest in my project!

Sincerely,

Megan

story:
We are very proud to be publishing Eight Step Recovery: Using the Buddha’s Teachings to Overcome Addiction, and we want to offer you the opportunity to get involved in bringing this book into the world. Publishing is changing – we increasingly need start-up funding in a book’s production and marketing. This is why we ask you to help by making a donation.

Valerie: "These teachings saved my life, and I believe that they will help to save other people’s lives too. So please do help with our campaign. Be part of this new movement of Buddhism and recovery, get on board and help us put the message out there."

As will be clear from the endorsements below, this book will make a substantial contribution to resources for addiction recovery. Please do give generously.  You can give the amounts suggested in the perks (right), or you can give an amount that you decide. We will be sending out the perks in January.

- Peter Joseph, Publishing Director, Windhorse Publications

Find out more about 'Eight Step Recovery' 

"The eight steps taught here may be seen as eight principles to live by. We begin by accepting that whatever we have suffered – and some do suffer more than others – our pain is not ours alone, not personal, but simply a way life may show up while we are in this world. The other steps lead us away from the path of creating more suffering for ourselves and, gradually, onto the path of compassion for others. It takes practice. In this volume Valerie and Paramabandhu gently introduce us to the practice of breathing and self-awareness, beginning with small increments, until breathing and awareness become the anchors for us being grounded in all the eight steps.”

From the Foreword by Gabor Maté, M.D. author of In the Realm of Hungry Ghosts: Close Encounters with Addiction

"'The Buddha was in recovery.' Taking this bold statement as a starting point, this wonderful book shows how we are all addicted to aspects of life and can all benefit from training our minds and hearts to be free of the tyranny of compulsion. The Mindfulness-Based Addiction Recovery (MBAR) programme draws on a wide range of the Buddha’s practical, yet deeply profound, teachings. Over the eight steps you are given a priceless gift – the possibility to gain mastery over your mind and heart and find freedom.”

Vidyamala Burch, founder and co-director of Breathworks, author of Mindfulness for Health

“Through Buddhist teachings, personal experiences, and case examples, this book provides a wise illustration of the fundamental processes underlying a broad range of addictive behaviors. Mason-John and Groves offer here a practical and compassionate step-by-step guide to freedom from the deep trappings and suffering of addiction.”

Sarah Bowen, Assistant Professor, Department of Psychiatry and Behavioral Sciences, University of Washington, author of Mindfulness-Based Relapse Prevention for Addictive Behaviors: A Clinician's Guide

“Blending the MBAR program with traditional Buddhist teachings and personal stories, the authors give us a wise and compassionate approach to recovery from the range of addictions. This comprehensive approach will be a valuable tool for addicts and addiction professionals alike.”

Kevin Griffin, author of One Breath at a Time: Buddhism and the Twelve Steps

“The eight steps outlined here provide a simple, wise and practical approach to recovery from a wide range of compulsive patterns of behaviour associated with suffering. They provide a spiritual pathway to recovery for people from any faith tradition, as well as for those who are not religious, and for those who suffer from addiction as well as those who are simply aware of the suffering associated with the human condition. This is a book for everyone!”

Professor Chris Cook, Director of the Project for Spirituality, Theology & Health, Durham University

story:
Mysteries of the Tarot Unlocked!

Who hasn't been fascinated by the mysterious tarot, writer and reader alike? For centuries, fortune-telling by the Tarot has caught many an imagination, but nothing like what I'm about to present here.

I am an editor who specializes in working with indie writers. But first and foremost I am a FICTION LOVER. There's only one thing I love more than my kids and Death By Chocolate Cake--and that's STORY. Editing is my career, and I've edited over seventy successful indie books. I know talent when I see it, and I know what it takes to make a story work. I have self-published myself so I know how to put a publication together. Need character references? Check out my Testimonial Page:  http://wordwebbing.com/testimonials-3/

Want more? Just ask and I'll tell you anything you want to know. Except about the goat incident, with which I was not involved. (Can't reveal details; the gag order, you know.)

I've been reading since I was three years old. Through some dark and terrible times, the only thing which saved my life and my sanity, more than once, were books. Wonderful, fabulous, amazing stories spun by people I didn't know, but who saved me. People who had no idea the joy and wonderment that helped me survive some awful experiences. 

I want to pay some of that back by presenting to you a collection of incredible stories based on the Major Arcana of the Tarot by an eclectic and tremendously talented group of writers. Each one has their own unique view and storytelling voice--voices I know will mesmerize, hypnotize, and satisfy your deep fiction itch. How do I know? Because I have either worked directly with some of these writers as an editor, or am a fan of their work. 

In order to make this happen, I need your help. 

Where The Money Goes 

The goal is to create a quality publication from some of the best new and established, award-winning writers you may not know. Yet. I aim to change that.

The budget is simple and clear. The goal: $5000 to cover professional rates for the writers and publishng costs.

Professional rates for writers:                                                      $3300.00

(That's .05 per word for up to 3000 words per story; $150 cap; 22 stories)

Copy editing                                                                               $500.00

Cover art:                                                                                   $350.00

Formatting/book design:                                                              $250.00

Perk expenses:                                                                           $250.00

(This includes print copies)

Marketing and financial fees:                                                        $350.00

 

Total:                                                                                       $5000.00

 

THE PERKS, THE PERKS!


On the sidebar is listed a choice of perks for every budget. The writers involved have been beyond generous in contributing to the perk packages, and your choices for The Empress Package can be found on http://www.allegoriesofthetarot.com/support-this-project/ -- The Support This Project Page.

Anything you can contribute is deeply appreciated. 

Stretch goals as they happen and inspiration occurs. I already have some ideas and cool stuff lined up if we get that far. Check this page often for updates.

 

Your Reward

I am a fiction freak and I know you are, too.  (The Tarot told me!) In this volume you can expect a wide array of genres. Something for everyone. Fantasy? Check. Paranormal? Check. Horror? Check. Bizzaro? Check. Dystopia? Check. Romance? Check. And a few more surprises, but one thing these stories will all have in common--QUALITY.

This anthology will be chock-full of short stories from some of the best writers you may not know. It took less than 24 hours to fill 21 spots--that's how much the writers believe in me and in this project, and I can't tell you how honored I am by this. Just look at this line-up!

The Fool-- Peter Giglio

The Magician--Lon Prater

The High Priestess--Billie Sue Mosiman

The Empress--Spike Marlowe

The Emperor--Kris Austen Radcliffe

The Hierophant--Jessica McHugh

The Lovers--Eden Baylee

The Chariot--Annetta Ribken

Strength--Rochelle Maya Callen

The Hermit--Red Tash

The Wheel of Fortune--

Justice--Catie Rhodes

The Hanged Man--Matthew Bryan

Death--Timothy Smith

Temperance--Anne Chaconas

The Devil--Patti Larsen

The Tower--Jordan L. Hawk

The Star--Samantha Henderson

The Moon--Janet Sked

The Sun--Tristan J. Tarwater

Judgment--Jennifer Wingard

The World--Laura Eno

 

SPREAD THE LOVE!


I know budgets are tight all over, and if you can't donate there is still a way for you to help. Spread the word! Twitter, Facebook, G+, Stumble, Tumblr, LinkedIn, even smoke signals if it doesn't violate your city's ordinances. Tell your friends,  your family, strangers on the street--but please note bail money is not included in this budget.

I am truly grateful for any support you can offer.

story:
Hi, my name is Torben Sonntag. "Viel Bier um nix" is the first book I´ve written. At first I did it for the fun of it. I thought it´s cool to have a self-written book in my shelf and it would make a perfect present for my small children some day. But the outcome was way better that I thought it could get. 

So I self-published it in Germany. I printed 2,500 copies and sold 1,000 within the first 4 month (till now). That means I have still invested much more time and money than I got back. But I believe, it´s a damn good book that should make much more people happy.  As my story plays on Hawaii, it would totally make sense to have an English version of it. This is the back cover text:

"Stefan and Jorn, two friends from school days, spend their windsurf-holidays on Maui / Hawaii. After a party they get brutally attacked. Stefan barely survives, Jorn is kidnapped. As quick and unbureaucratic help from the local police is unlikely and  time is running, Stefan needs to find his friend on his own. 

A hot trail leads to Kahoolawe, a Hawaiian island that has been used as a training target for the military since decades and is currently being cleared of unexploded ordnance. When Stefan sets off to rescue his friend, he has no idea that hunting is just about to begin..."

Review by n-tv.de (one of the biggest news-channels in Germany): „Drugs, shootings, deaths, nasty characters, and a ludicrously thrilling story. All this is part of "Viel Bier um nix" by Torben Sonntag. The novel really lives up to it´s subtitle "A Hawaiian action thriller "!

Review by Kieler Nachrichten (regional newspaper in Northern Germany): „It starts on a container ship somewhere in the South China Sea and ends in Kiel between „Fishbar“ and „Café do Sul“. In between you’ll find a crazy story about surfers, drug lords and a trip halfway around the world. "Viel Bier um nix" is the action-thriller by Torben Sonntag“

I already contacted some translators. To get a decent translation I have to invest 12.000 €. Of course it also takes money to get some marketing done and to print the English version. But if I can get 5.000 € here, I will start the project "half way to Hawaii" - The English titel of "Viel Bier um nix"

Please help me to push this project further. Who know´s maybe my next campaign is to finance a movie of my story!
