In between you’ll find a crazy story about surfers, drug lords and a trip halfway around the world. "Viel Bier um nix" is the action-thriller by Torben Sonntag“
I already contacted some translators. To get a decent translation I have to invest 12.000 €. Of course it also takes money to get some marketing done and to print the English version. But if I can get 5.000 € here, I will start the project "half way to Hawaii" - The English titel of "Viel Bier um nix"
Please help me to push this project further. Who know´s maybe my next campaign is to finance a movie of my story!

story:
NOTE: All Silence in the Library anthologies are DRM-free. The $10 perk should read "DRM-free" rather than just "DRM".

Here at Silence in the Library Publishing, we've put out what we like to think are some really great products. Many of you, who know us from Kickstarter, have taken the journey with us from our first anthology, Time Traveled Tales, through Athena's Daughters and Apollo's Daughters, all the way to the graphic novel Icarus. 

Many of those projects have captured the imagination of a large number of readers. Never before, though, have we launched a project with the power to galvanize the entire science fiction and fantasy community, from authors and artists, to publishers and readers, like this one. 

This time, you see, we're taking care of our own. And that's when all of us are at our best. When we, as a community, are supporting each other.

The purpose of this anthology is to provide that kind of support to author CJ Henderson. Let me start off though, by saying that this is not charity. We are not simply collecting money and handing it off to a needy individual to help pay medical expenses. No, what we are doing here is endowing a grant. A grant that will allow CJ to continue to produce the kinds of stories that CJ writes. Stories with the power to entertain and captivate us all. We are making an investment in CJ.

All of the authors, artists, publishers, graphic designers, and other professionals involved in this project are assigning what would be our portions of this anthology to that grant.

Those professionals include authors like Kevin J. Anderson and Rebecca Moesta,Danielle Ackley-McPhail, Jack Dann, Ed Greenwood, Joe Haldeman, Nancy Holder,Tanya Huff, Gail Z. Martin, Jean Rabe, Mike Resnik, Janine K. Spendlove, Michael A. Stackpole, Anton Strout, Robert E. Vardeman, Elizabeth A. Vaughan, Gene Wolfe, Bryan Young, Timothy Zahn…well the the list goes on and on. It also includes artists like Alan M. Clark, Mark Dos Santos, Ben Fogletto, Thomas Nackid, Matt Slay, and Christina Yoder. 

Why are we doing that? If you know CJ or his work, you know the answer.

CJ Henderson is a working author who has spent years writing insightful and entertaining books in a wide array of genres. He's also spent those years sharing his humor and good nature not just in his stories, but with the science fiction and fantasy community as a whole. A staple at conventions around the country, CJ has always made a point of being generous with his time and experience. 

And, oh boy, is there some experience! CJ, in addition to writing fiction, has worked as a movie house manager, waiter, drama coach, fast food jockey, interior painter, blackjack dealer, book reviewer, stockman, English teacher, roadie, advertising salesman, creative writing instructor, supernatural investigator, bank guard, storage coordinator, children’s theater director, card shark, film critic, dishwasher, magazine editor, traffic manager, short-order cook, stand-up comic, interview & general article writer; toy sales-man, camp counselor, movie booker, street mime, lounge lizard, and as a senior editor of legal publications at Matthew Bender & Co., Inc. 

And he's used all of this experience to inform his writing and his interactions with fans and fellow authors.

CJ is facing a painful battle with a cancer that all of us, including CJ, thought he had beaten. Well, It has come back with a vengeance. 

Here's the story in CJ's own words:

CJ Henderson here. Or, as I'm known these days, cancer boy. Here it is ... what's wrong with me. The abridged edition.

Last year my leg swelled up massively, and this led to the discovery of blood clots which led to the discovery of cancer. Specifically, non-Hodgkin Lymphoma. Now, this is the wimpy version of a wimpy cancer, so I was thinking I was going to be okay. It had been crippling me for several years without me knowing it.

I went through the chemotherapy, lost weight, lost hair, lost work opportunities, found out I had the most amazing set of friends and fans a goofy guy could hope for. They pumped me full of radiation, ran me through a scanner, and a few days ago told me I didn't beat it. Almost, but not quite.

I had been riddled with cancer from head to toe. The cancer was everywhere. Well, they believe they got most of it. All the little cancers were wiped out. But, the ones that survived have regrouped in my lower back. There's a BIG knot of them there (I'm not anthropomorphizing, by the way, by little cancers I mean nodes that grow out of control) that seem to take pleasure in pressing against the nerves in my spine to make me scream.

Like the majority of working authors, CJ does not have a job that offers him medical insurance, so not only does he have to deal with the pain of his cancer, he also has to worry about how his medical bills will affect his family.

This is where we come in - and by we I mean Silence in the Library, a ton of great authors, artists, and other professionals, and you. You are the most important part of this equation. We have put together an amazing anthology, but only you can make this project successful.

We want to be able to provide enough funding that CJ can get well without having to worry about the medical bills. We want him to be able to focus on continuing to produce excellent stories. We will all be richer for it.

As I said before, this is not charity. For your contribution, you will be receiving an incredible anthology that will only get better as we reach stretch goals. We're starting out with an initial line-up of great authors that includes the following:

Kevin J. Anderson and Rebecca Moesta, Maggie Allen, Jack Dann, Ed Greenwood,Joe Haldeman, Nancy and Belle Holder, Tanya Huff, Gail Z. Martin, Danielle Ackley-McPhail, Jean Rabe, Mike Resnik, Hildy Silverman, Janine Spendlove, Michael A. Stackpole, Anton Strout, Kelly Swails, Robert E. Vardeman, Elizabeth A. Vaughan,Bryan Young, Jean Marie Ward, Gene Wolfe, and Timothy Zahn. And, of course, CJ Henderson.

But we have over 30 authors lined up in total, and as we reach their stretch goals, the anthology only gets better and better and bigger and bigger. In total, we're currently sitting at potentially 179,000 words of science fiction and fantasy goodness and counting. Once all of the stories have been added, the likelihood is that we'll wind up well over 200,000 words. 

You'll also be getting a whole bunch of free eBooks and short story collections as we reach other stretch goals!

We're not. At least, not one print book. Given how many stories we have, that would be impractical. While ALL of the stories from the authors listed above and from all of the stretch goals we reach will be included in the DRM-free eBook you receive for your contribution, only the initial authors listed above will be included in the first print book. That's right, first print book. One of our stretch goals will be an additional print volume, which you will be able to add to your pledge as we reach those goals. 

As I said before, though, you will get all of the stories in the eBook.

Here's the entire list:

Initial Authors:

Kevin J. Anderson and Rebecca Moesta, Maggie Allen, Jack Dann, Ed Greenwood, Joe Haldeman, Nancy and Belle Holder, Tanya Huff, Gail Z. Martin, Danielle Ackley-McPhail, Jean Rabe, Mike Resnik, Hildy Silverman, Janine Spendlove, Michael A. Stackpole, Anton Strout, Kelly Swails, Robert E. Vardeman, Elizabeth A. Vaughan, Bryan Young, Jean Marie Ward, Gene Wolfe, and Timothy Zahn. And, of course, CJ Henderson.

Stretch Goal Authors:

Aaron Rosenberg, Alan M. Clark, Allan Gilbreath, Alma Alexander, Tera Fulbright, Cynthia Ward, Davey Beauchamp, Dylan Birtolo, James Chambers, Jeff Young, Jennifer Brozek, John Hartness, Maxwell Alexander Drake, John L. French, Jonathan Maberry, Keith R.A. DeCandido, KT Pinto, Michael Ventrella, Misty Massey, Patrick Thomas, Pete Prellwitz, Sheryl Nantus, Stuart Jaffe, David B. Coe, Vicki Steger, and Mike McPhail. 

And there are more on the way!

Artist Alan M. Clark has provided an amazing cover for the first book of the anthology. Check it out:

While the imagery is not specifically monkey-related, as soon Alan offered this beautiful artwork, we were hooked.

And other artists are working on covers for the other print book in the anthology when we reach that goal.

We've also had several authors, including Mark Dos Santos, Ben Fogletto, Thomas Nackid, Matt Slay, and Christina Yoder offer drawings of CJ Henderson as a monkey that will be included in the anthology.

We also have musicians like Danny Birt and Jonah Knight standing by ready to contribute music as stretch goals.

One of the things you should know about CJ Henderson is that he loves monkeys. One of his best known sayings is "I'll dance like a monkey for a nickel." In one of our updates, we'll share a hilarious story in which that saying came back to bite him.

I think you know where our title came from…and you can rest assured that there will be at least one monkey in each and every story! And, many of our authors will graciously make fools of themselves through the course of the campaign by dancing like monkeys on video. We'll post those videos to the media gallery on a regular basis.

So, now you know the story behind this anthology. As I said before, it is times like these that we, as a community of authors, artists, readers, and other contributors, are at our best. Please join us in this important journey and help us provide support to an exceptional author and human being who is in a bad spot - with the added benefit of ensuring that we have many more years of CJ's wonderful work in the process.

Aside from the money needed to pay for printing and shipping to fulfill your rewards, and the portion that goes to Indiegogo, all funds from this Kickstarter will go to CJ Henderson to help him battle cancer.

First 40 Backers - Get a free print copy of the anthology No Longer Dreams, edited byDanielle Ackley-McPhail. US Backers only. But don't worry, international backers, you'll get a free eBook of a novel from one of the authors from our anthology. US backers can also opt out of the print and go strictly digital, if you wish.

First 150 Backers - Will receive an advance digital copy of author Ed Greenwood's original story for the Dance Like a Monkey anthology.

First 250 Backers - Will get a free digital download of a Jean Rabe short story written just for our first 250 backers!

$8000 - Every backer at or above $10 gets a free digital download of Michael A. Stackpole's alternate history book Perfectly Invisible. 

$8500 - We'll add a story to the anthology by author Tera Fulbright. 

$9000 - Every backer at or above $10 gets a free digital download of Bryan Young's time travel adventure Operation Montauk. 

$9500 - We'll add a story to the anthology by author Aaron Rosenberg.

$10,000 - Every backer at or above $10 gets a free digital download of Jean Marie Ward's short story collection Four For More. 

$10,500 - We'll add a story to the anthology by author John L. French.

$11,000 - Every backer at or above $10 gets a free digital download of four John L. French short stories: "Clean and Pure", "How the Story Goes", "Hero", and "What Goes Around".

$11,500 - We'll add a short story to the anthology by author James Chambers.

$12,000 - Every backer at or above $10 gets a free digital download of Three Chords of Chaos by James Chambers.

$13,000 - We'll add a story to the anthology by author John Hartness.

$13,500 - Every backer at or above $10 gets a free digital download of Tera Fulbright's story "Fires Within the Blank Page".

$14,000 - We'll add a story to the anthology by author Alma Alexander.

$14,500 - Every backer at or above $10 gets a free digital download of The Dead Bear Witness by James Chambers.

$15,000 - We'll add a story to the anthology by author Jonathan Maberry.

$15,500 - Every backer at or above $10 gets a free digital download of the audio book of Danielle Ackley-McPhail's Consigned to the Sea.

$16,000 - We'll add a story to the anthology by author Cynthia Ward.

$16,500 - Every backer at or above $10 gets a free digital download of Tears of Bloodby James Chambers.

$17,000 - We'll add a story to the anthology by author Mike McPhail.

$17,500 - Every backer at or above $10 gets a free digital download of Gabriella byCynthia Ward.

$18,000 - We'll add a story to the anthology by author Sheryl Nantus.

$18,500 - Every backer at or above $10 gets a free digital download of The Redcaps Queen by Danielle Ackley-McPhail.

$19,000 - We'll add a story to the anthology by author Stuart Jaffe.

$19,500 - Every backer at or above $10 gets a free digital download of War of the Seasons, Book 1: The Human by Janine K. Spendlove.

$20,500 - Every Backer at or above $10 gets a free digital download of Fire and Ice byCynthia Ward.

$21,000 - We'll add a story to the anthology by author Maxwell Alexander Drake.

$21,500 - Every backer at or above $10 gets a free digital download of a Gail Z. Martinshort story bundle.

$22,000 - We'll add a story to the anthology by author Jennifer Brozek.

$22,500 - We'll add a story to the anthology by author Pete Prellwitz.

$23,000 - We'll add a story to the anthology by author Vicki Steger.

$24,000 - We'll produce a second print volume of the anthology, which you'll be able to add on to your existing contribution.

$24,500 - Every backer at or above $10 gets a free digital download of a second Gail Z. Martin short story bundle.

$25,000 - We'll add a story to the anthology by author David B. Coe.

$25,500 - We'll add a story to the anthology by author Misty Massey.

$29,000 - We'll add a story to the anthology by author Allan Gilbreath.

$30,000 - We'll add a story to the anthology by author Jeff Young.

…and more to come!

Please remember that in addition to contributing to this wonderful anthology, you can also help by spreading the word and by using the embedded Indiegogo links to like this project on Facebook, Twitter, and other social media platforms. We thank you for your time and consideration.

International Backers

There's just no way to get around it…shipping books internationally is expensive. If you've selected a perk at which you get a print copy of the book, or multiple books, please add the following for shipping:

1 Book: $25

2 Books: $30

3 Books: $50 - I know, this seems like a large jump, but at this point we go over the alb weight limit, and the cost goes up significantly.

4 Books: $55

If you select a perk with more than 4 books, please message us and we'll figure out the shipping.

Add-Ons

$20 - An extra print copy of the Dance Like a Monkey anthology.

story:
Oh God. 

Someone else is asking for money. *Eye Roll*  ---- Before I give you any of my hard earned money - I have questions! 


WHAT IS VONA? 


VONA/Voices, the only multi-genre workshop for writers of color in the nation, brings writers of color from the margins to a community where their work is centralized and honored. 

WHY ARE YOU GOING? 

Dude, I was accepted into a space made specifically for me and writers like me.

 Do you know how big that is?

I grew up in Bushwick, in the 90's. Girls like me were taught we weren't accepted anywhere except trap houses, or to get summer school lunches, or the welfare office. 

 Me!!??? You sure you accepting me? *Side Eye* 

 Little old, non academic writing, GED having, writing poems as facebook statuses, no formal training having ass ------ was accepted into one of the dopest spaces a writer of color can be accepted into.

 I was accepted into VONA solely based on writing about my life experiences. 

Crazy right? That's why I need to go represent for me and writers like me. 

What I Need 

TUITION/ HOUSING/ MEAL to cover the week that I am there is $1,450

This does not include flight, but I am not asking for flight. I am lucky enough to have just enough for that. 

Bitch, why can't you pay for this shit yourself? 

 I hate asking for help. I do. I JUST moved to Brooklyn, between the actual move, 1st months rent, 2nd months rent and security, and purchasing my furniture, that took up the majority of my savings.  So while I made one dream come true by moving back to Brooklyn, now I have this other dream that I need 1500 to achieve LOL. HELP. :( 

What do I get? 

Ok, so since I HATE asking for money, I want to give YOU something in return for your very humble donations. Check out the incentives for each category. 

Look, Elisabet, I am proud of you and all, but check it, I'm broke too. I have kids, bills, rent, and my own dreams that I am saving up for, I can't help you. 

Yes. You can. Please share this and tell the world why you're helping to support me. It means the world. Even sharing this helps get me closer to my dreams. Thank You. 

WHY ARE YOU DOING THIS? 

For my daughter who I had at the age of 16, who grew up with her grandmother because I was homeless for a hot minute and didn't want her to be homeless with me. 
For my mother, the woman who sometimes mothered me but most times abandoned me. 
For every girl who thinks their life is over because of a teen pregnancy, or drugs, or alcohol, or lost loves, or homelessness, or identity crisis. 
For every person who does not believe a story like theirs belongs in the history books. You do! Let me show you how. 
I do this for me, and for every story yet to be told. I am living fucking proof anything is possible if you JUST KEEP FUCKING GOING. 

Pa'Lante!

story:
Short Summary
My name is Cara Jones and I am an international award winning short documentary filmmaker, an award winning photographer and a motivational speaker from Antigonish, Nova Scotia.  At the ripe old age of 34 I have been fortunate enough to experience many adversities in life that have taught me the value of perseverance, resilience and faith.  After living life with over 100 seizures a day and being told “Never” the majority of my life, (I would never graduate high school, go on to university or possibly never live past my twenties), I found myself back in Antigonish at age 26, upon returning from Australia, about to embark on life as a single parent.  I reflect on the concept of “Never” and share my story with my unborn child in this inspiring and provocative journey as an intuitive and spiritual artist who continues to defy the odds.

Dear Cole, Never Say Never is filled with humor, turmoil, love, forgiveness, the discovery of self and the underlying message that we all possess unlimited potential and can achieve miraculous feats through personal power.

I decided to self publish because of all the ways I would like to use this story to inspire and create opportunities for artist and entrepreneurs. It also gives me the opportunity to raise money for the Epilepsy Association of Nova Scotia’s Educational Scholarship fund. $2 from each book will go to help fund a student’s educational endeavors.  

Many people have read the story and the response has been overwhelmingly positive.   I am excited to unleash this piece of art to the world and to inspire a new generation to become leaders and to “Never say Never.”
 
Your Investment
I want to make this publishing venture a true success and I need your help. My goal is to raise $10,000 in order to pay the very talented artist Rita Vantassel who is designing and illustrating the cover of my book, my editor Paula Lowe who is polishing the manuscript, 1000 copy print run of the book, the 1000 DVD copies of my four short documentaries that I will be including in the sleeve, my web designer who will be setting up an online merchandising store, proper ebook production that enables tablet readers to enjoy the work in a polished epub format, postage to mail out copies of the book and promotional and marketing materials to advertise once final production of the book is complete.
 
The Impact
I have seen firsthand how my story has inspired people to take charge of their lives and pursue dreams they may have deemed impossible.  For years they have come up to me at music festivals, coffee shop lineups, the grocery store, and contacted me via the internet, just to name a few, expressing their gratitude for the simple reminder that they are in control of their joy no matter what adversities stand in their way.

My dream is to take this book on tour across Canada and internationally and, through my example, empower people to take charge and aim higher than they ever dreamed possible.
 

What You Get

1) You will become part of a movement to inspire people to take responsibility and action in creating a more fulfilling life experience.
 
2) You can choose from various perks, from an ebook version, to a signed copy, your name in the published book or become a co-publisher.
 
3) You get an advanced copy before it is distributed in stores across the world!
 
4) You are supporting entrepreneurship and the arts!  
 
5) You will help to raise money for a person with Epilepsy to achieve their educational goals!

story:
Well... wow! We made it!

The campaign for my upcoming book is an ongoing success. Thank you to all who contributed. I will be spending all of my time in January signing and sending out your physical copies. I will be busy... we have contributions from over thirty countries!

Again, to everyone who has supported the project thus far, thank you!

And if you haven't signed up yet to get your personalized, signed copy (or your early-bird digital review copy) of the book, it's not too late. There is still several days to go before the campaign ends! So if you have been hesitating, hesitate no more!

Any amount I receive above the campaign target amount will go directly to the following:

  • Translation and publication of the book into Spanish and Portuguese. (Yes, other languages will follow, but I think those are the most requested)

  • The creation of an audio book (read by me in a professional studio)

  • The great Book Tour of 2014. Yup, I will be wandering about far and wide giving talks, sharing ideas, hanging out with all who contributed to help me make the book a success.

That's it... I think you will like the book and to be frank, I am nervous to finally release into the wild after ten years!

And now... as a gift for meeting and exceeding our target amount, I have attached a short passage from the book itself!

Here's the link:
The Alabaster Girl - Indiegogo Excerpt 

Enjoy,
Zan Perrion

_____________________________________________________________________________

   
And here is the original pitch...

Short Summary

Note: I forgot to add this to the $50 and $100 (signed physical copy) option: 
Please add $10 shipping for orders outside of Canada

Well, I wrote a book...

The manuscript is finally finished. Ten years... 

Who am I? My name is Zan Perrion and I have been traveling and lecturing and wondering about the philosophy of beauty for many years. In 2002, I founded the Ars Amorata movement.

What is the Ars Amorata? It is a celebration of the art of seduction, the rebirth of romance, and a lifelong quest for beauty and adventure...

As I mentioned, I have been writing this book for ten years and it has not been an easy task! It is a book of ideas, which is, I suspect, the hardest thing to capture. At any rate, the manuscript is now finished.

The book itself is multi-layered (which is part of the reason it was difficult to write). In simplest terms, it begins with a man and a woman on a train. She is there to interview him because he wrote a book called The Alabaster Girl – the memories and impressions and half-remembered dreams of his lifetime in the arms and company of women. He has been interviewed before and thus, is ready for her questions. But she pushes for more. Who is he really? she asks. And why do women respond to him in ways they never do to other men?

He looks at her and realizes he has never told anyone the secrets to his success with women, and so now, for whatever reason, he does. The rest of the book then is the musings of a seducer. - a discourse, a brain-dump of everything he knows about the heart and soul of women. And interspersed throughout his discourse are excerpts of the book he wrote: The Alabaster Girl.

So my book has three layers (and thus three distinct "voices"). Each chapter begins with the train journey interview (Voice 1), then opens up into his conversation to women in general about the way his mind works (Voice 2), and is sprinkled throughout with pieces from his book (Voice 3).

So there you have it... I wrote a book called The Alabaster Girl about a man who wrote a book called The Alabaster Girl! At its core, it is a book about the heart of women written to the heart of women. Ah, how presumptuous is that?

Is it a story? Not really. Is it self-help? No. Is it philosophy? I am not sure. Is it a novel? I suppose. But it is a novel without plot or characters or anything really. So it is hard to categorize!

Here are the chapters:

  1. The Way of Beauty
  2. The Way of Seduction
  3. The Way of Discovery
  4. The Way of the Natural
  5. The Way of Men
  6. The Way of Women
  7. The Way of Love
  8. The Way of Salvation
  9. The Way of Beauty

What's next? The publishing and promotion process. My goal is to have it published on my birthday, December 14, 2013. In order to do that, it is necessary for me to completely focus on this project until then. This means that I need to slow down my schedule of talks and live events. I love doing those events and I will continue to do them again in the future, of course, but for the next couple of months, I need to stop everything and concentrate only on this considerable project.

This is where you come in, dear reader. I am seeking a few angel sponsors. My book will come out eventually anyway, but your contribution will help to smooth the process and allow it to be published by my exacting, albeit arbitrary, deadline.

So it is my honor to ask for help. My direct appeal to you is this... I am inviting you to help release sponsor the publication and presentation of this book.

I like to think of it exactly like the artists and minstrels of days gone by - they sought out friends and patrons who believed in their work enough to lend support. Or perhaps it's like intrepid explorers of centuries past - knowing that they could not do it alone, they sought out patrons and requested financial backing for their dangerous and risky overseas explorations!

Well, that is perhaps a little overly dramatic... my book is hardly dangerous or risky or intrepid, but you get the point!

How much do I need? I calculate 15,000 dollars to pay for everything - the book publishing, the book design, the website, the promotion and book tour (yes, I plan to hit the road for all of 2014 and will very likely be in a city near you!)

That's it... this is a very personal project and thus, a very personal request. If you are willing to contribute something toward that amount, you will forever be regarded by me as a personal patron. For that I will always be grateful.

_____________________________________________________________________________

UPDATE (November 4): Very few people have ever read the manuscript of my book. Not even parts of it. Why? I don't know. Like I said, it is deeply personal and I have kept it close to my chest over the years. I think only four people (including my editor in New York) have ever read it in its entirety! And now I am about to present it to all of you!

One person who has read it recently is my good friend, Steve Pavlina (Personal Development For Smart People - www.stevepavlina.com). Here is his proffered testimonial:

"The Alabaster Girl is a richly compelling, beautifully poetic journey into the heart of relationships. With his unapologetic wisdom and tough compassion, Zan delivers an astonishingly insightful guide to the paradoxes of love. This opus is best relished in small sips, allowing time for its many a-ha moments to weave themselves into your own tapestry of self-discovery. Highly recommended!"

_____________________________________________________________________________


What I Need & What You Get

My goal is to have the book published by my birthday, December 14. In order to do that, I need a few key sponsors.

Look for it as a print book available in January, as well as Kindle and eventually audio.

Here is what I offer in return:

  • For $10, you will get a personal thank-you email AND your name on the book website as a supporter.

  • For $25, you will get a personal thank-you email AND your name on the book website as a supporter AND a digital review copy of the book (One week before official launch).

  • For $50, you will get a personal thank-you email AND your name on the book website as a supporter AND a digital review copy of the book (One week before official launch) AND I will sign a copy in your name and send it to you after it is published.

    (Note: Please add $10 shipping for orders outside of Canada)

  • For $100, you will get a personal thank-you email AND your name on the book website as a supporter AND a digital review copy of the book (One week before official launch) AND I will sign THREE copies in your name (or whomever you please) and send them to you after it is published. UPDATE (November 13): I added this perk on November 13 because of multiple requests. So if you already paid $50 for a single signed copy before then, but you want to take advantage of this perk, just buy another $50 perk and send me a message. Then I will know to get you three copies.

               (Note: Please add $10 shipping for orders outside of Canada)

  • For $500, you will get a personal thank-you email AND your name on the book website as a supporter AND a digital review copy of the book (One week before official launch) AND I will sign a copy in your name and send it to you after it is published AND I will do a one-hour Personal Mentoring Call with you.

    Update (December 1): I have decided to enhance the $500 perk (A Personal Mentoring Call!) Because... why not? Here is what I am changing it to (note, I can't change the actual wording of the perk while the campaign is running, but it doesn't matter... below is what you will get anyway):
  • You will get a personal thank-you email AND your name on the book website as a supporter AND a digital review copy of the book (One week before official launch) AND I will sign a copy in your name and send it to you after it is published. Just like that. PLUS: I will do an open-ended Personal Mentoring Call with you! PLUS: I will give you a follow-up call a week or two or three later to check-in and debrief since the first call.

    And yes, that includes those of you who already selected and paid for this perk!
  • For $5,000, you will get a personal thank-you email AND your name on the book website as a supporter AND a digital review copy of the book (One week before official launch) AND I will sign a copy in your name and send it to you after it is published AND I will do a one-hour Personal Mentoring Call with you AND you are invited to spend a week with me wherever I happen to be in the world (My beloved Casa Amorata perhaps? Or your city? Or a Trans-Siberan train journey? Or Ipanema beach? You pay your own expenses, of course, but why not? Think adventure! Nothing else is worth the having!)
  • For $15,000, you will get a personal thank-you email AND your name on the book website as a supporter AND a digital review copy of the book (One week before official launch) AND I will sign a copy in your name and send it to you after it is published AND I will do a one-hour Personal Mentoring Call with you AND you are invited to spend a week with me wherever I happen to be in the world (My beloved Casa Amorata perhaps? Or your city? Or a Trans-Siberan train journey? Or Ipanema beach? You pay your own expenses, of course, but why not? Think adventure! Nothing else is worth the having!) AND a full year of personal mentoring! Unlimited access to me through Skype, email, and an open invitation to any events I personally do!

_____________________________________________________________________________

Other Ways You Can Help

For those of you who'd like to contribute but are unable to do so financially, that's okay. Here's how you can help... and yes, will it really help!

Get the word out and make some noise about this campaign. Let your Facebook friends know about this and give them the link.

And that’s all there is to it.


Finally, I just want to thank you again for your help! 

Zan Perrion

story:
THE DISPLACED PRINCESS

When I grew up I wanted to be a princess and live in a beautiful castle. wear gorgeous gowns, have perfect children and a loving and loyal prince and live happily ever after.....

When I woke up from that dream I was in a troubled marriage, I no longer knew who I was and didn't recognize the once happy, free spirited and fun woman who seemingly existed in another life.

I did, however have three great kids and in my mind and heart I felt it was a better choice to keep the family together. I thought I had the wherewithal to tolerate an unhealthy marriage for the sake of my kids. I wanted the fairytale and lie of a perfect life for my two sons and daughter.

In 2009 I could not take the infidelity anymore. I filed for divorce and never looked back. I had no plan in place and that would prove to be a huge mistake. One of many I made along the way.

This is not a man bashing story about my marriage. It is my personal story of the living hell I went through, with very little and sometimes no financial support, losing my home to foreclosure and having no where to go. 

One day I am in my beautiful home and the next I am in hotel wondering where my son and I will live. In the past five years I have had nightmare after nightmare thrown my way. I have been kicked to the curb more times than I care to remember. And somehow I have managed to get up and keep going forward....

This tale is not all doom and gloom. I will share my first "single girl" summer of fun after being married for twenty plus years. I will include my online dating experience, dates from hell, my relationship with a twenty something guy and all the things I was sheltered from as a married woman. And so much more.....

After I started my blog, www.displacedprincess.wordpress.com I was blown away by the letters and responses I received from not only other single mothers as well as adult children who had been raised my a single mom. Most of the kids had great admiration for their mothers.

I hope you will join me on my journey as I freely share my tale and give hope and inspiration to others who find themselves alone, scared and not knowing what to do next. This is a story of an ordinary mom who had her life turned upside down and how she got back up, chose to do it by herself and what she discovered on the way back to her life.....

(PLEASE CHECK OUT MY OTHER VIDEO IN THE GALLERY)

Here is how you can help make my dream come true...

The reason I am asking for funding for my book project is because there is no way I can make this possible on my own. I need to make it clear I am still very much in the struggling phase of life. I am raising my son entirely alone and he has supported and believed in me entirely even though he himself has made sacrifices to make my dream come true. Here is what the funding will cover;

  • Most all the money will go to a self-publishing package. This package is best suited for my book because the package offers most everything needed from start to finish. The company is reputable and is owned by a traditional publishing house.
  • The displacedprincess.com website needs to be updated and properly coded for sales of the book. For this I need a professional web designer.
  • Marketing the book once published. This is a must in self publishing. 
  • It is my hope to raise all the funds required to publish my book. If I am unable to do so everything I receive from the campaign will go towards the publishing costs and I will honor all perks promised to those that were kind enough to donate.  
  • You don't need a Paypal account to donate to my campaign           

In my heart I know that my book, The Displaced Princess will express the feelings and struggles of other single moms in many different ways.

  • My story will truly support and give some peace to all the wonderful and courageous single moms in the world.
  • Through my blog I quickly learned how single moms, children of single moms, siblings and friends of these special women are yearning for a connection and to be understood.
  • I've taken my pain, heartbreak and fear to help other single mothers feel appreciated, valuable and loved. I truly didn't know in the beginning that I would be able to help others by simply sharing my story.

Would you consider sharing my campaign and story with others?

  • I am truly grateful that you took the time to read my campaign. Can you help me by getting the word out? You have no idea how valuable that will be in getting my story told.
  • Reading and sharing my blog www.displacedprincess.wordpress.com will be a huge help as well.
  • And by sending people to my website www.displacedprincess.com in hopes they too will share their stories and possibly be in the book.
  • Indiegogo has lots of amazing share tools! Will you consider sharing my campaign and spreading the word so displaced princess can come alive?

story:
We are five misfit poets that somehow got put together on a poetry team and are trying to get to Saskatoon to represent Urban Legends in the Canadian Festival of Spoken Word (CFSW)! Who are you helping you ask? Here's the team:

Khaleefa (Apollo the Child) - liberator of boots and spoiler alert... he's actually 25
Aly (Infinite Mind) - style coordinator and sensuous sassafras 
Panos (Playto) - the wise old fart who once ate a piece of chalk for science!
Devin (Dali) - the 12 year old snorting comedian who is actually 14
Kt (Girly Boy) - high school freshman who gets excited over new calculators 

Together, we are working hard to put together works of poetry never seen at CFSW and give it a truly Ottawan  poetry experience but we need your help. We're looking to raise $1000 to at least pay for our accommodations for a week-long festival in Saskatoon; any bonus money will go to our airfare and food money because if you've ever flown to Saskatoon (or any Canadian city for the matter), that $hit is expensive!

We understand not everyone can contribute to our cause and honestly, we're just thankful you stopped by. If you could pass on the message, you've put us one step closer to our goal so thank you.

THANKS EVERYBODY!!

En el 2013 iniciamos una campaña para recoger los fondos necesarios destinados al proceso de regularización urbanística del Monasterio Zen Luz Serena.

Durante 2013-2014, gracias a la generosidad de muchos, recibimos la cantidad de 36.769,12 €.

Hasta el día de hoy, hemos usado estas donaciones de la siguiente forma:

  • Informe urbanístico del conjunto religioso Luz Serena  6.000,00 €
  • Informe Impacto Paisajístico  1.280,00 €
  • Honorarios arquitecto proyecto legalización de edificaciones  15.128,73 €
  • PPIF, Informe Hidrogeológico, Proyecto depuradora  2.850,00 €
  • Análisis  Agua depuradora  82,28 €
  • Instalación para aguas residuales (primera fase)_  1.344,31 €

Total empleado   26.685,32 €

Disponible:   10.083,80 €

Ahora nos vemos confrontados con los tres últimos requisitos que nos exige la ley:

  • Tasas de legalización para el Ayuntamiento de Requena  8.000,00 €
  • Plan de Prevención de Incendios   5.000,00 €
  • Instalación para aguas residuales (segunda fase)   6.782,05 €

Total gastos pendientes:  19.782,05 €

Dado que aún nos queda un remanente de 10.083,80 €, necesitamos la cantidad de 9.698,25 € para completar el proceso.

En estos momentos, el Monasterio Luz Serena no puede hacer frente a este gasto extra. Por eso, te pedimos, de nuevo, que nos ayudes a finalizar lo que comenzamos en el 2013.

El Monasterio Zen Luz Serena está desarrollando una importante labor de guía espiritual para cientos de personas desde su fundación, hace 26 años. Desde entonces y hasta ahora, ha podido realizar su labor gracias a las donaciones de las personas que se han beneficiado de su existencia y de muchas otras personas que, sin ni siquiera conocer el zen, consideran que un lugar de irradiación espiritual como este merece ser sostenido.

Por eso apelamos de nuevo a tu generosidad. La donación más adecuada para ti será aquella que te deje una sonrisa en el corazón.

Para realizar una donación, puede hacerlo a través de esta página web, a través de la cuenta de paypal del monasterio http://sotozen.es/hacer-una-donacion o realizando una transferencia a nuestro número de cuenta.

Si quieres colaborar con la campaña realizando una transferencia, hazlo a nombre de la Comunidad Budista Soto Zen

Entidad: Triodos Bank ES52 1491 0001 2510 0872 9327

Muchas gracias a todos/as.


Monasterio Zen Luz Serena

Comunidad Budista Soto Zen

story:
Short Summary

  • Why is it that you get a smile and a personal welcome when picking up a cup of coffee and you get coffee in a plastic cup when you buy a $250,000 car?
  • Why is TripAdvisor so successful ? Why are people venting their opinions on everything wrong in a hotel?
  • And why is the CHO* more important than the CEO?

In "What companies can learn from butlers" Vincent Vermeulen bundles his experience of founding his own butlerschool.

While training butlers and companies he discovered that any company can profit from the techniques he developed over the years.

WAIT! Not only companies can benefit from this book. You as well ! You will learn powerful techniques butlers use everyday to apply in your personal life and boost your self-confidence.


What We Need & What You Get

To be able to publish the book we are looking for funding:

  • The target amount will give us the opportunity to develop beautifully crafted books in print.
  • You can get your hands on the book one week prior to the actual launch.
  • Some of the perks are really amazing. How about a private training at your company or having a private butler for the weekend in your house?
  • Should we not hit our target, the book will still be published in ebook format.


The Impact

We have tons of stories of people coming to us wanting to be trained as a butler. Shortly after the training they start working all over the world. 

  • Someone working in the media for years, all of sudden is working for a wealthy family in the most stunning houses in the world. And we want more stories like this.
  • Big brands were be able to install a new mindset for their employees
  • A 20 year old applying these techniques is now making over $4000 in personal income per month doing what she loves
  • A lady thinking her career was over at 53 is providing top level service in Switzerland
These are only some of the stories you will read in the book and hopefully the book will write your story as well.


Risks & Challenges

The funding will not only allow us to publish the book but also to partner with research institutes to make the book even better. Integrating studies of behavioral science together with renowned universities is only one benefit should we hit our target.

In any case, with or without funding, this will become a landmark book in business writing. So join us!


Index of the book

Here is a sneak preview of the index of the book (work in progress)

Introduction

Chapter 1: how it came about

Chapter 2: how butlers look at companies

Chapter 3: CEO, move over!Here’s the CHO

Chapter 4: butler techniques every business should apply

Technique 1: eye for you

Technique 2: Separate and improve

Technique 3: The Gladiator mindset

Technique 4: Be organized

Technique 5: Manners are back

Technique 6: Words are forever

Technique 7: Service, where no man has gone before

ABOUT ME:

My name is Sienna Sinclaire and I'm a model, sex/dating coach, author and Naughty Lifestyle Expert (in all things naughty!). You can learn more about my websites here:

 www.NaughtyLifestyleExpert.com 

www.FollowSiennaSinclaire.com


ABOUT THE BOOK:

"Naughty Girl's Guide to Las Vegas" is a naughty travel guide to the city. It's part travel, history and coffee table book. 

"Your Naughty Travel Guide to Las Vegas is here! How many times have you traveled to a city and wondered where to go for the sexiest bars, clubs and restaurants? Where to attend the best swinger parties? How to find a fetish hotel that caters to your kinks? This is not your average travel book on Las Vegas, this is your naughty guide to the city. The book, written by sex coach and adult entertainer Sienna Sinclaire, is a gorgeous mix of travel information, sexy photos and naughty historical tidbits of Sin City's not so innocent past and present. It truly comes off as a naughty Frommer’s travel guide, complete with listings for individuals to research on their own before planning out their trip. Get your copy today and learn all about Vegas' naughty side. 

Whether you live in Las Vegas or you're traveling solo, with your girlfriends or with your lover this book is an indispensable guide in the quest to discover the sexy side of Vegas. Plus this book lets you determine how naughty you want to get. Maybe you want some clean, sexy fun with your lover at a strip club where the girls keep their clothes on? Or maybe you want to get as naughty as you can with some fetish play by hiring a Mistress for you and your lover? That's up to you to decide and this book will show you how. 

It's the perfect coffee table book and gift for those who love history, photography and traveling but are looking for something a little naughty! It’s not just “naughtiness” that you’re exploring but a celebration of local figures, businesses, history, products and food."

 

This will be my second book in my naughty series, my first book was "Naughty Girl's Guide to Los Angeles." I funded and self-published the book all on my own but need to raise money for this book to keep the series going. 

I've had a huge success from my LA book with tons of radio and TV. I was even featured on a reality show for the upcoming Vegas book, hoping to promote it for when it comes out. 

The Los Angeles book won TWO awards for "Best Travel Guide" in 2013.

I want to turn this into a successful series of naughty travel guides, so that travelers have something different to experience in cities than your normal touristy stuff.

The Vegas book will be over 300 pages of naughty things to do in Las Vegas that I've personally researched on my own. It took me 2 years to research and write the book. 

You can learn more about my current book and upcoming Vegas book by visiting my website so you see what it's all about at www.NaughtyTravelGuide.com



WHAT THE MONEY WILL BE USED FOR:

The book is completely finished! Now the book just needs to be designed, edited and printed along with marketing. This is what I will be using the money for as it's not cheap to print a full color travel guide. 

The book is very well designed. I don't have sample pages of the Vegas book yet but you can view sample pages of the LA book below and more here http://www.thenaughtygirlsguide.com/user/naught... 




    RISKS & CHALLENGES:

    This will be my second book so I'm completely aware that things take time with design, editing and printing. Right now the book is ready to head to the designers, then editor and finally off to the printers. I already know the time schedules of designing, editing and printing a book. So right now I'm looking for it to come out October/November 2014. It could come out earlier or later. But if it does come out later then I will personally contact anyone with the delays.


      OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP:

      I completely understand that some people won't be able to contribute, financially. But that still doesn't mean you can't help out. There are many ways you can help out by spreading the word about my book. 

      • Share this link on your social networking sites.
      • Share my books website.
      • If you have a blog, post it on your blog.
      • Email friends and family about my upcoming book.


      Thanks for all your support and help! I really appreciate it!

      xoxo Sienna Sinclaire

The book, written by sex coach and adult entertainer Sienna Sinclaire, is a gorgeous mix of travel information, sexy photos and naughty historical tidbits of Sin City's not so innocent past and present. It truly comes off as a naughty Frommer’s travel guide, complete with listings for individuals to research on their own before planning out their trip. Get your copy today and learn all about Vegas' naughty side. Whether you live in Las Vegas or you're traveling solo, with your girlfriends or with your lover this book is an indispensable guide in the quest to discover the sexy side of Vegas. Plus this book lets you determine how naughty you want to get. Maybe you want some clean, sexy fun with your lover at a strip club where the girls keep their clothes on? Or maybe you want to get as naughty as you can with some fetish play by hiring a Mistress for you and your lover? That's up to you to decide and this book will show you how. It's the perfect coffee table book and gift for those who love history, photography and traveling but are looking for something a little naughty! It’s not just “naughtiness” that you’re exploring but a celebration of local figures, businesses, history, products and food."
 
This will be my second book in my naughty series, my first book was "Naughty Girl's Guide to Los Angeles." I funded and self-published the book all on my own but need to raise money for this book to keep the series going. 
I've had a huge success from my LA book with tons of radio and TV. I was even featured on a reality show for the upcoming Vegas book, hoping to promote it for when it comes out. 
The Los Angeles book won TWO awards for "Best Travel Guide" in 2013.
I want to turn this into a successful series of naughty travel guides, so that travelers have something different to experience in cities than your normal touristy stuff.
The Vegas book will be over 300 pages of naughty things to do in Las Vegas that I've personally researched on my own. It took me 2 years to research and write the book. 
You can learn more about my current book and upcoming Vegas book by visiting my website so you see what it's all about at www.NaughtyTravelGuide.com





WHAT THE MONEY WILL BE USED FOR:
The book is completely finished! Now the book just needs to be designed, edited and printed along with marketing. This is what I will be using the money for as it's not cheap to print a full color travel guide. 
The book is very well designed. I don't have sample pages of the Vegas book yet but you can view sample pages of the LA book below and more here http://www.thenaughtygirlsguide.com/user/naught...

 This will be my second book so I'm completely aware that things take time with design, editing and printing. Right now the book is ready to head to the designers, then editor and finally off to the printers. I already know the time schedules of designing, editing and printing a book. So right now I'm looking for it to come out October/November 2014. It could come out earlier or later. But if it does come out later then I will personally contact anyone with the delays.

Share this link on your social networking sites. Share my books website.
If you have a blog, post it on your blog.
Email friends and family about my upcoming book.

story:
I Love "Weirdo Music"

That's how a friend once described the stuff I listen to: basically, music that is dark, intense, and/or transgressive in some way. Over the years I have supported music - and especially independent artists - in every way possible, from working in a music store to attending shows; booking shows; coordinating promotional campaigns; press releases; and music journalism (conducting interviews, writing music reviews, etc.) - because I want these artists to continue making music. 

For a fan of contemporary industrial music, the acts on the bill for the SE:UK Industrial Alliance festival in London are too good to miss. To have them all performing on the same event, under the same roof, may never happen this way again. I want to be there to document the event, as a music journalist and photographer. 

This may not seem like a big deal to many of you, but for me this will be like attending Woodstock. Getting there is an adventure that I hope to achieve with the help of friends, family and music fans who appreciate and/or share my passion. 

Here's the Bottom Line

$1000 is needed for airfare. It's essentially a weekend trip, during which time I intend to cover the festival for my blog, factoryworkermedia.com. 
One of the blog's main goals is to acknowledge that today's music is as important and noteworthy as anything that came before, and worthy of serious consideration and analysis. That kind of writing doesn't happen as often as it could, but I do my best to contribute to the perpetuation of meaningful discourse.
As I mention in the pitch video, perks are essentially negotiable - maybe I can get you into a show, maybe you want a copy of the audio from one of my past interviews (the Emilie Autumn one is a personal favourite) - tell me what it was that prompted you to support the campaign, and let's see if we can't think of something personalized just for you. 
Failing that, there's the default "Postcards From the Edge" perk. (Go on, admit it - you all love getting snail mail.) :)

The Impact

Usually I can manage travel costs myself, but earlier this fall I invested in a DSLR camera for my concert photography (of course that will pay for itself several times over in the long run - including this trip) and the timing of that acquisition sacrificed a significant portion of my travel fund. It's unlikely that a North American festival could book all of these European acts together on a single event any time soon, so your support will help to ensure that these talented independent artists get the recognition they deserve and, with a little luck, eventually they will be able to tour here, too.

Personally I think audio interviews are the most fun, so here's a link to my archive on Soundcloud: https://soundcloud.com/factory-worker-music-co/sets This is a noteworthy example of the interest that exists for the various types of music I try to cover on my blog; e.g. the interview with Dave Brockie of GWAR has over 4000 hits to date.

Risks & Challenges

The usual work/travel challenges apply: jet lag, communication (do the tube stations still have free wi-fi?), local travel logistics (hence the concern about wi-fi), sufficient battery power and data storage, etc. I always bring a backup audio recorder and digital camera, and this won't be my first trip to London, so the biggest hurdle is just the usual crippling exchange rate. I'll eat a big meal before my flight. :)

***REVISED (previously under "The Bottom Line"): If funds fall short of the target, as much as I would like to go to London anyway, the sensible alternative is to save the collected funds for my next music adventure/working vacation - the 2015 Maryland Deathfest, which has scheduled one of the best curations of metal bands anyone could imagine. 

Other Ways You Can Help

During a crowdfunding campaign people always ask their supporters to share the project link and build awareness around it - so please, do that! - but, as a writer,  what I would REALLY appreciate is your feedback on the articles and/or interviews that will come out of this trip. 

Thank you for your support!

story:
Summary:
Please help me accomplish a different kind of “vision quest”.  I seek your help to go on a journey – a journey to learn the roots of a healthy, healing and sustainable civilization. 

Our transformation from a dysfunctional, unsustainable and spiritually empty society means a return to sacred civilization.  This is beyond “religion”. It is a return to the ways and values of honoring Earth, Life and Spirit.  My intention is to learn how to do this, and bring that learning back for all of us to share.

Description:

Most Westerners go on “vision quest” to discover themselves, or to work out some personal challenge.  Mine is different.  I am questing to discover the sacred roots of human civilization, and to find the path of return to a society that places Earth, Spirit and Life over the values of greed and selfishness.

This Summer, I am walking the path of sacred civilization, to the ancient Kingdom of Ladakh, in what is now Northern India, Northern Pakistan and Southern China.

This journey is to answer a Call. My eyes and Heart will be open for the Source.

I have been active in the field of “Societal Transformation” for over five decades, working to create an inclusive world that works for all beings.  My work has taken me to 38 countries, and to over 100 distinct cultures, on every continent with people on it. 

But – I’ve always explored current, living cultures.  Now, I intend to use the past to help guide all of us to a viable future.  Your support will help all of us transform our world by rediscovering our roots.  I strongly believe that the way OUT of our current Mess will come from looking INTO the roots of sacred civilizations.

By “roots”, I don’t mean the Euro-centric and Spirit-depleted histories that we were taught in school.  My search will be well outside those “boxes” that confine our Spiritual and imaginal mental landscapes.

Although I use the word “sacred” I am NOT talking about “religion”.  Our ancient roots connected us to each other, to the Earth, to Life and to the Spirit.  Religions tend to do the opposite. (I am not against religion.  It is fine in its place – which is not running a society.)

Around the world, we find evidence that humans have lived (and many are still living), in sacred civilization.  We refer to “native” or “indigenous” people as those who practice ways of life that evidence a deep respect for Earth, all beings (and Life Itself) and Spirit.  The “indigenous” people hold to Transcendental ways of knowing, predicated on concepts and a world-view that has been transported over thousands of miles and thousands of years.

Or… from no time and no distance. 

We see that “indigenous” people living in “sacred civilization” have a deep, mystical bond with All.  But, we rarely ask the question: “Where did they get it from?”  And, “Why are these sacred societies so similar in their cosmologies/ understandings about the Universe?  Where did they learn how to live in harmony with the Earth and each other?”  

There is evidence that the deep reverence for Earth, Spirit and Life originated in Central Asian shamans/ Spirit workers.  There is evidence that they spread this knowledge into North and South America and Europe.  There is evidence that the roots of Western civilization come from these same shamans of Central Asia.  However, rather than rely on this evidence, I intend to go to the source.

A Spiritual Journey – Not an Academic One…
This is not an academic journey.  I am not traveling to support or refute some premise.  This is not (just) a “writing” assignment.  [I use the “writing” category simply because Indiegogo has no category for “social transformation” or “sacred journey”, or anything else like this campaign].

What I Need:

I will use the funds you give for the journey/ societal vision quest to the ancient civilization of Ladakh.  Specifically, funds will be used for  plane tickets, travel equipment, places to stay, hiring local guides, journey expenses to sacred sites, visas, travel insurance, cross-border expenses, recording equipment…

Any funds over my request will be used to fund a conference upon my return (slated for Fall, 2013).  “Societal Transformation and Sacred Civilization” will chronicle the journey, and will explore how we can incorporate the values and tools of sacred civilizations into our presently dysfunctional society. [I will use some additional funds to enhance the journey by obtaining more optimal travel arrangements, and by adding more locations, including possibly Nepal and Tibet.]

The Impact:
 Funders get the satisfaction of knowing that they are active participants in the next big step in the transformation of our society.  With your contribution, you will become an active, positive and inclusive agent for the transformation of our society!  A little goes a long way: a little more even longer.

If Short of Goal:

Less than full funding will mean a scaled back journey.  Significantly below the funding request may mean scaling back on the ambitions for the journey itself.  [This may mean less than optimal travel arrangements (time and routes). Not having guides, translators, or appropriate ground transportation will limit what I will be able to discover, and paradoxically, make the journey more expensive.]

In a way, this journey is like a referendum on the state of our current civilization.  You “vote” of $100, or even $10, will send a message to all of us – that you recognize our present society is dysfunctional, and that you support the idea of bringing inclusivity and sacredness back to our human societies.  Thanks!

Other Ways You Can Help:

First: Please know that even $5 or $10 is significant in the world of crowd-funding.  Don’t feel self-conscious because you don’t have hundreds to donate. (And, don’t feel self-conscious if you do!  Give with gusto!)  Any and all of your dollars will contribute to the “buzz” around this project.

Second:  Please spread the word!   It’s through people like you telling their friends and associates that word of this journey will spread to others.  Please put this link into your church’s weekly bulletin (or mosque, temple, kovil…).  Talk about the “vision quest” with friends, family and co-workers.  Show your support. 

 Third:  Do you know of any shamans or spiritually-minded people in Ladakh?  Trustworthy drivers or good places to stay in Leh?  I already have contacts there, but your personal knowledge and experience can help make this quest a success! [Please... no advertisements for services.  They will be ignored.]

Fourth:  Please hold the meta-vision of “a world that works for all”.  For the sake of our planet and for the sake of our humanity, we need a meta-vision that is larger than our individual selves and longer than our life span.  We need a human society based on sacredness.

Peace,

 

Sharif 

PS:  I have been learning how to “ask” without self-consciousness, to ask of the Divine, from the Divine.  Thank you for reading this, and thank you for the opportunity to practice asking!
