story:
Summary

Be part of the world peace tipping point and celebrate the 10th anniversary of Dr. Will Tuttle's groundbreaking book The World Peace Diet by backing our next decade's efforts of self-publishing media:  two World Peace Diet companion books--World Peace Diet Cookbook by Culinary Olympic award-winning Chef Mark Stroud and World Peace Yoga book by nationally known yogini, and founder of World Peace Yoga Anna Ferguson. Our second decade also includes realizing our dream of nationally launching a World Peace Diet Cuisine line of organic, gluten-free, sugar-free vegan food products. How many times has Dr. Will Tuttle been asked after creating this practical tool, The World Peace Diet, “what do I eat on this diet?” And our answer is, “you have read the book, now eat the food." To achieve this, funds raised in this campaign will also support the World Peace Diet Cuisine food line's development. This incorporates a commissary food-manufacturing kitchen — the Peace House Grille dining area — for test marketing food products for a national reach while providing Cincinnati local sustainable vegan eating. On top of this, assistance with these projects will indirectly make expansion of the Jubilee Animal Sanctuary possible, as it will be funded through their financial prosperity.

      

      

In this third trimester of our campaign, we focus on what these tools – cookbook, yoga book, and food products - mean to you and us in the creation of a sustainable economic environment for our various projects.  By generating additional income from these economic engines, we are able to make our Jubilee Peace Fest festival ticket price much lower and accessible to all income levels for people seeking a life-changing spiritual experience.  And very dear to our hearts, this revenue gives us the means to sustain and expand our Jubilee Animal Sanctuary. Even after our recent move, the horses require more land to graze and exercise, more land to grow hay, and better indoor living conditions. With more land and a new barn, Maitreya and Arjuna will then be able to welcome new fellow animal (people) friends, such as cows, pigs, chickens, sheep, goats, and ducks.  Our intention is to ultimately create a self-sustaining sanctuary from self-generating income. With this model, we would ideally only require outside assistance such as crowdfunding for larger one-time principal improvements. This is our immediate and long-term sustainable economic plan and we ask you today to be part of this ongoing mission.

  

Our two new books and our food product line will enable our current global outreach to deepen and further our vision of creating world peace one lifestyle change at a time. They also serve our mission of, educating, encouraging, researching and promoting a loving lifestyle to create virtuous, kind, gentle, and respectful relationships among all beings and the Earth, and contributing to peace throughout the world.


A Little History

Since 2005, the first World Peace Diet study group is still going strong in this 10th year anniversary meeting twice monthly in Cincinnati and sharing stimulating conversations and delicious vegan eats. In the last ten years, we have served up spiritual and educational food in different formats, such as classes, workshops, teacher trainings, and festivals to thousands of people. Our Center creates spiritual opportunities for under-served populations, such as the Deaf community, inner city kids, and the homeless.


Our Global World Peace Diet Center sponsors the Jubilee Peace Fest, a life-changing jubilation of yoga, music, and food, a spiritual festival that has just celebrated its fifth year anniversary. The festival includes the World Peace Diet Facilitator Training as an ongoing part of the event. One of our World Peace Diet Facilitator graduates recently directed and premiered the ground-breaking film Cowspiracy. The festival brings in many awe inspiring yogis, activists, foodies, and musicians, such as, Sharon Gannon, Chloe Jo Davis, Julia Butterfly Hill, Victoria Moran, Sticman of Dead Prez, HuDost, and many others.

  

(From left, Anna Ferguson, Mark Stroud, Will Tuttle, Madeleine Tuttle.)

Chef Mark Stroud is a Culinary Olympic award-winning vegan chef, yoga (meditation & philosophy) teacher who conducts classes, workshops, and has run multiple nationally recognized restaurants. Anna Ferguson’s knowledge of yoga and her ahimsic (nonviolent) style of teaching derived from years of study and practice with Doug Swenson and Julie Kirkpatrick, Sharon Gannon, and David Life of Jivamukti Yoga.

We are building on the work of Dr. Will Tuttle, author of the #1 Amazon best-seller, The World Peace Diet, now translated into over 15 languages. A former Zen monk with a Ph.D. in education from U.C., Berkeley, Dr. Tuttle has worked extensively in intuition development, spiritual healing, meditation, music, creativity, vegan living, and cultural evolution. He and his wife Madeleine — a visionary artist whose work has been exhibited throughout North America and Europe—travel together to educate and share the ideas in The World Peace Diet.

Look to the right of the page to check out the amazing sexy powerful purposeful peace-filled perks you receive for contributing!

 

PERK Your Interest to Reach Our Goal

Our goal set for this campaign is $72,000, with a stretch goal of an additional $72,000, for a total of $144,000. Your contributions are to be used in the following manner:

$45,000 pays for completing our World Peace Diet Cookbook and World Peace Yoga book, including the shared expenses of editors, copywriters, layout designers, photographers, printing, distributing, e-book formatting, marketing and promoting the books. The more contributions we receive, the more books we are able print and more widely spread our peace-filled message.

$27,000 pays for the costs involved with creating the first World Peace Diet Cuisine food line prototype, including market evaluation and research, product analysis, development of prototype: recipe creation, recipe testing ingredients, recipe testing time, recipe testers for market testing, food photographer, and packaging design, followed by national launch preparation and further marketing and promotion. In addition, we are now able to hire the necessary architectural, engineering, and design firms to bring forward our commissary test kitchen to early stages of construction. 

The first $72,000 is for self-publishing our World Peace Diet Cookbook and World Peace Yoga book, and creating our first prototype of a World Peace Diet Cuisine food line. 

Ideally this campaign stretches to $144,000, raising an additional $72,000 in contributions allowing us to pay for the expansion of our building. This includes construction costs so that our Global World Peace Diet Center’s footprint increases by 600 square feet and is LEED Platinum Certified using green and sustainable building materials, energy star food preparation equipment, and earth friendly systems, such as solar and permaculture for our commissary kitchen and additional spiritual practice space that is handicap accessible. 


(Commissary kitchen + additional spiritual practice space design)

The Impact

By reaching our goal to publish and produce these products and services, together we are more deeply and widely spreading the message of kindness and compassion articulated by The World Peace Diet in very practical and useful everyday ways of living. It is by increasing, improving, and promoting more “all” vegan “compassionate” products, services, and programs, that, this message becomes the change. This is a call, a clarion call, for more vegan businesses, more vegan programs, services, institutions--you name it, on every street corner, a vegan world. This is a huge task, and, together, we are up to it!

It is our belief that it is the vegans, yogis, and other compassionate people of the world and their energy of kindness and gentleness who have kept this planet from completely imploding. Therefore, we are asking all vegans and animal lovers to step up and join with us and other vegan businesses and organizations to become an even greater force for peaceful change in the world. Get involved, collaborate with other like-minded souls with your time, talent, and money! Peace —real peace in our lifetime — is doable, now, today, not in some far off blurry future.

Please be part of this tipping point for change and celebrate with us this 10th year anniversary of The World Peace Diet and the potential for greater peace on this planet for this generation and the ones to come by contributing to this project.

Risks & Challenges

There are always inherent risks and challenges in self-publishing media and launching a food product. We have a great team of people working on these projects with a combined total of 144 amount of years of experience in their respected fields. The real risk for us is that NOT doing this work contributes to more pain and suffering in this world. 

Other Ways You May Assist

In addition to selecting a perk we'll love for you to...

1.  Please ask your family, friends, work associates, and others to back and spread the word about this campaign. Let's make some noise! Peace!

2.  Get involved with and start other similar world-changing projects.
story_txt:
Summary
 

Be part of the world peace tipping point and celebrate the 10th anniversary of Dr. Will Tuttle's groundbreaking book The World Peace Diet by backing our next decade's efforts of self-publishing media:  two World Peace Diet companion books--World Peace Diet Cookbook by Culinary Olympic award-winning Chef Mark Stroud and World Peace Yoga book by nationally known yogini, and founder of World Peace Yoga Anna Ferguson. Our second decade also includes realizing our dream of nationally launching a World Peace Diet Cuisine line of organic, gluten-free, sugar-free vegan food products. How many times has Dr. Will Tuttle been asked
after creating this practical tool, The World Peace Diet, “what do I eat on
this diet?” And our answer is, “you have
read the book, now eat the food." To achieve this, funds raised in this campaign will also support the World Peace Diet Cuisine food line's development. This incorporates a commissary food-manufacturing kitchen 
—
the Peace House Grille dining area — for test marketing food products for a national reach while providing Cincinnati local
sustainable vegan eating.  On top of this, assistance with these projects will indirectly make expansion of the Jubilee Animal Sanctuary possible, as it will be funded through their financial prosperity.
       
       
In this third trimester of our campaign, we focus on what these tools – cookbook, yoga book, and food products - mean to you and us in the creation of a sustainable economic environment for our various projects.  By generating additional income from these economic engines, we are able to make our Jubilee Peace Fest festival ticket price much lower and accessible to all income levels for people seeking a life-changing spiritual experience.  And very dear to our hearts, this revenue gives us the means to sustain and expand our Jubilee Animal Sanctuary. Even after our recent move, the horses require more land to graze and exercise, more land to grow hay, and better indoor living conditions. With more land and a new barn, Maitreya and Arjuna will then be able to welcome new fellow animal (people) friends, such as cows, pigs, chickens, sheep, goats, and ducks.  Our intention is to ultimately create a self-sustaining sanctuary from self-generating income. With this model, we would ideally only require outside assistance such as crowdfunding for larger one-time principal improvements. This is our immediate and long-term sustainable economic plan and we ask you today to be part of this ongoing mission.
   
Our two new books and our food product line will enable our current global outreach to deepen and further our
 vision of creating world peace one lifestyle change at a time. They 
also serve our 
mission of, educating, encouraging, researching and promoting a 
loving lifestyle to create virtuous, kind, gentle, and respectful 
relationships among all beings and the Earth, and contributing to peace throughout the world.





A Little History
Since 2005, the first World Peace Diet study
group is still going strong in this 10th year anniversary meeting
twice monthly in Cincinnati and sharing stimulating
conversations and delicious vegan eats. In the last ten years, we have served up spiritual and educational food in different formats, such as classes, workshops, teacher
trainings, and festivals to thousands of people. Our Center creates spiritual opportunities
for under-served populations, such as the Deaf community, inner city kids, and the
homeless.  

Our Global World Peace Diet Center sponsors the Jubilee Peace Fest, a life-changing jubilation of yoga, music, and food, a spiritual festival that has just celebrated its fifth year anniversary. The festival includes the World Peace Diet Facilitator Training as an
ongoing part of the event. One of our World Peace Diet Facilitator graduates recently directed and premiered the ground-breaking film Cowspiracy. The festival brings in many awe inspiring yogis,
activists, foodies, and musicians, such as, Sharon Gannon, Chloe Jo Davis,
Julia Butterfly Hill, Victoria Moran,
Sticman of Dead Prez, HuDost, and many others. 
   
(From left, Anna Ferguson, Mark Stroud, Will Tuttle, Madeleine Tuttle.)
Chef Mark Stroud is a Culinary
Olympic award-winning vegan chef, yoga (meditation & philosophy) teacher who conducts
classes, workshops, and has run multiple nationally recognized restaurants. Anna Ferguson’s knowledge of yoga and her ahimsic
(nonviolent) style of teaching derived from years of study and practice with
Doug Swenson and Julie Kirkpatrick, Sharon Gannon, and David Life of Jivamukti
Yoga. We are building on the work of Dr. Will Tuttle, author of the #1 Amazon best-seller, The World Peace Diet, now translated into over 15 languages. A former Zen monk with a
Ph.D. in education from U.C., Berkeley, Dr. Tuttle has worked extensively in intuition
development, spiritual healing, meditation, music, creativity, vegan living,
and cultural evolution. He and his wife Madeleine 
— a visionary artist whose work has been exhibited throughout North America and Europe—travel
together to educate and share the ideas in The World Peace Diet.
Look to the right of the page to check out the amazing sexy powerful purposeful peace-filled perks you receive for contributing!
   



PERK Your Interest to Reach Our Goal

Our goal set for this campaign is $72,000, with a stretch goal of an additional
$72,000, for a total of $144,000. Your contributions are to be used in the
following manner:
$45,000 pays for completing our World Peace Diet Cookbook and World Peace Yoga book, including the shared expenses of editors,
copywriters, layout designers, photographers, printing, distributing, e-book
formatting, marketing and promoting the books. The more contributions we
receive, the more books we are able print and more widely spread our
peace-filled message.$27,000  pays for the costs involved
with creating the first World Peace Diet Cuisine food line prototype, including market
evaluation and research, product analysis, development of prototype: recipe creation, recipe
testing ingredients, recipe testing time, recipe testers for market testing, food photographer,
and packaging design, followed by national launch preparation and further marketing and promotion. In addition, we are now able to hire the necessary architectural, engineering, and design firms to bring forward our commissary test kitchen to early stages of construction.  The first $72,000 is for self-publishing our World Peace Diet
Cookbook and World Peace Yoga book, and creating our first
prototype of a World Peace Diet Cuisine food line.  

Ideally this campaign stretches to $144,000, raising an additional $72,000 in
contributions allowing us to pay for the expansion of our building. This includes construction
costs so that our Global World Peace Diet Center’s footprint increases by 600
square feet and is LEED Platinum Certified using green and sustainable building
materials, energy star food preparation equipment, and earth friendly systems,
such as solar and permaculture for our commissary kitchen and additional
spiritual practice space that is handicap accessible.  


   
(Commissary kitchen + additional spiritual practice space design)




The Impact
By reaching our goal to publish and produce these products and
services, together we are more deeply and widely spreading the message of kindness and compassion articulated by The
World Peace Diet in very practical and useful everyday ways of living. It is
by increasing, improving, and promoting more “all” vegan “compassionate” products, services, and programs, that,
this message becomes the change. This is a call, a clarion call, for more vegan businesses,
more vegan programs, services, institutions--you name it, on every street
corner, a vegan world. This is a huge
task, and, together, we are up to it! 
It is our belief that it is the vegans, yogis, and other compassionate people of the world and their energy of
kindness and gentleness who have kept this planet from completely imploding.
Therefore, we are asking all vegans and animal lovers to step up and join with us
and other vegan businesses and organizations to become an even greater force
for peaceful change in the world. Get
involved, collaborate with other like-minded souls with your time, talent, and
money! Peace 
—real peace in our lifetime
— is doable, now, today, not in some far off blurry future. 
Please be part of this tipping point for change and celebrate with us this 10th year anniversary of The World Peace Diet and the potential
for greater peace on this planet for this generation and the ones to come by
contributing to this project.

  
  
Risks & Challenges 
 There are always inherent risks and challenges in self-publishing media and launching a food product. We have a great team of people working on these projects with a combined total of 144 amount of years of experience in their respected fields. The real risk for us is that NOT doing this work contributes to more pain and suffering in this world.  

  
Other Ways You May Assist
 In addition to selecting a perk we'll love for you to...
 1.  Please ask your family, friends, work associates, and others to back and spread the word about this campaign. Let's make some noise! Peace! 
2.  Get involved with and start other similar world-changing projects.

story:
The story of a spunky, creative 8 year old that lives with her grandmother.
This is the first book in a series which will explore the complexities and blessings of grandparents raising grandchildren but with a unique twist; written from the child's perspective.

Excerpt:

"Amira is an 8 year old little girl with lots of bouncy curls that twist and twirl. She has caramel colored skin and is just as sweet as can be; at least that’s what grandma says."

The book will serve two very important goals; first to provide a book where these special kind of families can see themselves within the pages in an entertaining whimsical way and two; to help the author, a grandmother raising her own 3 granddaughters, the ability to put aside some of the proceeds from the sales to help raise her granddaughters.

Excerpt:

Sometimes Amira asks about her birth mom; “Grandma why don’t I live with my mommy?”

Her grandma tells her “Your mommy was very sick and couldn’t take care of you but she loved you very much and that’s why she gave you to me, to make sure you were well taken care of and loved!”

This book and others in the series will fill a gap in children's literature.
Children being raised by grandparents often feel different than their peers, especially when it comes to the stories they read. Amira the Everyday Princess will afford them wonderful tales where the can relate and see themselves within the storyline. Grandparents also will appreciate having stories where their grandchildren feel a sense of belonging and understand that they too are a special kind of family.

Though the author is unpublished, this is her driving passion. Not only is she facing the everyday challenges of being a grandparent raising grandchildren, she is determined to build a support which will enable her to provide hope and stability for her own grandchildren as well as many many others. It's a New day!!

Funding will help with the illustration and publishing of the books, beginning with the first book in the series: Amira the Everyday Princess.

Currently we are contacting publishing houses, exploring self-publishing and researching the literary world for our best options. We hope to launch the series by the fall of 2015 with your support.

Please help by either contributing and/or by passing the word on to others who may be interested; especially those big time publishers!!!

"Tell them I am the real old woman who lived in a shoe, who had so many children she didn't know what to do, so she sat down on her tuffit and picked up a pen, along came a story she inspired to share."
